column1: Visualizer fails to launch with manual story threads
column29:
Brad Impact: 13

When the user clicks "Launch Informedb", the visualizer file downloads successfully, but when launching the file, an error box appears with "The scenario could not be found because the story thread does not exist..."

the visualizer does not render objects correctly (at all) in this state

Potential Fixes:
- (Big?) Make scenarios work with manual story threads
- *(Medium?) Fix launch and disable scenarios*
- (Small?) Fix launch and let scenarios crash
- (Small?) Disable launching manual story threads

Technical Details:
- Update getNodeIdentifiers to inform visualizer about thread type
- Track thread type state in visualizer
- Disable features for manual story threads
column79:

- User cannot save scenarios for manual threads.

column1: Visualizer: Aggregate dates from different objects in the timeline view

* Define ways to aggregating objects into a larger object in the timeline view.
 ** Manually specified (these two objects are really just 1)

column1: Manage Story threads: Use the same visualizer rules in a different story thread
column29:
As a data analyst, I want to be able to use the visualization rules I have created in another story thread in a new one, because the views should have a similar presentation style.

Our initial implementation made it easier to upload a project file back to a story thread. We took out the ability to download a story thread because we had planned to to provide a better way to do that in the website so users didn't have to juggle files. That feature got put on hold to decide when we had enough time remaining.

In order to cut a new version, we need some way for them to meet this need. Our options seem to be:
 * Separate the visualizer changes into a branch and release with the old code; deploy the new feature in the next version.
 * Re-add the "download project file" action to the visualizer
 * On the story thread or designer page, provide a way for them to download the project file in the website
 * On the story thread page, provide a way for them to copy the project file from another story thread (Alan strongly advocated for this)

One potential sticking point if they do not download the file is that they will still need some way to update the default, which is not attached to a story thread explicitly.

column110:
16/Jan/19 4:45 PM;MasonVines;Investigated and reproduced.

The issue of font size only occurs when you have windows scaling set to 125% AND the advanced feature for Windows to "help with blurry applications" or something like that.

 

The solution is to right click on jp2launcher.exe in the java bin directory.

Select the 'Compatibility' tab

Click 'Change high DPI settings'

Check 'Override high DPI scaling behavior'

Select 'System' from the drop down.

 

No current way to fix programmatically.

column1: Advanced Filter: Add multiple choice criteria (front end)
column29: Unicode normalization is not required yet.
column79:
- Multiple choice attributes are: single select, multi select, and tags.
- Operands: is, is not, is empty
- Multiple choice attributes are now selectable in the advanced filter property chooser.
- You can select an operand and can select 0 to many option values for that multiple choice field
- Option values are listed alphabetically
- The values that are listed as options are the union of values for multiple choice fields with that name within the chosen object types.
- Values differing only by case are distinct.
- Values that have trailing and leading whitespace are distinct.
- 'Is' is a logical 'or' between the selected options
- 'Is not' is the inversion of 'Is'
- Is empty passes objects which don't have a value (but have that field).

2. When adding or updating a multiple choice filter, the "Add Filter" is disabled when "Empty" is selected. The user has to select a data option to enable the "Add" or "Update" filter. 
3. If OTs are selected with the same attribute name for all 3 multiple choice types. The tag selections are not listed. This only occurs if a Tag, Multi Select, and Single Select share an attribute name. It works correctly if only two are selected.

column1: Filter page: Duplicate a filter
column29:
-Users are used to being able to copy a story thread. In the past, they have copied a story thread and used that as a basis for tinkering around to try out certain filter changes.

The need for this is partially mitigated by the fact that it doesn't automatically save as you make changes. However, since the selections may span various parts of the pages, recreating it is not necessarily trivial.
column79:
- On the basic filter page, there is some means to duplicate the current story thread.
- On the advanced filter page, there is some means to duplicate the current story thread.
- When duplicating, you are prompted for a name of the duplicate.
- The duplicate name is pre-populated with "$currentStoryThread Copy"
- The text of the duplicate name is highlighted so users can immediately type in a new name.
- Can accept or cancel
- Accept takes you to the newly created story thread.

column1: Advanced Filter: Add Number criteria
column29:
Money, Integer Decimal attributes.

Backend was original pointed as a 5 before it was folded in.

'Between' was descoped.

If the kendo field gives us a number, we may need to remove support for money abbreviations.

 

Descope 'empty' and 'not empty' - decimal's and money default to 0.0
column79:
- Number criteria: Money, Integer, Decimal
- Operands: <, <=, =, >=, >, !=, Between, empty, not empty
- <, <=, =, >=, >, != have 1 input fields
- If invalid number is entered, show a validation error (following design system)
- If second number is lower than first, show a validation error (following design system)
- Is Empty / Is Not empty disables text field input.
- Users can enter money abbreviations as values (e.g., $2M)
column107:
05/Nov/18 4:15 PM;RyanScranton;Issues: 
1. No validation message. The "Add/Update Filter" button is disabled/enabled appropriately when text that is not correct is entered, but there are no validation errors like there were in the mock up. 
2. When a filter is first created, the "Add Filter" button is enabled even if nothing is entered into the field. If the user clicks the button they will get an infinity loading spinner and a filter is created with a blank field. 
3. The numbers start getting weird after adding 16 characters. The tool does not allow a user to enter numbers with greater than 16 characters so we probably wont run into the issue. But after the user enters greater than 16 characters the numbers are zeroed out. (For example if I enter 111111111111111111 into the filter field, when I click add/update filter, the number is shown as 111111111111111100)
column108:
06/Nov/18 10:28 AM;JohnSieck;Testing in IE, here is are discrepancies found between the mockup and the implementation:

0) when first opening the criteria dialog, the "Apply filter" button ought to be disabled until user types value into text field.

1) There is no space between the first and second row of criteria (Equal, Not equal, etc.) in the Add filter dialog.  There ought to be 8px of space between the options.

2) The number text field ought to match the width of the Apply filter button. Sometimes it did?  I refreshed and it appears correct now but...???

3) padding around the edge of the dialog is 16px.  It ought to be 20px.

4) There ought to be 16px of space above and below the line separating the criteria (Equal, Not equal, etc.).

5) the line separating the AttributeCaption from the criteria is missing.

6) criterion button height ought to be 28px and there ought to be 8 pixels between the button text and the sides of the button (padding left and right)

7) "Enter desired number" prompt inside the text field ought to be #a6a6a6 (blank state)

8) Border color of text field in rest state ought to be #a6a6a6.  It appears to be getting at least partially overridden by something.

9) I know we are not including error text as part of the MVP (sadness) but can we make the border of the text field red when an invalid value is entered (i.e. a letter or punctuation)? Currently, it disables the Apply filter button.  That's good as we don't want them submitting bad data but some visual indication of an error state would be good.
column109:
06/Nov/18 7:14 PM;RyanScranton;UI Issues: 
1. The text field for the number being entered should be the width of the "Add/Update Filter" button

3. This may just be me, but it appears as if the selection criteria are not vertically aligned within that section. It appears that there is more of a buffer below the selected than above.

column1: Advanced Filter: Search results don't come back from memo fields
column29:
Tested on latest, CEC 09282017. Joseph independently confirmed on LAV_TEST_01.

 

I retested including filter criteria that includes memos. No criteria with memo fields come back correctly.

 

This manifests as an infinite loading spinner. Analyzing network traffic shows a 500 error.

 

To reproduce:
 * Create an advanced filter
 * Set the object type to something with a memo
 * Add a filter criteria on the memo field (either a match or not, does not matter)

 

Demo reproducing it:

[http://informedb-latest.dev.simventions.com/MRM/Search/Advanced/e7a73168-1dc6-4cd4-ab38-bb15c37ef570]

 

From the log file:

ERROR 2018-03-07 17:23:50,922 1335232ms DataAPIFiltering       eClauseFromFieldFilterExpression - Invalid column in filter expression..  You cannot search for values in 'Description':'description__String' since it does not exist in this filter

ERROR 2018-03-07 17:25:09,626 1413937ms DataAPIFiltering       eClauseFromFieldFilterExpression - Invalid column in filter expression..  You cannot search for values in 'Description':'description__String' since it does not exist in this filter

ERROR 2018-03-07 17:25:51,616 1455927ms DataAPIFiltering       eClauseFromFieldFilterExpression - Invalid column in filter expression..  You cannot search for values in 'Description':'description__String' since it does not exist in this filter

column1: Filter: Allow caller to specify a subset of columns to return for the objects that pass the filter
column29:
Until this is implemented, every node returned by a filter call will include the union of all columns of each object type in the filter.

For performance (smaller payload and less data to parse in the UI), we should all a caller to specify which columns they want returned

At a minimum we will add the object type id and the object id to the list of columns to be returned (they are base properties of the nodes that get returned)

*_CEC currently gives a client out of memory error since it returns so much data_*

column1: RC1 Testing: Objects: Nested LAVs not respecting RBAC
column29:
Reporter: Ryan S.

RC 1 Testing Fail – Objects

 

Server: Staging NSERC

Project: Staging NSERC Project 2 (49121)

Summary: If the user has nested LAVS (OT1 -> OT2 -> OT3) and is  denied to OT3 they can still see that data in OT1.

 

Test Steps:
 # Set up a project with at least 3.
 # In OT 2 there is a LAV to any attribute in OT 3.
 # In OT 1 there is a LAV to the LAV attribute in OT 2.
 # Set up a RBAC rule to deny the user to OT 3 (they should not see any of that data)
 # The user is not able to see the OT 3 data in three BUT they can see the OT 3 data in the nested LAV in OT 1.

column1: Give a warning before inactivity timeout
column29:
When working in a story thread, leave it alone for 10 minutes, then check an atribute or artifact.  The criteria is added to the criteria radiator and the loading spinner spins and spins and spins...  You should be logged out, but you are not.

Now click one of the links in the nav bar.  You are logged out.

It appears the idle timeout / logout is only triggered when hitting the back end.  Since the story thread filter options are all front end, the idle timeout / logout is never triggered.

This was highlighted most recently during the SimV resume updating process. Fred Krieg lost 3 hours of work because he did not click the "save" button.
column79:
- After (timeout - ? ) minutes after a web request, user sees a dialog indicating that they will timeout soon.
- Doing any sort of activity on the dialog resets their timeout.
- If they timeout without interacting with the dialog in the remaining time, they are taken back to the DoD Banner page.
column93: Message box for when tool is about to timeout and button to stop it
column107: 18/Jan/18 2:32 PM;JohnSieck;Same thing occurs on Object Details page if you click edit, wait ten minutes and click cancel.
column108: 13/Sep/18 10:45 AM;MattChild;This has been a frequent problem, and we get consistent complaints about it. During the Informedb Enterprise resume updating at SimV, one user lost 3 hours of work due to the inactivity timeout.
column109: 18/Dec/18 5:13 PM;JohnSieck;From a UX perspective I think addressing the timeout issue for users is CRITICAL to the success of Informedb.  Users have to be able to trust the web app and when they lose work due to a timeout that occurs without notice then trust is eroded..fast.

column1: Story Thread Pie Chart: Infinite loading spinner when switching to table
column29:
After adding rules to a story thread, sometimes you get an infinite loading spinner if you try to change the visualization method to a table.

Steps to reproduce:
Server: latest
Project: demo and training
Story thread: "pie chart"
- Add a new rule
- Change the new rule's object type to "Development Effort Schedules".
- Select "Visualizations"
- Select "Table"
- Click "Apply"

Result: "Loading" spinner continues spinning infinitely and table does not appear.

Notes:
- It doesn't always happen when adding new rules.
- If you save it and reload it after changing to a table, you will correctly see the results.
- If you've saved it as a table, then you seem to always be able to get back to the table (e.g., come fresh into a saved table with dev schedules / milestones, remove schedules, switch to pie chart, add rule, change rule to schedules, switch back to table - table appears).
- Saving it before switching to table (but not refreshing the page) has no change to the errant behavior.
- I haven't seen it being broken when removing rules.
column79:
- Errors received during data fetching are displayed to the user.
- If an error occurs, the loading spinner is cancelled.
- A message with static text replaces the content area (just the grid).
- Scenario described below does not result in an infinite loading spinner.
column107:
05/Dec/19 2:37 PM;PeterMorrissey;POC: Scott

Time: Half a day

Dependencies: None

Note: Make a list of ways to force errors for testers
column108:
06/Dec/19 1:02 PM;ScottSummerford;Testing Areas:

Smoketest Reports / Basic ST / Advanced ST. Make sure it's triggering updates when it should (filter changes).

For Basic / Advanced STs  -

Test the loading state as well as the error state.

Ways to trigger load error:

Disconnect Network (Easy in chrome)

Time out your user in one tab and continue edits in another.

Delete an attribute on an OT you're filtering on (Do not reload the page - it will explode, see comments below)

 

Things this does not fix - 

If you have a filter with a deleted OT in it, it's still going to explode. There are 4+ things to fix and they were not in the area of this story.

Getting an infinite spinner while loading a deleted story thread

column1: Viz - Month # in "Weeks" header are off by 1

Original title: Viz - 12's showing up as 0's

MC: This is likely caused by the fact that Java's Calendar class is 0 based instead of 1 based.

column1: Determine how best to handle filters that have rules with attributes that are denied to users to prevent information leakage
Seeing denied RBAC objects when linking
column29:
The user is able to see objects for an OT that they are denied to when linking by "Add Related" and "Link Object to Object(s)".

Test Steps: 
* Create two OTs 
* Edit them to allow for relationships
* Create objects for each OT 
* Deny yourself access to one of the OTs 
* Navigate to the Object List page for the OT that you have access too 
* Select an object 
* Click the "Actions" button 
* Click the "Link Checked Object(s) to Object" button 
* Start typing the name of an object in the Denied OT.
* The user sees the object 
* This also occurs trying to "Add Related" on the object details page
column79:
- On the objects page, if you click "Link Checked Objects to Object", if you are denied permission to an object then you can't see it in the auto complete.
- If you are denied permission to an object type then you can't select it from the combo.
- Both also apply to Object details page, "Add Related"

column1: Issue with a user being Denied to an OT that is part of a rule in the Advanced Filter
column29:

For filters with denied attributes, the behavior for what results are returned is fine to be either the original results or the full list of that type.
column79:
- If a user's access is denied to an object type in a story thread's filter, that user's permission for that thread can be no higher than read only.
- Verify that permissions in the backend on save a filter enforce the permissions in the UI.
- If a user's access is denied to an object type in a story thread's filter, that object type does not show in the rules but the rules are still shown.
- If a user's access is denied to an attribute in a story thread's filter, that attribute does not show in the rules.

column1: Deleting a link attribute can cause objects in the type to throw errors for any change
column29:
This is an error Kasey Hill found when she was working on the Enterprise Database Support (EDS) project on Roadmap.

She created an attribute called SubTaskID, as a link attribute. She later realized that it shouldn't be a link attribute, it should be a string attribute. She deleted the link attribute and recreated it as a string. Later, related objects were throwing errors in LAV_Links_Delete because SubTaskID was not found.

It appears that when the link was deleted, it was deleted from the LAV_Configuration but not from the LAV_Links table or the LAV views that were created.
column107:
31/Jul/18 1:19 PM;NancyKraus;Steps to reproduce:
 # Create Object Type A
 # Add string attribute, strField, to Object Type A
 # Create Object Type B
 # Add Link Attribute, linkField
 # Add Relationship between A and B
 # Configure linkField to point to Object Type A, strField and to keep sync'd
 # Create Object A for Object Type A
 # Create Object B for Object Type B
 # Link Object A to Object B
 # In Designer, delete strField under Object Type A
 # Attempt to edit Object A - error is thrown
 # Attempt to delete Object B - no error is thrown, but object is not deleted
column108: 06/Aug/18 10:32 AM;MattChild;Verify that 1882 is resolved. There is a sequence of steps that will replicate; at first glance they looked similar but we should verify it.

column1: There is no scroll bar for the DoD Banner page.

column1: Create a Label/Handle attribute on each Object for use in the Filtered Story Thread contents list
column29:
Short name is sometimes renamed, but we need some sort of system-design concept for helping the user understand what an object is in a short space.

Having a "label" attribute that the system can use to represent the object in lists and other places would lay the groundwork for future configurability. Currently, we are using a special attribute "shortname" that the system is using to represent the object, and we treat this specially and have it as a "reserved" field. The fact that users rename this field gives us a hint that that they think about their data a different way than the default. Having a default taxonomy is still useful, but users are going to want to change it and customize it.

In the future, it would be useful to make the text that represents a node configurable - for instance, the combination of a "first name" and "Last name" attribute. Having a "label" or "handle" value on every object would do 2 things:
- Allay the immediate problem of not having the "short name" attribute available to display something useful in the filter story thread list of objects.
- Reduce the cost of implementing a configurable label in the future by having new features (or retrofiting as we make changes to old features) rely on the new computed field.
column79:
- Every object type's ShortName should go to a single column in the filter view.
- In the interface, the column header displaying the short name is "Object"

column111:
20/Nov/17 4:31 PM;NancyKraus;To test, change the web.config settings and verify the PtoP export is downloaded successfully.  Settings to set are:
 * DownloadType
 ** Values are: mvc or manual
 * DownloadSubType
 ** DownloadType == mvc, Values are: content, stream, path, contentsresult, streamresult, or pathresult
 ** DownloadType == manual, values are: anything, stream
 * DownloadIncludeName
 ** set to false, files will download with no set name
 * DownloadBufferOutput
 * DownloadChunkByteSize
 ** Only effects DownloadType == manual, DownloadSubType == stream

column1: Move templates from cshtml into script files
column29:
For a long time we've used the pattern of $(".template .classname").clone() to store templates for components in the HTML source; it's easier to make changes if the template and code using it are closer together, though. Having a constant in the script of the form TEMPLATE = $("
...
"), and then clone()ing the constant where needed, allows making things more local. This is easier for files already converted to Typescript, since it permits strings deliminated by `` so quotes don't need to be fixed. (Long-term we can use React components and have inline JSX/TSX templates, but I don't expect us to get off jQuery overnight.) X

column1: Filter should not show Kendo control when no results or a new (blank) filter
column29: The appearance of pagination when there were no results or a blank / new filter with no results confused even experienced users,
column79:
Acceptance Criteria updated after 9/28 scrum. JP

Do not show the Kendo component when there are no records displayed due to 1) no results or 2) a new story thread with no records.  Instead display a message according to each case. 

1) No results message is as follows: 

Your criteria did not produce any results. Try modifying the criteria on the left to change what is included in your story thread. 

Tips for Creating Story Threads
- Try selecting different criteria
- Try selecting fewer criteria
- If using Date Range criteria, try using a broader range
- If using Search Within, make sure words are spelled correctly or try entering different keywords

2) For a story thread where no criteria has yet been set because it is new or because the user has unchecked everything the message is as follows: 

To populate your story thread, choose the items you want included from the criteria on the left. The available criteria and the items in the story thread will automatically update depending on what you choose.
column107:
28/Sep/17 10:54 AM;JohnSieck;Matt, 

If the criteria selected results in no results returned, I suggest we display the actual criteria so the user can easily see what combination of criteria produced the blank results. Then they can easily decide what to change (a lot easier than looking through the left sidebar). It could be included before or after the "Tips for Creating Story Threads" copy.  For example: 

Your current criteria... 
- Product 
     - Document Status: Approved, Draft, or Pending Changes 
- Controlled Documents 
     - Funding: Funded 
Search within "Platypus"

column1: Cyber Alert:  Security Alert for Progress Telerik UI for ASP.NET AJAX
column29:
Security Alert for Progress Telerik UI for ASP.NET AJAX
	
   	We are writing to inform you of a security vulnerability (CVE-2017-9248) that exists in all versions of Telerik.Web.UI.dll assembly prior to 2017.2.621. We have investigated and addressed the issue and strongly recommend you follow one of the steps below to ensure the safety and security of your applications. As we consider this vulnerability critical, we urge you to take one of the following actions as soon as possible.
•	Download and promote the security patch provided in your Telerik.com account for versions between Q1 2011 and R2 2017
•	For those on active maintenance, upgrade to R2 2017 SP1 or newer version of Telerik UI for ASP.NET AJAX
•	Prevent access to the DialogHandler.aspx handler (for example, remove it from your web.config)
You can find more details in the Cryptographic Weakness KB article found here: http://www.telerik.com/support/kb/aspnet-ajax/details/cryptographic-weakness

Best regards,
The Progress Team

column1: Story Thread Pie Chart - Rules Shrink Pie Chart permanently
column29:
When you add rules to an advanced filter, the Pie chart gradually shrinks to give more space. When you collapse the filter, the Pie chart stays small. 

AKA if you have more than 4 rules you have a permanently mini-sized Pie chart.

However, if you change the grouping and force the pie chart to re-render, you get a different issue. Now when you expand the rules the pie chart gets shifted off the page.
column79:
- The pie chart size is fixed at a large size (the initial size when the rules are collapsed), regardless of the number of rules.
- When the rules are expanded and take more room than the expanded rules + fixed pie chart size allows, the whole content area (rules + pie chart) has a vertical scroll.
- The "table" visualization works as it does now (fixed content area size, scrolling within the table).

column1: Moving attributes on the Edit Groups page does not save
column29:
Issue: 
If the user moves attributes between groups on the Edit Groups page and save, the changes are not saved. 

Steps: 
1. Design > Edit Groups
2. Make sure an OT has two groups, if not create two groups. 
3. Move an attribute from one group to another (Drag and Drop)
4. Click "Save" 
5. The attribute is not in the desired group. 

Work Around: 
1. Click the "x" next to an attribute to remove it from any group. 
2. Move the removed attribute to desired group. 
3. Click "Save" 
4. The attribute is saved in desired group.
column107: 23/May/19 1:10 PM;MattChild;Ali and I retested this, and it looks like you can never move an attribute back to a group that it was previously in.
column108: 23/May/19 1:12 PM;MattChild;There is a workaround we found. If you remove the attribute from groups completely, then save it, then move it to a new group, it will save.

column1: Problem saving an MRM object with many LAV values.
column29:
Jason Redcay and Alison Perry were having an issue with saving an object. When they tried to make any changes to date attributes and save it, they got an "Oops, something went wrong" error. There appeared to be 2 related errors in the log. The first was a LAV parsing problem, and the second was a SQL timeout. My initial guess is that the update for the LAV may have caused the SQL timeout.

 

This may be related to INF-2172

 

Project: LCS Enterprise Planning Tool

Type: Avails

Object: LCS 0001 DSRA FY18

LAV Parsing Exception:

INFO  2018-06-06 10:50:33,859 12424272ms InternalDBLayer        saveMRMObject                    - Link Attribute Hull failed to save due to exception. Value will be ignored.
 Newtonsoft.Json.JsonReaderException: Unexpected character encountered while parsing value: L. Path '', line 1, position 1.
    at Newtonsoft.Json.JsonTextReader.ParseValue()
    at Newtonsoft.Json.JsonTextReader.Read()
    at Newtonsoft.Json.Serialization.JsonSerializerInternalReader.ReadForType(JsonReader reader, JsonContract contract, Boolean hasConverter)
    at Newtonsoft.Json.Serialization.JsonSerializerInternalReader.Deserialize(JsonReader reader, Type objectType, Boolean checkAdditionalContent)
    at Newtonsoft.Json.JsonSerializer.DeserializeInternal(JsonReader reader, Type objectType)
    at Newtonsoft.Json.JsonConvert.DeserializeObject(String value, Type type, JsonSerializerSettings settings)
    at Newtonsoft.Json.JsonConvert.DeserializeObject[T](String value, JsonSerializerSettings settings)

column1: Add a consistent way to display messages to user to the design system

Establish a list of the different kinds of errors that would happen, for instance:
 * Submitting an invalid request (upload, form, etc.)
 * Entering invalid characters
 * Action not successful
 * Loading / Progress

column1: "Object Details" sometimes takes a full minute to load
column29:
Reported by Brad, witnessed by Matt C.

On a certain database on Roadmap, in a certain project on the objects page, when you click on the a link to go to the details of the object there is a long lag time in between loading. In looking at a network trace, it appears that the call to the VisualDatabase/getNeighbors method is not invoked for over 50 seconds after the start of the page load. Once the call is made, it returns and renders fairly quickly (3 seconds). However, the page doesn't render until that call returns and so it looks like the page takes a full minute to load.

column1: Verify setting timeout in web config logs closes their session
column29:

Make sure to verify NSERC config when we deploy 4.9.8.2 if we confirm this works.
column107:
12/Jan/18 9:11 AM;NancyKraus;There are two timeouts that can be set:
 * Session timeout.
 ** The default is 20 minutes. If nothing is changed in the web config, it will still timeout after 20 minutes. However, when the session ends it will NOT log the automatically log the user out.
 * Forms Authentication timeout
 ** When this timeout is reached, a user will be logged out and redirected to the login page. It does NOT end the session. If not configured in the web.config, default is 30 minutes.The test servers and Roadmap are configured to a 360 minute timeout.  NSERC is using a 60 minute timeout.
column108:
12/Jan/18 10:53 AM;NancyKraus;There are two session timeout related stigs:
 * Automatically terminate session and log off after 15 minute idle time period for non-privileged users
 * Automatically terminate session and log off after 10 minute idle time period for admin users

 

Configuring the session and form timeout to 10 should meet both stig requirements
column109: 12/Jan/18 11:25 AM;NancyKraus;Timeouts have been configured to 10 minutes. Verify it works and no wonkiness is experienced

column1: Collect analytics and metrics on database growth
column29:
From Brad's E-mail:

I’d like to task someone, I’m not sure who or when, but I think we need to know and track over time the amount of “data” we have in each project.  I’m not talking about the size of the DB (e.g. 734MB), or the number of records (400 objects), all of which are important... but the total number of attributes and the total number of links.  To me, this is really the meat of each project.  You can have a database with 1000 objects, but with only 3 attributes each... psst – who cares – easy peasy.  You can have a database with 1000 objects with some attachments and a few links... psst – who cares.  BUT processing 1000 objects with 100’s of attributes and 1000’s of links could crush processing power and give us leverage for future service costs and SW/HW upgrades we could get paid for.  IMHO, those are numbers we should track.  We can claim success in managing project ABC with some metric like this... see how it has grown over time... maybe monthly or yearly... and relate these metrics with issues also...  on and on... 

Is this something we can document by running a “simple” script on each project?

column1: We need a consistent approach to presenting help content to users.
column29:
We need a consistent approach to presenting help content to users. This includes producing error messages that are polite, precise and prescriptive (how to fix it).

According to the Nielsen Norman Group, help is one of the 10 usability heuristics. Help systems should have 3 essential qualities:
Available without interfering. Some type of help should be available in every application or website, but it should remain out of the way until users need it. And when they do, it should be easy to find.

Succinct yet descriptive, in plain language. Help messages should use only as many words as are necessary, in a language that is understandable by lay people. (It’s amazing how many unhelpful help systems simply regurgitate the system’s own language: “checking the foobar checkbox activates the foobar feature.”)

Unintrusive. It should be easy for users to return their attention to their original task after seeking help.

 - excerpt from https://www.nngroup.com/articles/pop-up-adaptive-help/

column1: Description: set default "isRequired" to false
column29:
This is frequently a nuisance to users, who rarely fill in the description column.

This fix should only apply to new object types; we don't need to change existing.

As a bonus: we could write a sql script script to turn the description to not required.


{color:red}
{quote}
SELECT * FROM _AttributesTable 
WHERE description = 'Description'

UPDATE _AttributesTable
SET isRequired = 0
WHERE description = 'Description'

SELECT * FROM _AttributesTable 
WHERE description = 'Description'
{quote}
{color}

column1: Error for SSF Rules
column29:
Come see me for understanding.

The user gets an error following these steps in NSERC_IWS2_4.3 only
	In project NSERC_IWS2_4.3 
	The rule is “If Object Type is RDT&E and if Attribute value DTE Sequence equals Identify Allow read only/is editable/full control”

	Edit an Object to have “Identify” as the DTE Sequence value 
	Click “Save”

column1: UX: Evaluate Summit progress indicator component for use in Informedb
column29:
As one of the original 10 heuristics for web usability, visibility of system status remains among the most important and universally applicable principles in user-interface design. 
Progress indicators, be they linear or circular, let users know that the system is still working to respond to their actions. Such elements inform users of the current working state and make the process more tolerable to the user by reducing uncertainty. Users experience higher satisfaction with a site and are willing to wait longer when the site uses a dynamic progress indicator.

Progress indicators were often built into our plan for a feature but just as often ended up on the chopping block when push came to shove. One of those features which does not tell the user whether or not the site is responsive is when preparing a PowerPoint presentation for download. The user does not receive feedback after clicking the button to start the process. For large presentations with many slides it can seem to the user that the site is broken. This results in frustration and distrust of the system and makes SimVentions look bad. Summit has developed a progress indicator component that may be able to be utilized in Informedb.
column79:
As a user, when I click to export or download a presentation, I want to receive feedback that the site is working on the request so that I know it is working. I would also like the ability to:
1) keep working on other things while the file is being prepared for download and 
2) cancel the preparation (of that file for download) if it is taking too long.

column1: Inventory database query plan for common website actions
column107:
17/Mar/20 10:14 AM;NancyKraus;How to evaluate query performance (from Drew):
 # Enable SQL logging in the DB
 # Use a “quiet” DB that no one else is using so you don’t get a bunch of junk.
 # Execute an action in Informedb that has been showing performance issues.
 # Disable SQL logging in the DB
 # Filter through the logged queries and find the ones related to change log (You may also find that the app is doing an inefficient query N times)
 # Execute an Explain Plan on the logged queries.  This will tell you how the DB engine will access the data.  If there aren’t any indexes, it will have to do a full table scan (bad for large tables!).
 # Based on the predicates of the logged queries, add some useful indexes.
 # Execute an Explain Plan on queries after adding indices and compare access methods with previous plan.  You may also need to tweak the indexes to get the best query plan.  Query tuning starts to become more of an art than a science once you dive in.

column1: Switch everyone to using VS 2019
Application pool crash causes server to go down
column29:
At 1:54pm on 3/20/2020, roadmap.simventions.com went down for 45 minutes. The application pool was automatically shut down by Windows, and so the web site did not have any workers to serve requests.

Here are the relevant events I could find from the server event logs:
*ROADMAP	5002	Error	Microsoft-Windows-WAS	System	3/20/2020 1:54:18 PM*
Application pool 'informedb' is being automatically disabled due to a series of failures in the process(es) serving that application pool.

*ROADMAP	5011	Warning	Microsoft-Windows-WAS	System	3/20/2020 1:54:18 PM*
A process serving application pool 'informedb' suffered a fatal communication error with the Windows Process Activation Service. The process id was '944'. The data field contains the error number.

*ROADMAP	1000	Error	Application Error	Application	3/20/2020 1:54:13 PM*
Faulting application name: w3wp.exe, version: 8.5.9600.16384, time stamp: 0x5215df96
Faulting module name: clr.dll, version: 4.8.4121.0, time stamp: 0x5deabd50
Exception code: 0xc0000005
Fault offset: 0x0000000000355b84
Faulting process id: 0x3b0
Faulting application start time: 0x01d5fee08a43cefb
Faulting application path: c:\windows\system32\inetsrv\w3wp.exe
Faulting module path: C:\Windows\Microsoft.NET\Framework64\v4.0.30319\clr.dll
Report Id: ceac1dae-6ad3-11ea-8180-00155d1e0806
Faulting package full name: 
Faulting package-relative application ID: 

*ROADMAP	1023	Error	.NET Runtime	Application	3/20/2020 1:54:13 PM*
Application: w3wp.exe
Framework Version: v4.0.30319
Description: The process was terminated due to an internal error in the .NET Runtime at IP 00007FFF6F4D5B84 (00007FFF6F180000) with exit code c0000005.


Some of these messages (except the first listed) were repeated multiple times with different process IDs.

Probable path to fix:
# If necessary, add a API call to get the Story Thread NodeType (one might exist?)
# In ObjectTypes.tsx, replace the call to GetObjectTypeForStoryThreads() with the NodeType version.
#* update the callback to insert a call to `setRelevantNodeTypes()`; pass the Story Thread NodeType as the only relevant type.
# in generateActionMenu(), change the `index` parameter to be a bare NodeType[] instead of a destructured TypeContext.
#* plumb that change all the way up to the `ObjectTypesPage` component; pass in the `relevantNodeTypes` as the value.

column1: Subtypes: Subtype with an apostrophe (') in the name issue
column29:
If a subtype contains an apostrophe in the name, the home page will not load the object types. There is no indication given to the user that the object types failed to load.

 

This is occurring because a stored procedure is called to get the total number of objects per subtype. It does not escape the apostrophe. Options to fix include:
 # Fix it to escape the apostrophe before calling the procedure
 # Don't use the stored procedure and use entity framework
 # Don't fix it and show an error to the user
 # Prevent the user from creating subtypes with apostrophes in the name (doesn't fix existing ones)
 # Load the object types but don't include the count if an error occurs getting it.

column1: Object Details: "Link Object" shows text box in dropdown
column29:
On the Object Details page, the "Link Objects" modal shows an text box in the dropdown. 

 

A similar modal access from the Object List Page via "Link Checked Object(s) to Object" does not show a separate text box.

 

See attachments.

column1: UI Issue: Loading Ship Availabilities OT is slow on the Objects List page

Developers Note: UI only Issue.

column1: "Save As" a story thread shares the associated Gard Project
column29:
When you Save-As an Advanced Filter that has an associated Visualizer Project File, the new Advanced Filter points back at the same file.

If one filter then has its associated project file deleted, then it's deleted for all the filters sharing it.

If one filter has its associated project file replaced by uploading a new one, then only that filter will be associated to the new file, but the old one will still be removed from all the affected filters.

This also occurs on the manual story threads and add/remove related pages

column1: UX: Do not delete scenario name when scenario name fails validation
column29:
When creating a scenario, if the scenario name fails validation the user is notified. When the user accepts the notification, the scenario name is deleted from the field and the user has to start all over. Don't delete it. Just leave it. The user can modify it from there until it passes validation.

Impact: minor annoyance

column1: Object list page loads 2x - 4x more slowly

Latest:

Data does not show up until it is fully loaded.
column107:
20/Feb/20 4:30 PM;PeterMorrissey;A few notes from my initial explorations:
 * At the moment, GetObjectTypesWithSubtypes (aka GetObjectTypes) is being called in three places in ObjectTypes.ts: line ~226, line ~1475, and line ~1930.
 ** The call on line ~1475 can be removed entirely, everything that function does is also done by checkboxFormatter which triggers on the same event.
 ** The two calls on lines ~226 and ~1930 can and probably should be combined into one function, there's no need to make that call twice that I can see.
 * After roughly implementing the above changes, the total time the remaining GetObjectTypesWithSubtypes spent waiting was still an order of magnitude larger on localhost than it was on staging. I'm uncertain if this was due to differences between debugging and server capacities though, I didn't check any neutral benchmarks.
 * GetThreads is also now being called when it wasn't before, though I think that this is necessary.

column1: Multi Select Attributes do not support commas
column29:
Due to the way multi select attributes are stored, if there a multi select value that has a comma in it, it will not be editable on the object details page.

For example, if you had a multi select:

Option 1: A, B

Option 2: C

It is stored as "A, B, C"

column1: Objects list page sometimes shows no page content
column29:
POC: Joseph
Timebox: 1d
Brad Impact: 8

Remove Kendo? Timebox: Half a day

In either Chrome, Firefox, Internet Explorer, when you go to the "Objects" page, the nav bar loads but the content of the page is completely blank. There is a console error:

Uncaught TypeError: n(...).kendoDatePicker is not a function

A quick googling found this result, which says the likely culprit is that something is getting called on Kendo before the Kendo script is loaded:

https://www.telerik.com/forums/newbie-kendodatepicker-is-not-a-function

Server: Informedb-sprint
Project: Demo and Training

Click on "Objects" in nav bar.

Potential fixes:
- (Small?) Change the order that scripts are loaded on the page.

Technical Details:
- Timebox: 1 day
- Matt works from home
- Team meeting (including Matt C.) to discuss before starting
- Spend an hour or two a day to create an idea and then have Matt test overnight.

It's *possible* that something is cutting off the download of the kendo script.
column113:
12/Feb/20 10:33 AM;JosephWallace;Digging more into things, it appears that the kendo bundle is the single largest script download that the page makes.

This might be a hint as to why it's always *that* file that fails, but I don't yet know where in the chain that's failing.
column114:
21/Feb/20 10:20 AM;JosephWallace;IT suggested a firewall may be blocking the Kendo file due to https://www.cvedetails.com/cve/CVE-2014-0307/

From Feb 20 meeting, routes to investigate were determined:
- Matt & IT would investigate whitelisting the script in the firewall to confirm the potential root cause
- Peter would look at (jQuery) Kendo usages to determine difficulty of replacement w/ Kendo React or Fabric components
- if nothing else works, we can try replacing the bundled version with a direct <script> tag to see what happens, but it's unlikely to make a difference based on current understanding.

column1: Filters: See selection in multi select list with many options
column29:
As a user I want to be able to see all the items I have selected in a multiselect component so I am not wondering which I have picked (currently they are hidden when the list scrolls).

See attached image examples of how a component can appear within a popover or in a panel (sidebar). See attached animated gif for component behaviors or read on.

Proposed solution is to update the component to what appears to be a list of items. When an item is clicked it appears as a pill (aka tag) within a container and is removed from the original list. Clicking the X on a pill removes it from the container and puts it back in the list. Typing in the container acts as a type ahead, narrowing the list.

!image-2020-02-26-15-37-25-687.png!!image-2020-02-26-15-15-48-770.png!

column1: Hidden attributes appearing when they shouldn't
column29:
Hidden attributes are not supposed to appear in certain places on the website. Currently, the are appearing in the Word Export, Advanced Filter, Reports (in filter and column selection) and the Visualizer. Also, the Basic Filter Search Within includes searching hidden attributes.

 

A hidden attribute is defined as an attribute that is not in a group if the object type has groups defined. To see if a field is hidden, go to the Edit Groups page in the Designer and select a particular object type. Hidden fields appear on the left in the "Fields" container.

column1: Users with full permissions have errors in filters made by users with restricted permissions
column29:
Under the following conditions, the Excel Export will cause an Uh Oh error.

Given:
 * User A does not have access to all attributes in the object type due to RBAC rules
 * User B has full access to the object type

 When
 * User A exports the objects of that object type

Then
 # User B attempts to export the objects of that object type with attributes that were denied to User A, an error occurs

 

This could also occur if User A was the first user in the project to export that object type, create a filter with just that object type or have a report with a filter with just that object type.

 

Workaround: User B make a change to the taxonomy (add/remove/re-name attribute or add/remove/re-name object type) and try again

column1: "Save as" when a scenario is deleted can't save all the changes
column29:
If you've loaded a scenario, the visualizer only knows about the changes that have been made in that session. It doesn't know what previous changes have been made since all of that is aggregated on the server. Thus, if you save as when a scenario has been deleted on the website, you would only be able to save a partial diff of the data.

What should we do about that?

column29:
When updating a string in the Visualizer, an extra new line is prepended to the beginning of the string. This occurs even if the user made no changes to the value.

 

Developer's note - the Visualizer is sending over a new line (\n) and it is getting saved into the database. Something similiar happens with scenario data as well.

Notes:
- Hitting enter or clicking out both cause this behavior.
- There was a discussion about whether or not we could always trim the text. Initial discussion was no, because we would need to think about that more and whether we would have to make other changes in the site.

 [^informedb-scenario-non-obvious-usecases-V5.txt]
column115:
13/Feb/20 9:26 PM;MattChild;Delete object
=============
?. Are the earlier changes for the object still in the scenario? [yes]
?. Are the changes from the published scenario applied to the undeleted object? [no]
=============
Copy Object
?. Are the changes for the original object still in the scenario? [yes]
?. Does the scenario show those same changes for the object's duplicate? [no, unless you are copying the object in the context of the visualizer which I don't think is possible]
=============
Move Object

1. Edit an object in a scenario

2a. Move the object to another object type not in the scenario
3a. Move the object back to the original object type
?. Do the changes for the object still appear in the scenario? [ideally yes, but flexible if this is cumbersome]

2b. Move the object to another object type still in the scenario
?. Do the changes for the object still appear in the scenario? [ideally yes if fields are common and the data is moved, but flexible if this is cumbersome]

column1: Computed Date: Prevent configuration of anchor date
column29:
The user can not select a computed date to be the anchor date.  However, the user can get around this by configuring a date attribute that is being used as an anchor date.  Example:

Three date attributes exist: A, B, C
 * A is configured to use B as an anchor date
 * B can then be configured to use C as an anchor date. This should be prevented

If the user did it in this order, it is prevented:
 * B is configured to use C as an anchor date
 * User can not select B when trying to configure the anchor date for A

Technical Details:
- Work with Captain Awesome (JP) to figure out UI implementation
- Update API to verify the date is not an anchor date
- Unit tests
column79:
- User is prohibited from configuring a date that is used as an anchor date.
- User can still configure a non-anchor date
column107:
13/Feb/20 2:58 PM;NancyKraus;More in depth details:

 ** var isAnchor = nodeType.Attributes.Any(attribute => attribute.dateConfiguration != null && attribute.dateConfiguration.anchorFieldId == idOfFieldBeingConfigured);
 * Add tests:
 ** DateFieldConfigurationTests.cs
 *** Add test similiar to updateDateFieldConfiguration_AnchorIsComputedTest, but checks that the date being computed is an anchor in another computed field
 * Update validation code:
 ** FieldDefinitionService.cs
 *** Choose:
 **** Update updateDateFieldConfiguration to take the node type that has the list of all dates
 **** Add call in repository that checks if the field being configured is an anchor in another field
 *** Update validateCanBeComputedDate() to check that the field is not an anchor date in anything else
 **** use either the node type or the new repository call to check for this information

Time: 1/2 day + time to coordinate with JP

column1: Computed Dates v1 - Make dates relative to other dates
column29:
As a data analyst, I frequently have dates that are dictated by a set plan or process - e.g., there is a fixed "release date", and then Milestone C is -60 days, Milestone B is -180 days, etc. I want to be able to add a field for the milestone dates that automatically updates without having to go in and update them if the final date changes.

Notes:
- Users typically refer to this as "A minus" dates.

Examples:
- If I change the anchor date on a page (like the spreadsheet modal) the relative date changes as well (after update call?)

Rules:
- Relative dates in the visualizer cannot be updated
- You get an error during import of an excel file with relative date column (non-atomic)
- Relative dates are only configurable at the taxonomy level
- Anchor dates must be on the same object
- " Computed date" can only compute off a regular date attribute
- PtoP should ignore relative dates when importing, assuming taxonomies match. A warning should be written to the log.
- Can't make relative dates writable with RBAC.
- You can use project transfer to import a relative date FROM another project.
- You CANNOT use project transfer to import a date TO a relative date in your project.
- If you delete the "anchor date" attribute, any relative dates show up as blank (null).

Answered Questions:
**Can we base a relative date off of last date modified?**
No.

**Can we base a relative date off of a relative date?**
No.


This is feature #12 on the TTA / SSDS requirement options list. It satisfies a statement TTA Task 2 (Subtask ID 7).

During epic grooming, this was estimated between < 1 - 1 Sprints, and a small t-shirt size.

column1: Backend
column107:
05/Feb/20 3:33 PM;PeterMorrissey;Notes from discussion
 * Create the table in the database
 ** In the SQL Project, the table should have:
 *** A foreign key pointing to the computed date attribute. This should be unique, and the primary key
 *** A foreign key pointing to the anchor date. This should be nullable
 *** A column with the offset
 ** The table should be properly index, and should cascade deletes
 * Update BuildRoadmap.sql with the new table. You should be able to pretty much copy-paste what Visual Studio generates in the SQL Project.
 * Update the upgrade script with the same code.
 * Update the Entity Framework model
 ** Create DateFieldConfigurationEntity
 ** Update the navigation props on AttributeEntity
 ** Update DbExtensions buildFieldDefinition() to include DateConfig nav property
 * Update DataApiRepository
 ** Update toAttribute in TaxonomyModelFactory to include the field config in ListData

By this point, you should be able to get dates with their configuration
 * Create a FieldDefinitionController, -Business, -Service, and -Repo
 ** All of these should inherit from AbstractCRUD
 ** Service
 *** Check if attribute exists
 *** Check if anchor isn't (complete/computed?)
 ** Repo
 *** Contains SQL implementation
 *** Should delete the configuration for an empty anchor or offset
 *** Reference the ScenarioRepo, it deals with a child table via ScenarioFieldValueHelper
 * For all of this, you can reference NotificationController - it has a nice CRUD path.

- User is notified of any errors that occur.

column1: Sandbox: Scenario name can be same as Story Thread name
Properly handle NuGet packages that depend on NetStandard
column29:
More and more NuGet packages depend on .NetStandard. We encountered an issue where one depended on it and threw and error when trying to load the website: "Could not load file or assembly 'netstandard, Version=2.0.0.0, Culture=neutral, PublicKeyToken=cc7b13ffcd2ddd51' or one of its dependencies. The system cannot find the file specified." It appears that because this a dependency of a NuGet dependency, it isn't being deployed. 

It appears someone manually added the netstandard.dll to informedb-latest (masking the problem). This is not the proper solution because it will be left out of deployments. It needs to be determined how to properly handle this scenario.

After this is properly fixed, the NuGet packages that use it should be updated.

column1: Scenarios: Does changing a scenario after it's published change its status?
column29:
In backlog grooming on 2/5/2020, the question came up about what happens when a user changes something in a scenario after it's been published. What should its status be?

MC Note:
- It seems like we would want the status to change to "active" if they've made a change to it.

column1: Publish scenario: Show read only objects?
column29:
I have an intuitive feeling that if users don't see that there are changes in a scenario that they can't publish, it will be confusing. The view that they will have is different than the visualizer, and it won't be easy for them to know why.

This is also true for things that are deleted, but there is a valid reason for this: The information holders specifically want to hide that information from others. For read only, that's not the case - they should be allowed to know about it.

If we show the changes they can't publish, we need to figure out how to show that in an expressive way and not overemphasize it because they can't actually DO anything with them, they just should know that they exist.

column1: Create a data sandbox (rev1)
column29:
As a fleet forces commander, I want to be able to make schedule edits in the visualizer that I think are right, but I'm not sure. I want to save those edits so that I can review them later with SMEs and then upload them later after I've confirmed they're correct.

Idea - "Sandbox", saving 1 or more gard file options to a story thread, being able to load any of them, gard files contain your changes and play them over top of the data.

This is feature #34 in the TTA / SSDS requirement options list. It satisfies a statement in TTA Task 1 (Subtask ID 1, 2, 3).

During epic grooming, this was estimated between 1 - 2 Sprints, and a medium t-shirt size.
*Example Mapping Session: 9/30/2019*
_Observations:_
- Project level variants would confer numerous benefits (both for users and site architecture)
-- The same set of changes could be shown in different visualizations
-- It may let us chip away at the restriction that you can only view 1 project at a time (because of reliance on the "current project" in the database)
-- No new editing capabilities would have to exist in the site (less components to build / wire).


_Questions:_
- Project level variants
-- How are sandboxes shared between users?
-- How do you switch sandboxes quickly (or back to the original data)?
-- How can we visually distinguish the difference between "live" data and fictional "what if" scenario (i.e., color of page being different) so you don't accidentally make changes to a sandbox when you were trying to make changes to the "real" data (or vice versa)?
-- Who can make a sandbox?
- Story thread variants
-- Are variants duplicated when filter is "saved as"?
-- Variants need their own details (who created it, how old it is, etc.)
-- Are the filter rules variant specific? (Probably yes, but needs thought)
-- Do we change the "baseline" to the published variant?
- Both approaches:
-- Can anyone make edits in their sandbox even if they didn't have permission to "officially" change it (for RBAC reasons, for example)
-- How do underlying changes to the data affect my variant?
-- Is publishing atomic?
-- Is there a limit to the number of variants? (Probably no, unless there is a compelling technical reason otherwise)
-- When you publish a variant, is it deleted? (Probably yes, JP's wording suggestion was "Make this variant the baseline")


_Rules:_
- Create, edit, and share change between each variant
- Story thread level variants:
-- Would include basic filter, but not manual story threads.
-- Export to word exports the selected variant
-- Variants are deleted with story threads
-- Visualizer data changes change associated variant
-- Each variant probably does not have a separate GARD file.
- Publishing a variant must include some kind of diff.

column79:
- "Future Years" is an option in the binning drop down
- Future Years bins are: Past, this year, next year, 2 years from now, 3 years from now, more than 3 years, no date.
- Pie chart legend displays actual years corresponding to bin selection (i.e., the options in the chart would read: Past, FY 19, FY 20, FY 21, FY 22, FY 23 or After, No date)
- Sort order of the legend values is ascending (earliest time first - see above)
- Each year's bin starts on Oct 1 of the previous year and ends Sept 30 of the named year.
- Pie chart shows the correct the results

column1: Visualizer: Save the object data in the scenario
column29:
POC: Nancy
Dependencies: INF-3715
2d

Implementation Notes:
 - The visualizer does not allow users add or delete nodes; only update them, and create links.

Technical Details:
 * There is a place to store it in the database
 * there is a path controller through repository in the C# layer to save that data
 * this will update the save endpoint to take an optional scenario ID
 * update the visualizer to include that scenario ID 
* perform a save when a new scenario is created (*before* doing the refresh that comes with changing the scenario!)
* make sure that saving into a scenario does not call the endpoint to update the links
column79:
- When not in a scenario, everything works as usual

When in a scenario:
- User can initiate / execute saving data
- No changes to base data
- Other scenario's data do not change
- Changes are saved to scenario.
- When you save base data as a scenario, added and removed links are not saved

column1: Notification: Verification
column29:
Prior to creating a notification, the following inputs from the user should be verified:
 # Object exists and is the specified object type
 # Object's short name is correct
 # Users exist

column1: Notification: Viewing notifications is not showing the latest notifications
column29:
When a user creates a notification for an object, and then clicks the notification icon (the bell in the nav bar), the new notification is not listed under Sent Notifications. Also, if another user creates a notification for the current user and the current user then clicks the notification icon, the new notification is not listed under Inbox Notifications.

The notifications are not updated until the page is refreshed or the user navigates to a non-React page.

column1: Notification: Notification count doesn't increment
column29: When a user creates a notification for an object, the number of notifications next to the bell in the nav bar does not increment. When the page is refreshed, the number is incremented.

column1: Create related objects directly from a LAV
column29:
Reported by Matt Wilson:
As a data entry person, I want to immediately create and link objects of a linked attribute type from the context of the LAV data field, so that I can quickly fully fill out and describe an item without having to click a bunch of things.

If we add a button next to a LAV field that allows me to create another items related to the associated linked type and maybe open a dialog of the default fields to fill in, that would be great.

column1: Excel Macros: Update IBPEZ macro sheet
column29:
A long time ago in a galaxy not on Disney+, I made an excel sheet that would allow IBPEZ to format other excel sheets, or data pasted into the master sheet, into a formatted excel sheet with table data ready to use with Informedb's Excel Import.

Those macros are a little dated. They were among the first things I did here as well, so the construction probably isn't perfect.

8-9 months ago we had a meeting where they discussed additional changes that they wanted. I think the format of the data may change, the mehods/phrasing of the macro, and something about highlighted text / differentials.

 

I've pushed the existing stuff to a branch "INF-UNK_IBPEZ_Macros". They were excited for it back then, but I haven't heard since. I believe a few people at SimVentions were also using it. It may be valuable to reconfirm desired behaviors.

 

Note:

- After Jan 2020 conversation with Ashley, she said it might be useful in the future but they have no current plans now.

column1: Enterprise Manager: Username / Email limitations and page breaking
column29:
When creating a user, there seems to be few restrictions on what you can use for your username/email (and probably password).

This means, for example, I can create a user with a username of half of the lyrics of mambo no. 5, and an email of the other half of the lyrics, followed by an @ sign.

When you do this, it forces the enterprise manager user page to scroll pretty grossly.

column1: Spreadsheet Modal: Add the ability to edit a cell
column29:
For the purposes of this story, the value shown in "edit" mode doesn't matter.

This was discussed when JP and Matt reviewed the initial mock-ups and discussed his research with PST for INF-3157:

- When hovering over a cell that is editable, the cursor changes to the pipe-y icon (just like when editing content in an Excel cell or a Word document.
- Clicking in an editable cell allows the user to edit the contents of the cell.
column79:
String columns:
- When you mouse over a cell, it changes to a "pipe-y" editor if it is editable
- Double click starts an "edit" mode for a cell
- Hitting "escape" cancels edit mode, and reverts the value to the original value.
- Losing focus on the cell (e.g., selecting another cell) stops edit mode (no more text caret)
column107:
24/Oct/19 2:22 PM;ScottSummerford;This includes css to fix some of the cells expanding their row size when selected.

There is specific CSS for chrome and firefox to make it so that when a cell enters "edit mode", the cell size does not increase. Make sure this works for IE, and smoketest firefox/chrome, but if they don't work then it can be dropped.

 

Also, any cell may enter "Edit" mode . Highlighting text on double click became disabled for non-edit mode cells. This is to replicate cell copy/paste later on. Cells that can enter "edit" mode but are not currently supported display the plain text (AKA - you can highlight the text again, but not edit it)
column108:
24/Oct/19 3:18 PM;ScottSummerford;Per discussion with JP -
 * When a cell enters edit, it may resize the cell if that was the largest cell in the row. This is acceptable as this may be fixed by column or row resizing, and should be an edge case. User testing can prove this otherwise if needed.
 * IE starts edit at the start of the cell. Firefox and Chrome start the edit at the end. There isn't a low cost path to fix that right now, so it is also acceptable pending user test.
column109: 25/Oct/19 11:53 AM;RyanFord;Does this story persist edits? Or are edits discarded once I close the Edit modal?
column110: 25/Oct/19 12:51 PM;ScottSummerford;From Teams - Edits are persisted until you close the modal. They are persisted on the front end  but not the back end, until the next story.
column111:
25/Oct/19 12:57 PM;ScottSummerford;Clarification for the acceptance criteria.

The "pipe" cursor is to be expected when you are hovering over a cell that is in edit mode (double clicked), not a cell that is editable but unselected.

column1: Project Transfer Step 3: Allow single click to add an object type

After usability discussion, single click to add an object type made the most sense.

column107:
26/Sep/19 12:13 PM;ScottSummerford;For Testing - 

Right now it is set to be on double click. If single clicking feels better during testing, that can be arranged.

The front end code was reworked for this story so it's good to thoroughly test. (CSS fixes are separate stories). The only css change was adding an on hover color change; testing that should be minimal.
 * Test that double clicking something fills the first empty slot for it's appropriate row.
 * Test that doing a pair modification resets the match for the corresponding steps but not for the other pairs.
 * Test that dragging a type to a empty match adds it
 * Test that dragging to the wrong match side does not add it to that side
 * Test that dragging back into the appropriate column resets it.
 * There was no swapping for matches. There is no swapping for matches. This rework will make it easier for a **future story**
column108:

Otherwise, passes test. Alan saw it and likes the double click option.

column1: Create first design iteration of Spreadsheet editing in an Objects page dialog
column29:
Based on our meeting on 8/12/2019, it seemed like the best approach for meeting the spreadsheet like editing requirement of the TTA was to add a popup on the Objects page that allows inline editing.

It is worth considering whether or not to use a continuous scroll approach to pagination. MEW uses something like this and Drew found it simpler to deal with (heard 2nd hand)
column79:
Objects page:
- There's a way to open the data in your list in an editable table
- The data you're currently viewing is in the table.
- There is a way to edit the content of a cell.
- There is a plan for how row selection would work when this becomes a full page.
- There is an indication for showing whether or not a cell is editable
- As an editable cell loses focus, changes are saved automatically
- Inline editing behaviors are defined.
- There's a way to close the modal
- There is some indicator to let the users know that a save is happening.
column107:
22/Aug/19 10:59 AM;JohnSieck;See attached.  Users request:
 * Maintain visual context of table when transitioning from Objects page to Edit state.  If columns shift around a lot or drastically change size, if sorting changes, or other visual contexts are changed, the user will likely have a hard time transitioning. 
 * When modal opens, column sizes are automatically set depending on width of content and overall width of table, but they can be manually adjusted by user.
 * When modal opens, sort order of Objects page table is maintained.  User can choose to sort on any column and that sort should be maintained between the two tables as the user moves back and forth.
 * User can filter the contents of the table via a text search / filter.  This enables them to narrow down the number of rows to more easily find and edit data.
 * Since we are auto-saving on the fly, users would like the ability to undo an edit or sequences of edits (just like Excel).
 * When hovering over a cell that is editable, the cursor changes to the pipe-y icon (just like when editing content in an Excel cell or a Word document.
 * When editing a cell, upon losing focus, the cell's contents save and the Saved button changes to Saving... just like the Manage People page.
 * When a cell has focus but is not in edit mode, arrow keys navigate individual cells.
 * Tab moves to the next cell in the row (or if at the end of the row the first cell in the next row).
 * Enter moves to the first cell in the next row.
 * When a cell is in edit mode, clicking enter moves the focus to the next cell down in that column.  This, of course, causes the save to kick off for the previous cell.
 * Clicking in an editable cell allows the user to edit the contents of the cell.

The importance of this feature will largely depend on performance on our largest data sets; 1000-2000 objects and 10-15 columns.

column79:
- List of objects is shown with a paginated list
- The table shows an initial list of results (50)
- The status header bar shows the total number of items in the list (regardless of the number of pages currently retrieved).
- The column header is locked in place (it does not scroll off when you scroll down)
- Users can change to other data pages, which updates the list of rows in the table.
- If a page does not load, you see an error message in the message bar (with JP-ANE)
column107:
03/Sep/19 10:04 PM;JohnSieck;Here are some things to consider when deciding between infinite scrolling and pagination:

*Infinite scrolling* is a technique that allowing users to scroll through a massive chunk of content with no finishing-line in sight. This technique simply keeps refreshing a page when you scroll down it. infinite scrolling offers an _efficient way to browse that ocean of information_, without having to wait for pages to preload.  Infinite scrolling is almost a must-have feature for _discovery interfaces_. When the user does not search for something specific so they need to see a large amount of items to find the one thing they like.

Pros:
 * offers an efficient way to browse an ocean of information
 * scrolling provides even better usability than slicing up the text to several separate screens or pages.

Cons:
 * page performance will increasingly slow down**
 * Item search and location - when users get to a certain point in the stream, they _can’t bookmark_ their location and come back to it later. And in some implementations clicking the back button doesn't return you to your previous place in the data
 * scroll bars don’t reflect the actual amount of data available.

*Pagination* is good when the user is _searching_ for something in particular within the list of results, not just scanning and _consuming_ the flow of information.  Pagination works by presenting a set number of rows in a view, with the ability to navigate to another set. This example provides the ability to [customize the row count per view|https://miro.medium.com/max/800/1*yLNoP3bNRc37jHn28Mqucg.jpeg]. Infinite scroll often replaces this pattern. Infinite scroll progressively loads results as a user scrolls. Infinite scroll works well for discovery websites but is usually disastrous for prioritization apps.

Pros:
 * Good for searching withing results, not just consuming the flow
 * Sense of control - Infinite scrolling is like an endless game — no matter how far you scroll, you feel like you’ll never get to the end. 
 * Item location - Having a paginated interface lets the user keep a _mental location_ of the item. 

Cons:
 * Extra actions - To get to the next page in a pagination, the user has to find the link target (e.g. “Next”), hover the mouse over it, click it and wait for the new page to load.

 

*When To Use Infinite Scrolling/Pagination?*

It's best suited for sites and apps that are _streams of user-generated content_ (Twitter, Facebook, Pinterest, Instagram). Pagination, on the other hand, is well-suited for goal-oriented sites and apps. Which are we?

Google is a good illustration for this point. Google Images uses infinite scroll because users are able to scan and process images much more quickly than text. Google Search uses pagination.  Reading a search result takes much longer. This is the reason why their Google Search results still use the more traditional pagination technique.
column108: 04/Sep/19 9:10 AM;MattChild;Based on the description it seems like we are both user generated content and a goal oriented site. We are going to have a LOT of text and not a lot of images, which makes it seem like pagination will be better. Further pushing towards pagination, I am not sure how the text search would work if we used infinite scroll, and the performance of the client machine may also matter because they're showing a LOT of cells (which is also a problem on the current object's page)

column1: Error when trying to save Ryan Scranton user account on NSERC.
column29:
Attached is the error when trying to update Ryan's user account on NSERC.

 

Dev note: What projects a user has access to is stored in two places. When adding/removing a user from a project and when saving a user in EM, both those places are updated. When project management was implemented, a lot of error checking during add/remove was done (can't add a user who isn't in the enterprise, return an error if user is already in the project, etc). These seem to be causing user's to get into a state where what project they are in is updated in one place, but not the other and it causes any further changes from happening. In these instances, the only way to fix it so far has been to go into the database and remove users from _Users in a project and/or all the aspnet tables in the enterprise database.

column1: Design initial approach to analyzing data quality
column29:
After initial discussion with Alison about potential approaches and how they meet the 'Data Quality' objective, it was decided that being able to group by dates in the pie chart was the best intersection of utility and cost.

After initial research and discussion with PST, this is a list of the types of dates that they usually track:
- Start and end dates
- Capability dates (projected)
- Awarded dates
- Ship avail dates
- SCD approval dates
- Last updated date
- Recent changes
- Last reviewed (for documents, Nate's group does this 3 times a year)
- Deploy dates

For data quality, this almost certainly revolves around dates in the past. However, from this list, it makes sense to also look at dates from the future. One suggestion which seemed sound was to take a look at some of the ways we group data already (for instance, in the visualizer) and use that as inspiration.

Some date groups that sounded be useful:
- 1 week/30 days/90/1 year/ more than 1 year (for how recently the data has been updated, and is critical for meeting 'data quality')
- Next 5 fiscal years (or previous)
- Next 4 fiscal quarters (or previous)
- Next 5 calendar years (or previous)

In how they would use a date grouping filter, there was some uncertainty. In brainstorming, Nate thought one use case would be to find things that are mandated to be viewed in a year to predict workload (as in, to make sure there is enough staff to execute the reviews).
column79:
- A list of the initial grouping strategies for date attributes (see description)
- Rough sketch of the design of how you configure a date attribute in a pie chart.
column107:
29/Oct/19 11:57 AM;MattChild;Review comments:
- What's in the display tab?
- Having the parenthesis after the field label feels cluttered - if the parenthesis add clarity, why not label the field with them?
- Looking at the Measurement / Dimension words without the explanatory note, I'm not clear on the difference between what Measurement and Dimension are configuring. Your note provides a lot more clarity - Measurement is "Attribute" and "Dimension" is "Binning method".
- I think the auto bin needs more detail but we can do that as a part of story elaboration.
- I think the 30 days / 90 days group option needs more elaboration but that can also be done during story elaboration.
- In your note under pie settings, you should say "use a date as a grouping" rather than "use a number as a grouping".
column108:
29/Oct/19 12:28 PM;JohnSieck;In response to Matt's comments because I cannot seem to reply to a comment:

Display tab is where use can set options for labels, color, etc.

Parenthesis is explanatory because I am unsure about the labels.  What will make sense to the user when we are asking them to organize by two fields both of which provide a type of "grouping" in the users' mind?

Feel free to suggest alternative labels for Measurement, Dimension, Group by, Auto Bin, etc.  Ultimately, we will need to sit with users and see what makes sense to them.
column109:
29/Oct/19 5:03 PM;JohnSieck;If dates are important, why not use a Histogram? A Histogram visualizes the distribution of data over a continuous interval or certain time period. Each bar in a histogram represents the tabulated frequency at each interval/bin.  Histograms help give an estimate as to where values are concentrated, what the extremes are and whether there are any gaps or unusual values. They are also useful for giving a rough view of the probability distribution.

!https://datavizcatalogue.com/methods/images/anatomy/histogram.png!

Pie charts are good for comparing a given category (one slice) within the total of a single Pie Chart, for giving the reader a quick idea of the proportional distribution of the data. They cannot show more then a few values, because as the number of values shown increases, the size of each segment/slice becomes smaller. This makes them unsuitable for large amounts of data.

Are we trying to fit a square peg in a round chart?
column110:
01/Nov/19 4:52 PM;MattChild;Based on our discussion, you can close this. I will add my suggestions for bins to the epic.

FYI, Matt Wilson wants a bar chart too.
