column108:
22/Nov/19 3:09 PM;NancyKraus;Things to know/test:
 # Example syntax in template is <# RelatedItemsAsTable::MTB35:: Animal :: Short Name, Status :: FilterByColumn||Short Name||Contains||Cat :: SortByColumn||Short Name||Ascending #>
 ## RelatedItemsAsTable
 ## Current Object Type (going away in follow on story)
 ## Related Object Type caption
 ## Related attribute captions to include in table, separated by comma
 ## Options: FilterByColumn
 ### Attribute caption to filter on (does not have to be included in #4)
 ### contains/not contains/equals/not equals (case insensitive, whitespace insensitive, plurality insensitive)
 ### Text value to filter on
 ## Optional: SortByColumn
 ### Attribute caption to sort on (does not have to be included in #4)
 ### ascending/asc/descending/desc (case insensitive)
 # FilterBy and SortBy are optional
 # There can be multiple filter bys
 # There can be 2 sorts (orderby, thenby)

Expected Errors:
 # Overall error writing table - error message appears in PowerPoint instead of table
 # Error parsing the shortcode - error message appears in PowerPoint instead of table
 # Related Node Type does not exist in entire project = error message appears in PowerPoint instead of table
 # Attribute specified as column in table not found in related object type, error written in column in header row -(going away in follow on story)-
 # DateTime attributes can use the [[fy]] syntax to convert to fiscal year
 ## If error converting date, error displayed in cell instead of fiscal year

Use staging to verify functionality - just use a template to uses Name instead of Caption
column109:
26/Nov/19 1:39 PM;NancyKraus;Testing Issues:
 # Change "Object Type not found" error to indicate an error occurred writing a table  - Fixed
 # Filter and Sort not working as expected  - Fixed
 ** Occurs if multiple tables are included in the slide template with almost identical shortcodes. Example, if one contains a filter and the other does not, the unfiltered table will show instead of the filtered one
 # No errors if FilterByColumn or SortByColumn is mispelled - Fixed. Rule is not applied and a warning is at the bottom of table
 # No errors if Filter/Sort rule is invalid - Fixed. Rule is not applied and warning is at bottom of table

column79: #NAME?

21/Nov/19 1:51 PM;PeterMorrissey;POC: Peter

Dependencies: None

Testing: Test basic and advanced
column108:
22/Nov/19 1:58 PM;RyanScranton;UI Issues (See pictures attached of Legend on Latest and Legend on Sprint):
1. Are we okay with the new bar of color instead of the box in the previous legend?
2. There is a space between the number and percent sign for all Valid values in the legend. There is no space for the No Valid Data option. We need to decide which way to go and be consistent. 
3. Do we want "No Valid Data" showing if that is at 0%? It may be unnecessary. 

Bugs:
1. The count for "No Valid Data" always shows "0%"
column109:
25/Nov/19 9:47 AM;ScottSummerford;If all data for the single select is filtered out, nothing is rendered for the pie chart, and no valid data is still 0%. I would expect a full circle of 100% no valid data.

If you change to table view, apply a filter, and change back to pie view, it does not update the pie chart and the results are inaccurate

If a story thread is saved to open as a Pie chart, and you change to the table view, there is an infinite loading spinner and the menu immediately re-opens. If you try to change to the table view again, sometimes it will continually bounce open/close and sometimes it will actually load the table.
column110:
25/Nov/19 10:17 AM;PeterMorrissey;_Are we okay with the new bar of color instead of the box in the previous legend?_
 * Yes - it was an unfortunate consequence of moving to the Kendo Legend, but JP approved it.

_There is a space between the number and percent sign for all Valid values in the legend. There is no space for the No Valid Data option. We need to decide which way to go and be consistent._ 
 * This needs JP - personally, I think the space looks weird as all can be, but what do I know?

_Do we want "No Valid Data" showing if that is at 0%? It may be unnecessary._
 * No, this is a bug.

_If all data for the single select is filtered out, nothing is rendered for the pie chart, and no valid data is still 0%. I would expect a full circle of 100% no valid data._
 * If there are zero objects being returned by the filter, there should be a placeholder rendered. If there isn't, that's a bug. 'No valid data' is for when there are objects, they just don't have a valid grouping.

_If you change to table view, apply a filter, and change back to pie view, it does not update the pie chart and the results are inaccurate_
 * This is a bug, though likely not from this story. Should be fixed anyway.

_If a story thread is saved to open as a Pie chart, and you change to the table view, there is an infinite loading spinner and the menu immediately re-opens. If you try to change to the table view again, sometimes it will continually bounce open/close and sometimes it will actually load the table._
 * I'd need to take a closer look to tell you what's going on there
column111:
25/Nov/19 11:22 AM;PeterMorrissey;Things that need to be fixed for this story to close:
 * No Valid Data should not be shown if there is no ungrouped data
 * If there are zero objects being returned by a filter, a placeholder should show
column112:
25/Nov/19 1:53 PM;NancyKraus;* Don't always show No Valid Data - Fixed
 * Show placeholder for no filter results - Fixed
 * (New) Switching from table to pie chart crashed - Fixed

column1: Make project DB & user DB creation scripts for MDA
column29:
In order to get Informedb installed on the MDA networks, we cannot use our normal procedure of restoring a .bak file - it would go through a 3 month process with their IA team before they would release it. SQL scripts go through substantially quicker, so we need to create a script to create the user and project databases so that we can run Informedb on their servers.

If Tram runs into issues with script, support fixing.
column79:
- SQL script that creates an empty user DB
- SQL script that creates an empty project DB
- SQL script that adds a default user and project
- Users are able to login and perform basic functions when an Informedb instance is pointed to that User DB (smoke test)
- Give script to Tram to test

column1: Notification: Close action inconsistency
column29:
When a user "closes" a notification, it disappears from their list of notifications. However, it does not always disappear from the list of notifications for other users. There are two use cases:
 # Close Inbox Notification
 ## Notification no longer listed in recipient's inbox notifications
 ## Notification no longer listed in sender's sent notifications
 # Close Sent Notification
 ## Notification is still listed in recipient's inbox notifications
 ## Notification no longer listed in sender's sent notifications

column1: Spreadsheet Modal: Select all text when double clicking in a cell
column29:
Reported by Ryan Scranton.

It would be nice if when a user double clicks into a cell the entire contents of the cell are selected instead of being defaulted to the beginning of the string. 

Notes:
This is the way Excel works, and it would make the spreadsheet behave in a manner consistent with their expectations. It also makes several options available to you with only using the keyboard:
- Add to the beginning of the cell (left arrow)
- Replace the enter cell text (any other key)
- Add to the end of the cell (right arrow)

05/Dec/19 11:08 AM;JohnSieck;I would like to see a UI overhaul as one of the steps so the application is optimized for consistency and usability. Usability entails the features in the app are more complete (i.e. being able to CRUD story threads from the story thread page). The tech debt we incurred was doing the minimum to satisfy a contract item and then often never being able to return to complete a feature to make it truly helpful.  Perhaps we prioritize by what we think the customer will not pay for in the normal course of business.  Here's some UI areas we could address:
 * Login page (first impression)
 * Homepage (also first impression)
 * Filter feature (panel filter options like [Metabase .33|https://www.metabase.com/blog/0.33/index.html] save vertical space for tabular data)
 * Nav and Command bar
 ** rethink breadcrumbs as positioning of command bar actions is better suited on left
 * Support site / Help (it's 2020, it's time to upgrade from PDFs)
 * Notifications - necessary to set up for future success
 * Design page
 ** Working with a taxonomy should not be so hard or take so long
 ** Rethink and reorganize where things go
 * Object list page
 * Edit an object
 * Visualizations in website to tilt the balance towards web and away from GARD/Java
 * Story Thread list page (still needed? rename?)
 * Reports
 ** add list view
 ** add PPT
 ** add Word
 * Activity component to include in Details panel or other places
column108: 06/Dec/19 12:00 PM;JosephWallace;As part of a UI overhaul, I'd like to see a more concerted effort to design & implement "Lego" components we can plug together instead of having a lot of one-off CSS for each page
column109: 06/Dec/19 4:46 PM;JosephWallace;RBAC needs to be made both performant and foolproof.
column110:
11/Dec/19 1:02 PM;NancyKraus;# Fix database structure so schema is not based on user actions
 # Implement a consistent backend (api controller -> business -> service(s) -> repository(s) -> EF model)
 # Implement a consistent what to connect to database via EF
 ** Remove Link2SQL usage
 ** Remove SqlCommand usage
 ** Remove DataSet1 usage
 # Fix domain model for object types and objects
 ** Remove legacy models (MRMObjectType, MRMAttribute, MRMObject)
 ** Make ID, Last Date Modified, ShortName/Label not attributes but properties on an object
 ** Make attributes strongly typed (each type is a class, not one class that acts differently based on an enumeration)
 # Upgrade to at least Identity 2.0
 # Make it a true SPA with a WebAPI (remove dependency on MVC and Razor)
 # Remove dependency on Current Project for all API calls and controller actions
 # Implement better way for SQL updates (EF data migrations and/or SQL Projects)
 # Make RBAC performant
 # Re-think and re-do how change log works
 # Resolve Nuget package inconsistencies (projects using different versions of same Nuget package)
 # Enterprise Manager
 # Database connection pooling
 # Log file management via Enterprise Manager

column1: Data Quality v1
column29:
As a project manager, I want to be able to see charts that give me an indication of data quality to check and see if the data is up to date and complete so I can be sure that what I'm presenting is accurate and make sure my team is providing inputs in a timely manner.

Scope: 0.5 sprint

Contract language:
====================================
This is feature #38 from the TTA / SSDS requirement options list. It satisfies a statement TTA Task 2 (Subtask ID 5).
- SimVentions will design and develop data quality algorithms based on field completeness and attribute values.  

Initial Design Approach Key Points:
====================================
Story thread "Pie Chart" Visualization Page
- You can select dates as the tallied attribute for the pie chart.
- When you select a date attribute, you have some options for selecting ways of grouping those dates together into bins.
- One of the bins is useful for categorizing the LastDateModified attribute.

Elaborated implementation ideas:
====================================
Initial suggestions for bins are below. Name of bin, followed by the grouping mechanism.
- Recent Past (91+ days ago, 61-90 days ago, 31-60 days ago, 0-30 days ago, future, no date)
-- This meets the "data quality" requirement when selecting last date modified (referenced above).
- Near Future (Past, 0-30 days, 31-60 days, 61-90 days, 90+ days, no date)
- Past Years (more than 3 years ago, 2-3 years ago, 1-2 years ago, 0-1 year ago, future, no date)
- Future Years (past, 0-1 year, 1-2 years, 2-3 years, more than 3 years, no date).

Other possible suggestions and ideas:
- Future quarters (Before now, next 4 quarters including this one, after this year, no date)
- Past quarters (Before this year, previous 4 quarters including this one, after now, no date)
- Current year (Before this year, Q1, Q2, Q3, Q4
- Long term outlook (Before now, 1-5 years, 5-10 years, 11-15 years, 16-20 years, after 20 years, no date).

Years would be useful as either calendar or fiscal, but fiscal is the most important.

column1: Recycle Bin: Objects are not ordered
column29:
Whenever you delete or restore an object in the recycle bin, the whole page is refreshed.

This causes an issue when you have a large number of objects in the bin, because the Recycle bin does not seem to be ordered in any way, and after you perform an action you will now have to sift through the whole list again to find your object.

column29:
* When the search panel scrolls, you scroll the whole page.
 * When you dismiss the search panel, you have to type instead of clicking / entering to get more results. In combination with the above issue, it gets very annoying to add things manually.
 * I believe this component is also used to add / remove related objects on edit details, so the issues are probably duplicated there.

column1: Object Details: Recent changes does not show New or Old value if it is blank
column29:
The recent changes for an object does not include the New/Old value if it was blank. 

 

Scenario 1:
 * Attribute1 is blank and then changed to "Hello World"
 * Recent Changes shows: New Value: "Hello World"

 

Scenario 2:
 * Attribute1 is "Hello World" and then changed to blank
 * Recent Changes shows: Old Value: "Hello World"

 

Confirmed on staging
column107:
11/Dec/19 2:12 PM;MattChild;The only time this may impact a user if it was an intermittent blanking, (not the 1st or most recent edit). Since it isn't telling them anything wrong, we can handle this with training if it starts coming up more.

Deferring from release since this is existing behavior.

column1: Object Details: Recent changes shows hidden attributes
column29:

column107:
11/Dec/19 2:09 PM;MattChild;Hidden attributes don't have a clear conception of what they are and how they are used. We shouldn't take action on this until there's a more clear purpose/intent for it.

Deferring this since it is existing behavior.

column1: Attribute RBAC is not enforced server-side
column29:
RBAC is not currently enforced for attributes beyond being disabled in the UI.

This happens because the EditDetails method in the MRMController synthesizes an MRMObject to save whose attributes all have ID = 0; the guts of the saving do RBAC tests on the attribute ID but use the attribute name to actually make the save.
column79: - even if the UI says you can edit an object, the server ignores the edit if you aren't actually allowed to
column107:
09/Dec/19 11:36 AM;JosephWallace;Testing:
- put your user in an RBAC group
- create a rule allowing that group to edit a particular field (Short Name or Description work fine)
- in another tab, load the object details page and enter edit mode
- change the rule to read-only or denied and save the rule
- in the already-open editor, change the value and hit save
- the save should not take effect; the old value should appear after save and after a refresh.

column1: Creating PowerPoints across multiple object types
column29:
Users want to be able to generate power points that include multiple object types. The easiest / most likely candidate for this is on the story threads page (like we do with Word reports). Users would pick a template from a local file on their computer - it would not be saved with the story thread.

 This is feature #42 from the TTA / SSDS requirement options list. It satisfies a statement TTA Task 5 (Subtask ID 20). It is faster to implement than the more expensive (but more useful) option of building a web-based power point builder (see related issue)

column1: PowerPoint generation across multiple object types
column29:
Users want to be able to generate power points that include multiple object types. The easiest / most likely candidate for this is on the story threads page (like we do with Word reports). Users would pick a template from a local file on their computer - it would not be saved with the story thread.

 This is feature #42 from the TTA / SSDS requirement options list. It satisfies a statement TTA Task 5 (Subtask ID 20). It is faster to implement than the more expensive (but more useful) option of building a web-based power point builder (see related issue)

During epic grooming, this was estimated between 2 - 3 Sprints, and a large t-shirt size.
column107:
21/Oct/19 4:45 PM;MattChild;Our initial refinement looked at how applying multiple templates and not changing the template format at all. We have since changed that approach, but I added it as a comment here for posterity:

During example mapping on 10/11/2019, we discovered these outcomes:

*Stories:*
- Preview: .pptx file downloaded with one object of the selected object type

*Rules:*
- Object types can be reordered
- New object types are added at the end (when, for example, a new object type is added to the filter)
- In the generated PowerPoint, all the objects of a single type will be listed together (e.g., all the objects in "A", then all the objects in "B", then all the objects in "C").
- PowerPoint report file output can contain data about more than 1 object type
- User can choose from an existing template for a given object type or upload their own template
- A template can only contain data from one object type
- Report types cannot be converted (i.e., PPT to Word, or Word to Excel, etc.)
- Object types that are selected in the filter appear in the list of object types for which you can pick templates
- Removing an object type from the filter removes the object type from the list of object types for which you can choose templates
- The "Download template" link gives you a dynamically generated .pptx file that would have all the attributes and related objects from a field of that type


*Pending Questions:*
- If user has not picked a template for an object type, what happens?
-- Don't include in output
-- Placeholder
-- Field level error
-- Warn, then ask, do you want to export anyway?
-- Use a default template if available
- If there are no templates, what does the dropdown selector show? (is it just an upload button, an empty combo, etc.)
- If all objects are filtered out of an object type, what is output in the generated file?
- If all objects are filtered out of an object type, is that object type shown in the list to select a template for?
-- Matt: After thinking, my instinct is yes. If you had a rule based on date, and changed the date value so that it returned 0 results, it would be really weird to have the template you've picked disappear.
- How big will the list get? How will it scroll?
- Can you see the filter results?
- If there is an error is it displayed on the page or in the console?
- What should "Download template" be called?
- Are the objects sorted? how?

column1: Spreadsheet Modal: Can save empty strings in required fields
column29:
Reported by: Ryan Scranton

String attributes can be saved even if they are required.

Notes:
We should examine our approach to required fields before taking action on this. There are alternate ways of getting fields populated that do not honor the "required field" attribute (like project transfer or excel import). It is useful for those transfers to be quick and easy and not have a lot of steps to resolve. This may indicate that we need a perspective shift from "required" to "important", which would impact how we think about solving this issue.

column1: Story Threads \ Pie Chart: Handle missing "Group by" attributes
column29:
Developer note:

- update FilteredNodeBusiness/calculatePieChartResults() to check if groupBy attribute exists - if not, return empty results
column79:
- Attribute is empty is the same as an object type not having that attribute.
- If object type is removed from filter, the "group by" attribute selection stays and if nothing else has that attribute the results all return as "no data".

All it's data should show in the pie chart as "No data" if:
- A grouped attribute is deleted from the object type
- A grouped attribute is renamed in an object type
- No attribute selected
- RBAC denied on object type
- RBAC denied on attribute

For each of the above, must test:
- Changes while you're editing pie chart settings
- Changes before you get to the filter (previously configured, and now the configuration is bad).

column1: Formatting issues with the related items table
column29:
The following attributes need to be formatted better in the Related Items Table:
* Date: should not show the time stamp
* Money should show the dollar sign. It also shows to three decimal places regardless if there are decimals or not. 
* Attachment and Images: The title of the attachment or the image should show in the field, not the guid. 
* Table: should not show anything if present in the related items table.

column1: Crashes when debugging website on load
column29: When debugging the website, often times the site will crash in UnityConfig.cs in RegisterTypes. This causes delays every time the developer is trying to debug this quickly. Each crash costs a few minutes to wait for the site to recover. That adds up over time.

column1: Advanced Filter: Invalid Options warning appearing when it shouldn't
column29:
Project "AUT Testing Rift"
- Advanced Filter with "Full Attribute" Object Type selected
- Filter on LAV Contains "a".
- Click the object type drop down where "Full Attribute" is currently selected.

The warning "Invalid options. Objects below do not contain the specified filter criteria. To make them valid, try changing criteria or adding a new rule" appears when it should not.


As far as I can tell, it's only an issue with LAVs
column79: "Invalid Options" warning only appears when all options are invalid
column107:
03/Dec/19 11:00 AM;MattChild;This is because other object types don't have the "LAV" field. The wording of the message is confusing.

We may also want to consider not making it an error state and just letting people filter on a field they don't have - just return empty results. Removing the assumption that filters are based on well-formed data is a stepping stone to make taxonomy changes easier and less impactful. It's still useful to see the list of objects that don't have that field - and keeping them in separate lists within the drop down would still be helpful.

Even if we do keep the disabling behavior, the message should be reworded to make it clear it's talking about the object types below and the fields you are filtering on.

column1: Recycle Bin: Delete from recycle bin not removing data
column29:
When a user deletes an object that is in the recycle bin, all entries in the change log for that object are marked as "Purged" but no data is removed. This can cause the change log to continue to grow.

 

Consulting with Christy, the only data point that should be retained is the entry that indicated the object was deleted. Everything else can be removed. NOTE, those entries should only be removed when the object is deleted from the recycle bin. If the object is restored instead, the user would want to still have the history of the object.

column1: New installations can't import Excel files without manual steps
column29:
Drew ran into this issue with his SAIC install. Brad could not import Excel files and was running into errors. After some research, the "Files\Import" directory is not automatically created in the web root directory in a new install. The application does not try and create this directory when the excel file is saved.

One thing that we may want to considere when creating this is creating a new "Working files" directory that is configurable from the web.config. This would get us closer to being able to do a "clean install" rather than "install overtop" when deploying a new version, which has sometimes resulted in very unpleasant bugs. STIGs prevent you from using a shared workspace for temporary / working files, so we can't use the built in ASP.NET "temp file" location (since it is potentially a security leak since other web applications also use the same shared space).

column1: Spreadsheet Modal: Edit button disabled based on filtered objects
column29: On the Object List page, the Edit button is disabled if all objects are filtered out when the user uses Filter Options and Date Filter. This was originally done because the modal was going to show objects based on those filters. When that changed, the Edit button should have been re-enabled if there were any objects for the object type, regardless of Filter Options and Date Filter.

column1: PowerPoint: Performance Improvement
column29:
When generating slides, all the information for the objects plus what they are related to is retrieved. This can cause the slide generation to take along time even if only the short name is being exported.

Instead, the template should be checked first to determine what information needs to be retrieved BEFORE retrieving any data.

column1: Filtered Story Thread: implement "static" Add Filter area
column29:
To make room for the settings button, add a static filter row from which users can specific filter criteria and add that criteria. See attached.

Filter and implementation ought to be common across Story Thread and Reports

The "Rule" bar now becomes the area containing the Title for the Story Thread name and Report name.
column79:
- Add Rule is renamed Add Filter
- Add action can be triggered by key press combination Shift + A
- Clicking Add Filter button creates a new filter row and slides any existing rows down with a .2s animation
- When filter overlay reaches (TBD: 1/2, 2/3, 100% of page?) a scroll bar is added to the filter overlay.
- Overlay background color is #F8F8F8 (neutralLighterAlt)
- Title bar contains the expand / collapse chevron, the Title and the Settings button (move it from the command bar)
- When modifying the static row, changes do not change the filter results until you hit the "add filter" button.
- Other rows that are modified (besides the static row) do automatically update the filter)
- Smoke test all advanced filter stuff

column29: This should fix the related issue (INF-3499).
column79:
- Rule editor is initially collapsed
- Chevron is shown next to thread name
- Number of filters is shown next to thread name.
- Clicking either chevron, # filters, or thread name shows an overlay of the advanced rule editor.
- Filter pop over blocks view of graph / results
- Filter state (open or closed) does not persist
- If making this change changes reports also (for ~free), then keep it! If it doesn't, then it is okay to separate them

column1: Fix edge case with file upload widget
column29:
Currently, the file browser only updates the widget if you pick a different file from the file that you previously used the browser for.

If you browse for a file, drag in a different file, then browse back to the original, the file browser won't pick up on the change.

Presumably the browser <input> component is not being cleared/updated when a file is dragged in.
column79:
1. use "Browse For File..." to select a file ("File A")
2. *drag* a *different* file into the widget ("File B")
3. use "Browse for File..." to re-select File A
4. File A should appear in the widget, instead of File B sticking around

column1: PowerPoint Report Details: Verify uploaded file is powerpoint file
column29: Verify the file the user uploads is a valid powerpoint file. If it is not, display an error to the user. If it is, allow the download to continue.

column107:
18/Nov/19 4:49 PM;JohnSieck;Feedback from PST:

Like: Sharing

Like: Activity

Want: to be able to name / rename a scenario

?   Is there an undo button?

?    Workflow for publishing approval? Submit for approval. Choose who to send it to.

? Duplicate a scenario. I have done a bunch of work and come to a crossroads. Rather than creating another scenario from scratch I want to be able to duplicate the one I am on and start from where I am.

Request: Create a brand new project based on a scenario

Like:  Ability to compare (aka like old EDX) between:
         two scenarios
         project and scenario before I publish
         project and scenario after I publish

Like: watermark idea ("Scenario" or "Draft" in background). Another idea is have another banner under the security banner or a border that goes all the way around the page.

?    When we export a pic from a scenario will the pic display the scenario look (i.e. if it has a black background that is a problem for my PPT)

Concern:   Changes auto-pushed from project to scenario could affect my COA. I would rather push/pull manually from project to scenario (and vice versa)

column1: Auto-Save on GARD files sometimes removes files
column29:
Some additional information.  The Story Thread is Filtered SW Version 11.14 Schedule, is seems to be happening on the newly created STs.  Rodney called me last week and said all the work we did is gone and the view profile is gone when I launched the ST.  I just thought he had done something wrong but in fact the GARD file had been wiped.

Let me know any additional information I can provide.

===============
-	Is it currently working for you? It seems to work at the time it’s saved and then and say a day or two when the ST is launched is when I noticed its wiped
-	Have you noticed this happening all the time, some of the time, or rarely? Ive only noticed this within the past couple weeks and it seem to be happening on the newly/recently created STs
-	When was the first time this happened? This is the second time Ive notice this in the past 2/3 weeks, I dismissed the first time.
-	Do you know the exact date / time of a modification that caused the file to get wiped? The GARD file seems to be fine the whole time Im working on the ST, I work make changes in the DB and the View profile and constantly save the GARD file back.  So its there at the time Im working on it, it seems as if its wiped between the last save and the next time the ST is launched.
-	Have you noticed this happening on any other projects, or only CEC? I don’t have an answer for this, sorry. The two specific STs this has happened to me are the Filtered SW Version 11.14 Schedule and the Filtered AC2 Milestone Chart.

====================

You mentioned you saved the file locally sometimes. 
-	Does the file get saved correctly? Yes
-	Can you manually upload it and have it work? Yes
-	Do those 2 story threads always cause the file to get wiped, or do they work sometimes? Those are just the two Ive noticed it happened to, both newly generated STs. Both generated within the last 3 weeks.  To be specific the first time it was noticed was on October 18th.  Rodney and I had worked on the new AC2 Milestone schedule all day on the 17th, making multiple changes and saving the GARD file back frequently because I was doing a lot of grouping and I didn’t want to lose it.  That next morning Rodney was to present to Program Office and called me first thing stating all the work we had done was gone.  That’s when I noticed the GARD file was wiped.  I uploaded from the file I saved locally and it worked fine.

column1: Story Thread: Add a Table settings pop-over
column79:
- There is a "Settings" button when the table visualization is selected.
- Clicking settings shows a pop-over for settings for that table.
- The settings option consists of being able to add or remove columns.
- Each column across every object type is listed.
- Changes take effect when you click "apply".
- "Cancel" closes the pop-over.
- Works for both basic and advanced story threads

column1: Story Thread: Save table settings
column29:
This story will also need to consider how this interacts with the toggle tabs at the bottom of the selected visualization (see related INF-3326). Initial thought was that the settings should be synchronized between the toggle tab and choosing a table as the visualization; it's just a quick shortcut to get to it without changing what the "real" visualization is for that story thread.

Error handling is not in this story; see INF-3398.
column79:
- When table settings are changed, this counts as "unsaved changes" for any save-required actions (e.g., launching the visualizer)
- When saved, settings are saved to the database
- After saving, when you come back to the story thread, it uses the same settings that were saved.
- If you do not save, when you come back to the story thread it uses the settings that were previously saved.
- Works for both basic and advanced story threads

column1: Spreadsheet Modal: Restrict edits based on RBAC permissions
column29: When implementing, also make sure RBAC rules restricting based on object type correctly constrain what a user may do so that it simplifies doing it for mixed types.
column79:
For all editable column types:
- RBAC "View" only cells are not editable
- RBAC rules restricting based on an attribute correctly constrain what a user may do.
- RBAC rules restricting based on an attribute value correctly constrain what a user may do.
- When a user's RBAC permissions are changed while they have the modal open, trying to make a change to a column they no longer have access to results in an error in the "saving" indicator.

column1: Change Log Export: RBAC rules are not applied
column29:
When the change log was updated in 2018, how information was pulled out of the database for the change log. Checking the data against the RBAC filter was missed. This allows data to leak.

 

Developer Notes:

Short term fix: Run the results retrieved from the database thru the existing RBAC Filter code (see MRMDataAPI/ChangeLog.cs/filterChangeLogItemForRBAC)

Better short term fix: apply the RBAC rules when retrieving code from the database instead of check each object individually. Some still needs to be done individually, but a first pass should apply when getting info from database.
column79: - When you run a change log export, you don't see objects or attributes that you have an RBAC rule that "DENY"s you.

column1: Update Typescript to 3.7
column29:
At the start of ~ 11/2019 Typescript 3.7 was released, which includes a couple of useful features.

We currently use 3.6.3, and according to the release notes there should be little to no breaking changes barring 1 -

If you tried to invoke a function as a property, it now shows as an error (ex. tester.doThis vs tester.doThis() - doThis is a function )

This should only be breaking if we've done something bad, and it'd most likely be a bug in the code anyways.
column79:
- Project still builds under typescript 3.7.
- Site still works when deployed.

Highlighting works normally in chrome

column1: Story Thread Pie Chart: Future Quarters
column29:
Subtasks:
- Add $bin_type bin type
- Update calculate to process $bin_type type
- For Free:
-- Apply
-- Save
-- Showing pie chart
-- Showing legend
column79:
- "Future Quarters" is an option in the binning drop down
- Future Quarters bins are: Past, this quarter, next quarter, 2 quarters from now, 3 quarters from now, 4 or more from now, no date.
- Pie chart legend displays actual year and quarter corresponding to bin selection (i.e., the options in the chart would read: Past, Q1 FY20, Q2 FY20, Q3 FY20, Q4 FY20, Q1 FY22 or After, No date)
- Sort order of the legend values is ascending (earliest time first - see above)
- Q1's bin starts on Oct 1 of the previous named year and ends Dec 31 of that year (Oct 1 2019 is Q1 FY20).
- Pie chart shows the correct the results

column1: Spreadsheet Modal: Add a quick search
column29:
PST User Feedback - 8/29/2019
- Rank: 3
- Bucket: 3

Product Team Feedback - 9/5/2019
- Rank: 25
- Bucket: 7

During discussion, users made sure to emphasize it was imperative that it search ALL of the results, not just the currently viewed page.

This was discussed when JP and Matt reviewed the initial mock-ups and discussed his research with PST for INF-3157:

- User can filter the contents of the table via a text search / filter.  This enables them to narrow down the number of rows to more easily find and edit data.

Answered Questions:
- Do we search as you type or is there a "go" button?
-- This may depend on whether or not we go back to the server for search queries.
- Can you search for newline?
-- No.
column79:
- There is a search box in the table header of the modal
- Typing in text further filters the results
- Search is a plain text search of all field values
- Searching is done with "contains"
- Search ignores case
- Removing the search criteria unfilters the list
- If there are no results, there is an empty state signifying no results are found.
- Rows that do not contain the searched text in any of the table columns are removed.
- The "total" number of results is updated to the number of rows that match the search text.

column1: PowerPoint Reports: Can you / how do you remove a template?
Create v1 design of project "Sandbox" data set
column29:
Questions that should be addressed:
- How do users quickly compare visualizations from different sandboxes (per primary use case)
- How do users know whether they are in a sandbox mode or not?
- Where do users go to publish their changes?
- How do users view someone else's sandbox?
column79: #NAME?
column107:
01/Nov/19 4:33 PM;MattChild;Page 1:
- I like the overall look with the new command bar. I agree I think it will be important to have a simple listing of the scenarios defined on the project since they could become large.
- I like having the scenarios quick to access. We will have to define some scheme to make sure they don't overflow the menu and turn it into the project picker on the profile page.
- The top bar feels like it is getting crowded. "Reports" is not listed in there, and it keeps growing. It feels like filters and scenarios are both supporting elements, rather than primary elements, and shouldn't be a top level nav choice.
- The scenarios feel like they are a different kind of thing than the other things in the nav bar. They have the potential to affect everything that it shares the menu section with (data, filters, visualize, etc.), which makes it feel like it's in the wrong place. It seems like they should be in closer proximity to the project. I added a paper sketch to illustrate the thought.
column108:
01/Nov/19 4:37 PM;MattChild;Page 2:
- Should the project name be completely replaced by the scenario name? it seems like it would be easy to lose context / orientation. Seeing the scenario name definitely seems useful - maybe in parenthesis after the project name?
- Comparing to the original project will be really useful, but that feels like it should be more of a contextual action based on the description in the note (in the command bar of whatever view you're on) instead of a top level nav bar
- Publishing makes a lot of sense at the top level, since you're publishing the whole cenario.
- You might want to have a page that's a listing of the diffs of things that were changed in this project. This would be a natural place to do the publish from. Maybe that's the first page you see when you click the what if? We would also need that in the future if we were to archive what you changed for later review.
column109:
01/Nov/19 4:42 PM;MattChild;Page 3:
- Are you sure we should publish here? It's unclear to me whether it would publish the whole what if scenario, or only the changes viewed in the visualizer (which may be a subset). This could get you into some weird states where you have half a "what if" published.
- A simple mock up would be helpful (even if it was just a color replacement and some bad looking text superimposed in the bar
- In how I was imagining it would work, the visualizer would be tied to the way it was launched - if it was launched from "what if" mode, it would publish back to the "what if", if it was launched from regular mode, it would publish back to regular mode. If you start crossing, it may get very complicated very quickly (from both an understandability and an implementation standpoint).
column110: 05/Nov/19 3:17 PM;MattChild;Draft 3.1 looks good to me, it is conceptualized enough to start conversations with users. Can close the story as far as I am concerned.

column1: Story Threads: Design saving behavior for changes to the visualization
column29: Current saving behavior requires an explicit save. This may cause a conflict long term when you can edit the data; edits to the data will be auto saved, whereas edits to the story thread would require an explicit save.
column79: #NAME?
column107:
15/Oct/19 2:52 PM;MattChild;There was a lot of good discussion about this. 

JP and I went through a couple of resolutions to the potentially conflicting save behavior:

1. Make them all save an edit, and let users just make a copy of it if they don't want it to work with something that people depend on.
2. Display save on edit a different way from the save in the page (for instance, in a top status bar a la Microsoft Word)

Alan had some good points about the way that the site behaves now generally and that most actions require an explicit save. One of the key elements that they felt made Microsoft Word work in an "Always Save" environment was being able to undo.

Since the editing behavior will not come in until a future version, it is not critical to make this decision now - so deciding is deferred until that day is closer.

column1: Spreadsheet Modal: Add the ability to undo
column29:
If users are making quick edits, it would greatly increase their confidence in making changes if they could easily undo a change. The undos do not need to persist through page transitions, reloading, or closing the modal.

PST User Feedback - 8/29/2019
- Rank: 1
- Bucket: 1

Product Team Feedback - 9/5/2019
- Rank: 24
- Bucket: 6

This was discussed when JP and Matt reviewed the initial mock-ups and discussed his research with PST for INF-3157:

- Since we are auto-saving on the fly, users would like the ability to undo an edit or sequences of edits (just like Excel).

Answered Questions:
- Do we need a button to make users aware they can undo?
-- JP: We should defer this until we redo the objects page.
column79:
- Every time a user makes an edit, it is saved for later undoing.
- Hitting "ctrl-z" undoes the most recent edit.
- Undoing something triggers the saving progression.
- The size limit on undos is 100.
- If no edits have been made, "ctrl-z" does nothing.
- Changes can be undone while saving is in progress
- If a save is in progress, and you undo it, the "undone" action is applied immediately (it does not wait for the save to complete).
- If a save fails, it is removed from the list of undoable edits.

column1: Spreadsheet Modal: Show "Pending Tasks" when saving
column29:
Pending Questions:
- What does clear all look like?

This was a late addition after backlog refinement of the modal when thinking about how to display errors.

Product Team Feedback - 9/5/2019
- Rank: 26
- Bucket: 8
column79:
- When a saving progression starts, the indicator shows a down caret for pending tasks.
- Clicking the "Saving" button shows a summary of the save task that it is in progress.
- If another save starts before the current is complete, that save task is added to the list.
- When the save task is complete, it is removed from the list of pending tasks.
- When all save tasks are complete, the down caret is removed (and the button returns to the "Saved" state), the dialog is closed when it is open.
- Showing or hiding the caret does not change the size of the button.

column1: The minimum amount of functionality needed to make Dashboards viable.
column29:
MVP:
 - Dashboard List
 -- Users can create dashboards
 -- Users can see other peoples dashboards
 -- Dashboards are sorted by most recently used. (Matt rewrite as need statement)
 - Dashboard page
 -- Users can create questions
 -- Users can select a way to view their answer (timeline, table, connections)
 -- Users can add an existing question / answer pair
 -- Users can set a dashboard as their home page.
 -- Clicking on it goes to the visualizer for visual answers or to the data page for table-oriented answers.
 -- There is an option to get to the data page from the question/answer widget.
 -- There is a default picture for each answer widget type (schedule, table, etc.)

 - Visualizer
 -- Launches with tab selected from the viewed kind of answer (e.g., timeline)
 -- When you "save" the project, the project file is uploaded to the website and the picture from the tab of the ansewr's kind (e.g., timeline) replaces the existing picture.

Nice to have:
 – Dashboards record a visit count (to implement better sorting algorithms later)
 – List of most recently used dashboards in nav menu.
 – If the story thread is updated in the website, take a snapshot on the server side of the updated picture in the visualizer.

SubType is
Type1, Type2, Type 3

Grammatically, this looks it looks like it must be all of those things (which is how they understood the behavior). However, the intended behavior is that it is any one of those things.

In brainstorming, one suggestion seemed attractive:

SubType is
Type1, Type2, or Type 3

column1: Project Admin: Rev 1 design of the "Manage Data Access Rules" page
column29:
_PO, please confirm my assumptions._

Background
Given that Bob the Project Owner is on the Manage Rules page

Scenario: Add a rule
When Bob adds a rule
And enters valid data
And saves the new rule
Then the rule is saved and appears on the page

--------

A rule may have one group. A Project Owner may add a new group from the Rules page if the group they need does not appear in the list.

A rule has a description.

A rule specifies access for a combination of one or more object types, one or more attributes and criteria (aka conditions).

For example, If the object type is "Hardware" and its attribute value "Status" is equal to "Planning" then deny access to everyone in the "Managers" group.

Or here is a multiple example: If the object type is "Hardware" or "Software" and its attribute value "Maker" or "Company" contains "Microsoft" then deny access to everyone in the "Smart People" group.

The type of access is may be set to one of the following:
- Deny
- View only
- Allow editing
- Full access

column1: Project Admin: Data Access - Add support for specifying multiple object types in an RBAC rule
column29:
It would be helpful to be able to select multiple object types that an RBAC rule should be applied to so that you could reduce the total number of rules being created.

Rule: If multiple object types are created then only the attributes those object types have in common are displayed as options for the rule's criteria.

Use Case 1: As a user I want to be able to deny access to a litany of object types.  Currently I have to create one rule per object type.  I would like to be able to create one rule with many object types to perform this task more efficiently.

Use Case 2: As a user I want to be able to deny access to any object type that was created before Jan 1, 1980.  Currently, I have to create one rule per object type and, for each object type, specify that the Last Modified Date attribute is before Jan 1, 1980.  I would like to be able to create one rule with many object types and only have to enter the Last Modified Date criteria once so I can get back to binge watching The Big Bang Theory.

column1: Project Admin: People - Add "Assign project access" context action
column79:
- Works on single or  multiple selected users.
- Shows a modal for picking a project access level that lists the roles ( Member, Designer, Project Administrator).
- Roles are listed in hierarchy order, with "Member" at the top.
- Clicking "Assign" changes the project access level for all selected users.
- "Assign" triggers the "Saving..." progression.
- Clicking "cancel" closes the dialog with no changes.
- If no users are selected, "Assign Project Access" does not show.
- If all selected users are in the same role, show that role as selected.
- If selected users are in different roles, it shows "multiple" and disables the assign button.
- If assigning multiple users and some users fail to assign, the rest of the users should still be assigned.
- If there are errors assigning any users, an error is shown in the message bar with a JP error message and a helpful link for more info.
- API cannot be called without project admin permissions.
- Users assigned with this method properly have their project access set.
- The users table reflects their new project access level.

column1: Project Transfer: Add 'Why can't I move to the next step?"

column1: Project Transfer Step 4: Enable if nothing is selected
column29:
After discussing whether or not allowing an empty import of attributes made sense, Jacob described an interesting use case. He said that in some situations, you may just want to import the links. The use case he was referring to was having a project that had a big data store - the ship avails for every ship in the navy. CEC would like to get information about the ship avails, but they only care about the avails for the ships that they deploy to. Pulling all of the avails would clutter up their data with stuff they don't care about.

To support this use case, we still need to be able to match up object types and select key attributes to be able to uniquely identify endpoints of the links. It seems like the best way to integrate this into the current workflow would be to allow the import to have an "empty" attribute import, but allow them to import links in the follow up step.

This would still create new objects, which would be problematic for the CEC use case. The related story INF-3216 will address this issue
column79:
Step 4:
- If no attributes are selected for import (except the keys), the user can advance to step 5.

Import process:
- When the import is completed, new objects are created based on the matching rule.
- If there are empty required fields, those fields are left with their default values (e.g., they are not modified).

column1: Project Transfer Step 6: Show status icons for imports
column29: After the import has been performed, it would be useful to have a high level "status" for how the import went. This would direct users to problem areas and provide them a warm fuzzy that everything completed successfully (or not). It would provide a place for feedback to users about errors or warnings.
column61: 26/Aug/19 4:47 PM;MattChild;Step 6 Final Review - Link Import as children.png;https://jira.dev.simventions.com/secure/attachment/17849/Step+6+Final+Review+-+Link+Import+as+children.png
column79:
Step 6:
- When the import is complete

- There is a new column for "Status" in the transfer table
- Status column is initially blank during the "review".

- When import is complete, the "Status" column is filled out.
-- The status column shows with successful, warning, or error depending on the outcome of the import for that row.
-- There is a some way to get more information about the specifics of that status (e.g., tooltip).

- When import is complete, the header text changes to be a summary of the import. 
-- The counts of the number imported includes objects and links. Links are only counted once (despite being shown twice in the table).
-- There is some way to get more information about the specifics of that status (e.g., tooltip).

column1: Project Transfer Step 4: Step navigation
column79:
- When a user clicks the Previous button and then advances to Step 4, the changes previously made in Step 4 are preserved.
- When a user goes back to change something in Step 2, and then advances to Step 4 then those changes are reflected.
-- If the mapping of an object type is changed to a different object type , all the mappings in the "target" are cleared.
-- Object types whose mapping has been removed do not appear in the list.
-- New object type mappings that were added appear in the list.
-- Object types whose mapping have not been changed maintain their existing attribute mapping.
- When a user goes back to change something in Step 3, and then advances to Step 4 then those changes are reflected.
-- The key icon / coloring state now shows on the new row and is disabled.
-- The old row does not have the key icon / coloring and is enabled
-- The old mappings on the new key are cleared (for both source and target) 
- If the  user advanced to Step 5 and then go back to Step 4, Step 4 is preserved

And if Their source/destination project does have enough OT's to produce a scroll bar, the user cannot scroll to the very bottom to see what the last alphabetic OT is. This mainly occurs on a laptop with zoom settings at 100% or greater. The scroll bar is displayed though once the user selects an OT and drags to the "Matched" section.

column1: RBAC Permissions Error: Changing the values of a single-select attribute causes the rbac permissions to disassociate
column29:
Changing the single select attribute possible values causes issues with rbac permissions.

 

In Goodwin_TestB, Ship Defenses has a single-select attribute called "Defense Ready". lets say if these values are changed from 1,2,3 to a,b,c, then the current rbac permissions get weird. If there was a "Allow Full Control" on 1, and a "Deny" on 2, once the single-select values are changed, 1 and 2 would automatically change to a and b. The attribute values in the object would also change to a/b. The RBAC permissions do not have any effect on the object until the attribute value is changed in the object. For example, if Defense Ready is a, it would have to be switched to b and back to a for an rbac rule based on the value a to work.

column1: RBAC Permissions Error: Single-Select attribute value linked to incorrect rule
column29:
This behavior was present when creating a new object and transferring a new object.

 

The RBAC permission for a single select attribute is incorrect. The read only permission is being applied to an incorrect attribute value.

 

In Goodwin_TestB, the "Ship Defenses" object type has a single-select attribute called "Defense Ready". When a new object is created and given the value "1" for "Defense Ready", and an RBAC read only rule is given to "Defense Ready" with the value of "2", the created object with value "1" is read only.

 

Unable to recreate on a different project.

column1: Spreadsheet Modal: Design handling multiple errors
column29:
Questions to answer:
 - If multiple errors happen, should all of the "old" ones be displayed to a user?
 ** JP writes: depends, are the errors blocking or information? Can the user continue to work or does the error need to be addressed prior to continuing?
** MC writes: In the context of these calls, it could be either. It could be "server not found", "server did not respond in time", "you don'tt have permission to the project", "couldn't find object to update", "you don't have permission to make the change", and probably others.
 - If the old ones are displayed, how and where are they shown?

column1: Spreadsheet Modal: Design LAV editing
Spreadsheet Modal: Design editing flag fields
Spreadsheet Modal: Design tag editing
Spreadsheet Modal: Design multi-select editing
Design how to clear pending tasks
Enhance the utility of project transfer for bringing data between projects
column29:
As a program manager, I want more control over what gets published when I transfer project data to command HQ because our terminology may differ and they may not need or want everything from objects in our database (which are for internal use and they may not care about).

This encompasses several things:
 * The ability to choose not to import certain attributes (e.g., "ignore" them)
 * The ability to map attributes across taxonomies (They call it "Start Date", I call it "Begin Date")
 * The ability to import links

Early prototype shown on page 18 of the attached Project Data Transfer.pdf. 

This is feature #2 on the TTA / SSDS requirement options list. It satisfies a statement TTA Task 3 (Subtask ID 9). The inclusion of links was specified in D307 Task 1.

During epic grooming, this was estimated at between 1-2 Sprints.

column1: Basic Story Thread Filter: Show the intersection of the attributes in the "pick" list
column29:
Currently shows the union of all attributes. This was a concession to utility to make sure the basic search (which came first) could handle enough cases to meet CEC contract requirements. With a more fleshed out advanced search, there is now a more robust way for handling those use cases.

Many of the usability and understandability problems with the basic search are cleared up when it is the intersection of the selected attributes:
 * It shrinks the number of attributes that you have to choose from.
 * It acts as a better information radiator because the options that are shown are more likely to show choices.

column29:
The language to use in the "no results" state may be dependent on what functionality we are able to include in the MVP; for instance, if you can add "sub type", we may want to include some of the original language about selecting different / fewer criteria.

Assuming we do not include any attributes, here is the text:

Your filter did not produce any results. Try modifying the criteria on the left to change what is included.
Tips for Creating Filters
- If using Date Range criteria, try using a broader range
- If using Search Within, make sure words are spelled correctly or try entering different keywords

column1: Data: Add "Link Checked Objects to Object" action
column29:
Existing behavior CANNOT easily be used as a guide here because there are several things about the "Link Checked Objects to object" modal that are broken or not working.

It would be very useful if the columns in the modal showing the name or object type were sortable.

This will include porting the existing "Link Checked Objects to object" modal to TypeScript.

Question: 
- How can we decompose this better?
column79:
- Only available when there are objects selected of the same type
- Disabled if there are no selections or selections have multiple types.
- If disabled, give the user some indication as to why it is disabled.
- Works if there are multiple selected objects (and they are the same type).
- Clicking shows the "Link Checked Object(s) to Object" dialog (existing)
- Some way to notify them that the action did something
- Optional additional behaviors in description if they are easy.

column1: Data: Add "Export Slides" action
column29:
Existing behavior in the "Objects" page can be used for a guide, excepting where otherwise noted in the acceptance criteria or description.

Question:
- How do we break up this story? What do we really need here for MVP?
column79:
- Available when:
  - There is a selection and the selected objects of the same type
  - There is no selection and all objects are of the same type
- "Download" menu is not shown if there are are no filter results
- When disabled, there is some indicator about why it is disabled
- Selecting it triggers the existing workflow (but with new components) for exporting objects to power point
- Create a new "export slides" dialog based on JP's beautiful and luxurious mock ups.
- If some objects are selected, the generated slides include only the selected objects.
- If no objects are selected, the generated slides include a slide for each of the objects in the results.

column1: Data: Add 'Delete objects' action
column29:
Existing behavior in the "Objects" page can be used for a guide, excepting where otherwise noted in the acceptance criteria or description.

Questions: 
- How do we show something is happening on the back end?
- If it is not usable (for instance, nothing is selected), is it still shown in the ellipsis menu?
column79:
- Only available when there are objects selected
- Disabled if there is nothing selected.
- Works if there are multiple selected objects.
- Some sort of warning / notification about deletion, either:
-- A confirmation with the number of objects being deleted
-- No confirmation and a "moved to recycle bin" with hyperlink.
- Deleting causes the objects to disappear from the results (with no page refresh)
-Deletes are not atomic; if a delete fails on one the others should still be tried.
- If there is a failure, the user has some way to know what failed.

column1: Data: Add some way to navigate to the object details page
column29:
Drew / JP / Matt discussion 5/8/2019

This is a good time to increase our reliance the "label" concept, so there is a static field we can depend on. As it does now for the Story Thread's page, label should be based on "ShortName", but anything in the application tier or javascript logic should use the "label" concept. Once it is in those views, we can start doing piecewise migration of other parts of the site as we update them.

Drew thinks it would be simplest to start adding "Label" to the views we generate. Even though that data is already in the "Nodes" table, adding it to the views would mean there's no additional joins needed to the "Nodes" table, which he was concerned might slow down performance and view creation.

This does not preclude users from adding the short name column too.
column79:
In the filter results table's "object" field
- The field is not editable (nor ever will be)
- The text is a hyperlink
- The text is equal to the object's short name
- Clicking on the hyperlink navigates you to that object's details page

- Menus are the same across attributes
- Allows object type name, ID, "object" (which will be label / link to details page) and any attribute across any of the selected object types
- Attributes which users don't have permission to view are not listed.
- Currently viewed columns are sorted to the top, sub-sorted alphabetically.
- 'Apply' button triggers the change.

- Data may appear in its raw form; does not need to be formatted.

- Ctrl clicking to select multiple would be really useful (MC: consistency with other things that allow you to shift click).

- Does clicking on the row select the row? or only selecting the check box? (have a meeting about this)

- Each row has a check box for selection
- Selecting a row adds a row highlight
- There is a column header for "select all"
- Show the number of rows selected in the top header of the table
- Additional functionality in description is optional but would be a big value add.

- Tester confirm consistency / discrepancies with reports and story threads. Anything that is not a quick / easy fix is written up as a separate story.

column1: Data: Choose which object types to filter on
column29:
Question: If there are no object types, should the "Blank" state of the filter say something different?

Should use the word "Object types" for now. If we rename to "Category" we should consistently throughout the site.

We can't keep select all performant, so we should not have a select all option for now.
column79:
- All object types are listed with a checkbox for each.
- Selecting an object type includes objects of that type in the filter
- Selecting multiple object types includes objects of all of the selected type in the filter ("or")
- Unselecting an object type removes it from the filter
- You can have 2 tabs open with independent filters
- If there are more than a JP-approved number of object types (10?), it is confined to a scroll pane.
- The list of object types are in a collapse pane.
- If there are no object types, the pane is there with an indication that there are no object types (see JP for wording).
- RBAC rules are respected for which object types the person is allowed to see.
- When the selection changes, the content area header reflects the filter change.

Project Transfer Step 3: Getting possible keys fails if an attribute name includes an apostrophe (')
column29:
If an object type is selected for transfer and it contains an attribute with the name that includes an apostrophe ('), step 3 will never load. May also occur for percentage (%)

 

Technical details: The stored procedure for getting the number of unique values vs number of non-null values throws an error. The stored procedure builds a select statement based on the columns in the MTB table. The column names are not properly escaped.

 

Exists on Staging (4.9.13.0)

column1: Project Transfer: ID as key issues
column29:
If the user is able to use the ID as the key field there are some unintended side effects:
 * ID was originally considered a read only field (like Last Date Modified). This is fine for updating existing nodes but is problematic when adding nodes. Right now, it generates a new ID that is different than the one importing.
 * This will not work for transferring edges because it is generating new IDs. There is currently no way to identify the newly created nodes during the edge creation phase.

column1: Visualizer: Fix SimpleDateFormat default
column29: Use of "YYYY" (week year) in a date pattern without "ww" (week in year). You probably meant to use "yyyy" (year) instead.
column79: Use year instead of week year
column107:
11/Sep/19 11:16 AM;ScottSummerford;YYYY refers to week year. This means that a date of 12/30/2018 would get a label of 12/30/2019 because the week of December 30th ended in 2019. Super cool, right?
 * Check that the tooltip text is updated to be lowercase y.

 * Check that the defaults in the combobox now autofill lowercase y in the text box (and yield the right format)

 * Check that dates that use 12/30/2018 actually show up as 12/30/2018 and not 12/30/2019 (you can set these in the inspector)

Existing Date Formats will not be corrected (If you've made a rule in a profile recently, it will be YYYY, as that is a 'valid' date format), so make sure to use the right format to test bullet 3.

column1: Project Transfer: Single Selects can cause preview to error out
column29:
During project transfer, single selects need to be defined the same between projects. In certain instances an exception is thrown while comparing the definitions. This will cause the preview to return an error.

To reproduce:
 * In Project A:
 ** Create an Object Type
 ** Add a new single select attribute.
 * In Project B:
 ** Create an Object Type
 ** Add a new single select attribute
 ** Click Edit icon for the new attribute
 ** Click SingleSelectFixed to display the edit modal for the attribute
 ** MAKE NO CHANGES
 ** Click Ok
 ** Click Save 
 * Attempt to do a transfer, mapping the single selects to each other

This most likely occurs for multi-selects as well

==============
Test approach:
- Try with an empty "single select" attribute in the source project
- Try with an empty "single select" attribute in the target project
- Try with an empty "multi-select" attribute in the source project
- Try with an empty "multi-select" attribute in the target project

Pass:
The preview shows successfully
The transfer happens successfully

Fail:
There is infinite loading on the preview page (Current behavior)

column1: Project Transfer: Mapping attributes and leaving required fields null
column29: If the String attribute "ShortName" from a project that is being imported is mapped to a new object's non required String attribute that is not "ShortName", things get a little weird. The object cannot be selected and edited because there is nothing to click on in the ShortName column. In the D3 view, the node is blank.

column1: Object Details: Integer and Decimal fields nullable
column29:
For both non-required Integer and Decimal fields, once a value is entered, the object cannot be saved without a value in that field (as if it were a required field)

 

Create an Object Type containing non-required 'Integer' and 'Decimal' fields
Create and save an Object of this Object Type with no data
Open the Edit modal for this new object
    The 'Decimal' field auto-fills a 0
    The 'Integer' field is null
    Save this Object

Open the Edit modal on the same Object
    deleting the 0 in Decimal prevents saving as if it were a required field
    Entering a value into the 'Integer' field, saving, Editing again, and deleting that Integer value prevents saving as if it were a required field.
column79: all non-required fields can be saved without any data in them.

column1: Attribute "Integer" large values cause error
column29:
Entering an Int value too large causes the page to "Uh-Oh" crash, saving the object either with default values or the last saved version.
Integer values are too large when they are larger than 2,147,483,647
column79: The website handles large ints in some way that prevents crashing

column1: Objects Page: Chevron inside Action Menu
column29:

If you click on the chevron, it both opens the menu and collapses the objects list.

Evidently nobody thinks it's a feature, and the chevron should probably be broken out or removed.

column1: Reports Advanced Filter: Rules sometime shrink
column29:
When there are multiple rules, some things cause the Rule to shrink and then grow again (looks like a flicker). In some cases, they just shrink.  Actions that cause it to happen:
 * Changing object types for a rule
 * Duplicating rule (only on latest)

This only appears to occur in the filter for a Report. An story thread advanced filter works correctly.

This is only observed in IE.

Seen on Staging (4.9.13.0) and Latest.

See attachment for what it looks like

Peter believes this is an IE-only bug.
column107:
12/Sep/19 3:37 PM;ScottSummerford;Testing:

 * Test that rules don't shrink when your browser shrinks.

 * Verify that the components inside a rule are laid out correctly (no overlap, no funny looks)

This is all styling. No logic changes. Functions should not change, only looks.

column1: CEC: Timeline View: Enhance date display options
column29:
CEC Impact Rank: 5

Contract language:

The Contractor shall enhance the date display options in the Visualizer.

Notes:

Enhance the date display options in the viz. (have options to show just month number, or month year 3/18)

Visualizer label and annotation rules can specify a format for how date properties are shown.

Implementation Discussion 4/24/2019:
 - Update view profile editor for labels for how dates are shown.
 - Update view profile editor for label annotations for how dates shown.
 - Must be able to show just month number (3), month / year (3/18), or full date (3/18/19)

- The view profile editor for labels has options for how dates are turned into text.
 - The view profile editor for label annotations has options for how dates turned into text.
 - The options must include being able to show just month number (3), month / year (3/18), or full date (3/18/19)
- The option is saved as a part of the view profile.
- Existing view profiles must still work
- The default format should match the current behavior for when you select a date.

column1: Changes in relationship between objects only show in one objects "Recent Changes" log
column29:
Two objects that are linked to each other each have a "Recent Changes" log that shows the recent changes to the object. If the link between two objects is changed, the change is only logged in one of the two objects "Recent Changes" log, even though both had a change.

column1: PtoP: Edges aren't being updated
column29: * Edges are being updated even if nothing changed.  The stored procedure sp_LAV_AddLinkToLavIfConfigured() is called on existing link and throws an error because the LAV Link is already there. When updating edges, the repo should probably call the legacy updateMRMRelationship()  instead of the legacy linkObjects(). (Talked with Dan - there was no reason he could remember why linkObjects was called instead of updateMRMRelationship.  SHould be safe to change)

column1: Localized project administration so that users can manage their project without managing the entire enterprise.
column29:
As a program manager, I want one of my team to have full control over my project so that I can quickly make any changes or give anyone access to the project that needs it.

Notes:

This provides some of the functionality in enterprise manager in the main site. Who has access to the project, who has designer access to the project, what group they are in, what RBAC rules they have.

This is feature #15 for the TTA / SSDS requirement options list. It satisfies a statement TTA Task 3 (Subtask ID 11) and SSDS Task 1 (Subtask ID 21).

During epic grooming, this was estimated between 2 - 3 Sprints.

column1: Simplifying the account creation, approval, and assignment on NSERC.
Advanced Filter: Checking if an object type is valid doesn't respect capitalization
column29:
Found on Staging.

The check the Advanced Filter uses to determine whether an object type is valid to include in a search rule doesn't take into account the capitalization of pre-existing object type captions. This causes the page to crash.

To duplicate on Staging:
 * Navigate to Peter's Playground
 * Create a new Advanced Story Thread
 * Create a Search Rule with the Test Object 1 object type
 * Add search criteria for the 'capital' attribute
 * Add the Test Object 2 object type to the rule. It will be valid, despite 'capital' not existing on Test Object 2 (Test Object 2 has 'CAPITAL').
 * Remove Test Object 1 from the object type selection. The page will crash.
column79: - In the given example, the page should not crash and should return valid results that match the specified rule from the 'CAPITAL' attribute.

column1: Reports: Don't delete reports when a user is deleted from a project
column29:
When a user is deleted from a project, all of their reports are removed. Since people that may care about a report have no way of knowing when a user is going to be removed, they could lose access to something they use a lot.

Instead, reports should be allowed to not have an owner.
column79:
- Reports may have an empty owner.
- Before a user is deleted (automatically or via enterprise manager), if that user owns a report, the owner of the report is set to empty.
- Reports with no owner still show up in the reports list if they had access to the report.
- Anyone with access to the report can make themselves the owner of a "no owner" report.

column1: Project Transfer Step 5 (Links): Step Navigation
column79:
- If next is pressed prior to INF-3112 then it is assumed that no links are imported.
- When a user goes back to change something in Step 2, and then advances to Step 5 then those changes are reflected.
-- If the mapping of an object type is changed to a different object type, the list of links for that type is changed to the mappings that are valid for the new "target" type.
-- Object types whose mapping has been removed do not appear in the list.
-- New object type mappings that were added appear in the list.
-- Object types whose mapping have not been changed maintain their existing object type mapping.
- Changes on Step 3 and Step 4 do not change anything on Step 5
- Advance to Step 6 and then returning to Step 5 selections are preserved
- If the user returns to step 2 and updates the mapping of an object type, then the new link mappings generated when the user returns to Step 5 are selected by default.

column1: Visualizer: Drag a group onto an object or another group to merge the groups
column29:
Contract language:

The Contractor shall enhance the save state feature to include saving the row order in the timeline and matrix views.
column79:
- Clicking and holding on a group starts a drag of that group.
- Dragging the group visually moves the group and its contents
- Dropping the group on a node adds that node to the group, and puts that group in the drop target's row (the drop target is the new "master" node).
- Dropping the dragged group on a group takes the contents of the dragged group and puts each node in the drop target's group (destroying the dragged group).
- Dropping the dragged group on anything else causes the node to animate back to its original location.
column107:
23/Aug/19 4:01 PM;ScottSummerford;* If you drag an existing aggregate onto a node, it centers the new aggregate on the nodes location, but keeps the existing aggregates settings.

 * If you drag an aggregate onto another aggregate, it discards the settings of the dragged aggregate.

 * If you drag an aggregate, it creates a ghost image but to be able to drop it onto something, your cursor must be over the target (the drag image does not dictate the drop zone)

 * There's an existing issue where if you form an aggregate by dropping something close to the left side edge, it can add whitespace between the row header and the timeline body. Dragging aggregates can exaggerate this sometimes since the dragged content is larger. Doing any other action will fix this. I think this is outside scope.
column108: 26/Aug/19 3:59 PM;PeterMorrissey;Passes test
column109: 27/Aug/19 9:20 AM;MichaelJones;Passes test. I noticed the action that Scott mentioned about the whitespace being added between the row header and the timeline body and doing any other action does rectify it. I also agree that this is outside of scope..

column1: Project Transfer Step 5 (Links): Select whether or not links are imported
column79:
- If next is pressed prior to INF-3112 then it is assumed that no links are imported.
- You can select links
- You can deselect links
- You can select an entire object type which selects / deselects all links (children) in that object type
- You can select / deselect all groups (and everything within them) by clicking the checkbox in the header of the details list control
- Since every link type is shown in 2 groups, selecting a link in 1 group automatically selects the one in the other group. 
- All selections are checked by default.

column1: CEC: Enhance the way related items are shown for a link attribute value on the object details page
column29:
CEC Impact Rank: 6

Contract language:

The Contractor shall enhance the way the related items are shown for a Link Attribute Value on the objects detail page.

Notes:

Enhance the way the related items are shown in a LAV on the Objects list page. (listed or some order vice jumbled up making it difficult to read) Similar to the edit table.

This will be showing the default columns. In edit mode context attributes will be available.

Implementation Discussion 4/24/2019:
 - Object details page LAV editor has a table of related items for a LAV
 - Columns of LAV table are what columns are "checked" for the LAV
 - All LAV values are shown
 - LAV view table is a fixed size (horizontal / vertical scroll)
 - LAV "Edit" table is not affected
 - Table should be alpha sorted by the first column by default
column79:
Object details page:
- Any LAV attributes show as a table (rather than the | separated list)
- The table has columns that are match the values that are specified in the LAV attribute (like the LAV editor widget).
 - Table should be alpha sorted by the first column by default
- The page load feels performant.
