column1: Excel Import: Multi-select only allows CSV, but Reports export uses paragraph separated values
column29:
When exporting from reports to be able to include GUID, multi-select is separated by paragraph/return/list value but import will only allow commas.  This creates an issue when exporting, updating data, then importing and requires additional steps to rectify. 

The issue is also not clear in the error received, "___ was not imported because the cell contained a value that could not be converted to the corresponding attribute type" It is clear after the fact what it is referencing once discovered.
column79: - The format of multiple multi-select values in "Import Excel" is the same as the exported format of multiple multi-select values in "Reports" (both should use commas)

column1: Object Details page: Make it easy to add links
column29:
Original ROM Estimate: Large
Refined Estimate: Medium

This will be heavy on design / implementation.

When people make objects right now, they usually fill in the data and then think they're going to come back and make links later. It's too many steps to add links when they're making the new object in the edit mode and so people put it off until later. Frequently, later is never until someone goes in and cleans them up afterwards.

If there were an easy way to add related items from the object details page, it may encourage people to do it as they go.

The best approach seems to be a "quick add" like add related so they can add links quickly. Jacob presented a quick design sketch, which is attached.

While we are modifying this page, it may make sense to do a quick change to the layout to make it easier to understand (see INF-3158)

column1: Survey: draft 3 study and revisions
column29:
# -Draft questions and get feedback from colleagues.-
 # -Draft survey and get colleagues to attempt to answer the questions. Ask for comments after each question to help you revise questions toward more clarity and usefulness.-
 # *Revise survey and test iteratively on paper. We typically do 4 rounds of testing, with 1 respondent per round. At this stage, don’t rely on colleagues, but recruit participants from the target audience. Revise between each round. Run these tests as [think-aloud studies|https://www.nngroup.com/articles/thinking-aloud-the-1-usability-tool/]; do not send out the survey and rely on written comments — they will never be the same as a realtime stream of commentary.*
 # Randomize some sections and questions of the survey to help ensure that (1) people quitting partway through don’t affect the overall balance of data being collected, and (2) the question or section ordering doesn’t bias people’s responses.
 # Test the survey-system format with a small set of testers from the target audience, again collecting comments on each page.
 # Examine the output from the test survey to ensure the data gathered is in an analyzable, useful format.
 # Revise the survey one more time.
column79:
1. Recruit a participant. 
2. Run survey as think-aloud study.
3. Revise survey.
Repeat steps 3 more times.

column1: Advanced Filter: Removing Filter Rule Breaks Page
column29:
Under specific circumstances, attempting to remove an advanced filter rule will break the page.

Steps to replicate using the project Peter's Playground:
 * Create a new Advanced Filter with two blank rules
 * In the first rule, filter on Test Object 2
 * In the second rule, filter on Test Object
 * In the first rule, filter on the Multiselect attribute (it doesn't matter which values you pick)
 * In the second rule, filter on short name (it doesn't matter which values you pick)
 * Remove the first rule. The page will crash.

This appears to happen any time you have two adjacent filled-out search rules, and the first is filtering on an attribute the second does not have.

column1: Relayout the object details page

column1: Add / Remove Related page: Prevent crashes when clicking multiple items in succession
column29:
Original Estimate: Large
Refined Estimate: Medium

In the Add/Related page, when checking a check box for an object the user has to wait until the check mark loads before continuing to select more objects. You will get an error and kicked out if you click too quickly.

On NSERC, it is really easy and noticable to make a crash happen when you click multiple links in succession without waiting for the check to appear.

This is a very old page and fixing it may be more expensive than remaking it. We should do a brief survey of options before deciding on how to handle this problem.

After a quick fact finding session with PST, people use this page when:
- They are removing many links
- If you don't know your data that well (it helps to see a list of items to choose from)
- When you want to link to 10 out of 1000 items
- When you are adding a lot of links
- When you are adding links across multiple object types and doing bulk changes

Alan also mentioned:
- A "Check all" would be really useful here.
- The "what the object is already related to" sometimes takes up a big portion of the screen and makes it hard to use for its primary purpose. It would be useful to be able to hide that.
- Being able to sort or filter the list of related items would also be really useful.

After refining, the best approach seems to be fixing this page by:
- Disabling check boxes after you've checked it
- Queuing the calls (if needed)
- Putting the list of related links in a scroll pane.
column107:
06/Aug/19 12:54 PM;ScottSummerford;The difficulty of this story depends on the implementation - 
 * As far as I can tell, there are no batch calls for adding or removing multiple related things at once. There are "batch" calls that take arrays but ultimately just iterate through a list of data to make a single call on each entry.
 * If we were to keep it as is, and add a button to the top that says "Update Related" and does that iteration through list + single call, I think it would be the easiest way to implement it.
 * Likewise I think having a button that sets the "All related items" table at the top to be invisible / visible would be very quick.
 * Sorting would be more difficult because the table isn't traditionally made like our typescript stuff. Depends on how we want it to be done. Looks like it's alphabetical?

 
 * If we wanted to make the "batch" calls actually be singular calls, and make the sorting actually look good (or just the page in general), I think it would be better to remake. Though if we do so, it'd probably end up being a large story

column1: Advanced Filter: Add a string, lav, memo attribute rule for values that are blank or not blank.
column29:
ROM Estimate: Small

When filtering data, it can sometimes be useful to look for values that are blank to tell when data is missing (to know what to update), or show only things that have data.

CEC Example: We were trying to filter out anything that doesn't have an "Applicable product". Show a schedule that only had things that were linked to an applicable product.

column1: Spreadsheet Import: Add granular control over what gets imported (like EDX)
column29:
ROM Estimate for project transfer like implementation: XXL
This will be heavy on design / test.

Currently, Christy manages a LOT of data for CEC by using EDX to do the import. She exports out a spreadsheet, sends it to her team, and then imports the data back in. When she imports it in, she is responsible for the changes so she has to review them and make sure that they are right.

To meet the need EDX is currently filling for her, she would need:
- A way to see the list of what has changed (and what hasn't)
- An option to accept or reject changes individually
- A way to ignore columns in the spreadsheet.

Current EDX screenshot is attached. A companion story handles the "data export" portion of EDX (see related issue).

Other notes from Project Transfer ROM meeting: 
- Inline editing might be really cool here - correct any errors you see!
- If we did a big list of the diffs, toggling on and off diffs would be really important.

During the second review when we scoped it to a next step in the excel import wizard, this seemed much more achievable. It was noted that "deletion" was a significant chunk of that, with the diff report being a medium and the deletion being a medium by itself. "Deletion" was carved off into the related INF-3154, since it was not a core feature of EDX.

column1: Timeline / Matrix View: Allow a row to not be subdivided
column29:
Christy mentioned this on a telephone call on 7/26/2019.

All of the rows in the timeline have a 2 tier header. For some rows, this won't be useful because it is preferrable to have them all in the same lane. It would be useful to configure the row so it is NOT split, and have the Data Type name from the first tier just have more space.

column1: Disable / deletion steps are sometimes out of order
column29:
I had a stale account on NSERC that was becoming inactive. It was a legacy account from the change over of how accounts are stored.

 I got the "scheduled for deletion" e-mail, then the "your account has been disabled" e-mail. Both e-mails arrived on Wednesday at 8:02 PM, with the "deletion" first, and then the "disabled".

The e-mails I received are attached.

column1: Project Transfer: Performance is slow when determining what fields can be keys
column29:
When determine what fields can be used as keys, a stored procedure is called to determine if any attributes have unique values. This stored procedure is called spGetNumberOfDistinctValues.

It is run for a single node type. When many object types are selected, this can be very slow. There is probably a better way to do this, perhaps use a view similiar to ViewOfAllObjects

column29: This was originally envisioned as a part of doing deletion as a part of import for scoping out an EDX diff report (INF-3072). However, since EDX does not support deletion, this was separated from the MVP.

Project Transfer Step 4: Mapping Last Date Modified attribute
column29:
The Last Date Modified attribute is set by Informedb whenever a node is modified. Prior to there being a step 4 (mapping and selecting attributes), project transfer did not include last date modified when transferring data between nodes. This would allow the user to select the Last Date Modified to transfer - but some questions would need to be answered:
 # Should it even be possible?
 # If so, should it only be limited to being a "source" field?
 # Anything I'm missing?
column107:
09/Aug/19 1:46 AM;MattChild;No, last date modified should not be transferred or transferrable. I think there area use cases that could use it, but they would need a lot more functionality than we have now.

If we aren't transferring it, can this issue be closed or do we need to remediate last date modified being a selectable attribute?

column1: Project Transfer Step 4: Mapping ID attribute
column29:
Project Transfer allows a user to select the ID as the key attribute. However, prior to there be a step 4 (mapping and selecting attribute), project transfer did not included IDs when transferring data between nodes. This would allow the user to select the ID to transfer - but some questions would need to be answered:

 
 # Should it even be possible?
 # If so, should it be limited to when ID is the key field? (I think Excel Import works this way)
 # If it is included, how does it handle new nodes (use ID from source project/Excel file or generate a new one?)
 # Anything I'm missing?

column29: Currently, the transfer preview only shows you a summary of the changes that will happen to each node type. It would be useful for this to be more of a diff report (like EDX) that would let you accept or reject changes individually.

column29:

column1: Use same status color for more than 1 status text
column29:
ROM Estimate: Large

Currently, you can only use a color once in the list of colors. This means CEC can't effectively use it for some of the statuses, which have (for example) multiple "greens":

- Complete
- Complete (awaiting remco)
- Complete no remco

Discuss with Alison Perry about whether or not there are any other issues with status color that should be considered as a part of this.

column1: Visualizer: Don't timeout if there is activity in the visualizer
column29:
ROM Estimate: Medium

Doing stuff in the visualizer does not reset your activity timeout with the website, which means it is very common that users time out because they will be doing a deeper analysis in the visualizer for an extended period of time.

We have to think about whether or not this is permissible from a STIG perspective, but estimate assumes we don't have to do any major work arounds.

column1: Filters: Make + Add Rule action easier to complete
column29:
ROM Estimate: Small

Users have commented that the Add Rule button is difficult to see and get to in its current location.  Users would like to be able to more quickly and easily create a new rule.

Suggest:
 * Paper prototyping options are presented to users.
 * UI design is completed.
 * Working, front-end only prototype is presented to users
 * Approved design is Implemented, reviewed and tested.

This would need to be for story threads and for reports.

From Christy:
Sometimes I have quite a few rules and it is irritating to scroll up and down to add a new rule. It would be great to be able to add a rule regardless of where I am in the list.
column79: Users everywhere agree, the new way to Add Rules is better than the old way.

column1: Advanced Filter: Add "Contains" and "Does not contain" rule for multiple choice attributes
column29:
ROM Estimate: Small

Currently, tags allow "is", "is not" and "is empty". Sometimes people only know a part of the word - for example, searching for the tag "Tuten" to find "RodneyTuten" because they don't know how to spell Rodney correctly.

CEC specifically asked for tags, because that is where they are primarily having the issue. During estimation, it seemed like on balance it would be better to do it for tags, single select, and multi select since we wouldn't have to create special behavior for just tags (and it would increase capability!)

column1: Show a "working" indicator when reports are being generated
column29:
ROM Estimate: Small

When you click the "Download" button on the reports page, there can sometimes be a delay between when you click the button and when you get the save dialog. Sometimes users get anxious and click the button again because they don't think that the download is working.

column1: Objects page: Provide fine grained control over what is copied
column29:
ROM Estimate: Large

Right now, when you copy an object, you have to copy all the links or none and you have to copy all the attributes. It would be useful to be able to selectively choose what attributes or links get copied over. This would save a lot of time because making links (especially) can take a lot of time.

Currently people go and copy all the links but then delete them individually, but this also takes a lot of time.

There also needs to be a "select all".

JP Note: Make it easier to manage relationships!

column1: Excel Report: Mark columns as read only or hidden
column29:
ROM Estimate: Medium

When Christy sends out her spreadsheets for updating via EDX, she marks certain columns as read only or hidden to minimize the amount of accidental data updates she has to deal with. If she had the ability to mark certain columns as "read only" or "hidden", Excel reports could take the place of the "export" portion of EDX for her.

Screenshot of the "EDX Configuration Screen" is attached.

Heavy on design.

column1: Determine best approach for conducting a usability study
column29:
Text from the contract:

The Contractor shall perform User Interface/User Experience (UI/UX) interviews and recommend software enhancements to address the highest priority findings.
column79: #NAME?
column107: 23/Jul/19 2:48 PM;JohnSieck;Draft v1 [Choosing a Usability Study.docx|https://simventionsinc622-my.sharepoint.com/:w:/g/personal/johnsieck_simventions_com/EWxSYM3fXuFDkpWW5MywraIBcU6PBqZPcJG-rh2BMR2XBw?e=WQdKXy]
column108: 26/Jul/19 3:09 PM;AlisonPerry;Alan has an upcoming training on 7 Aug. Potentially could use a part of the time to do a part of the usability study
column109:
26/Jul/19 4:23 PM;MattChild;There are two primary objectives to get out of the usability study:
- Rate understandability in site terminology and symbology. For the high level system concepts ("Objects", "Reports", "Story Threads", "Project Administrator", etc.) and iconography (icons for help, download, etc.), figure out which ones are the hardest to understand or remember.
- Determine what users spend most of their time doing and why. We can use this to determine where the biggest efficiency improvements can be made (time savings in user activity), or the most frustration can be eliminated.

The outcome of this story should be a plan for data collection for these 2 things.

Alison suggested a 2 tier approach might be useful; figure out general area (which page(s) on the site) first then do a finer analysis when we know more.

If a survey is involved, a broad selection of users may be helpful:
- Implementation team (PST)
- Other SimV users
- CEC Users
- IWS Staff (Alison has a list)
column110:
30/Jul/19 2:18 PM;JohnSieck;Proposed:

1) Implement a [SUPR-Q|https://simventionsinc622-my.sharepoint.com/:w:/g/personal/johnsieck_simventions_com/Eao_ISfPXrhPnjxEkBM7z88BAJrVslvtgngSpiHQ_fMVyw?e=4cFQBh] survey on the Informedb website to establish a baseline and monitor website quality over time.

2) Use the log file to try to gather analytics such as which pages are most used. It would be better to employ a tool like Google analytics but that will take time.  This approach is labor intensive, not as detailed, but it is expedient.

Both approaches above are quantitative and do not address the desire to rate understandably in site terminology and symbology.  To address that it qualitative (observing users attempt tasks) research is recommended.  Some of this can be gleaned from observations our trainers have made.  Other observations can be made by setting up appointments with users, giving them actions to do and silently watching them work, noting where they have trouble or where they work around the website to accomplish the task.

column112: 31/Jul/19 4:04 PM;JohnSieck;Three ways to collect data have been proposed. A follow-on story ought to be created to have a meeting with JP, Mike, Ali, Matt C and Brad next week.

- Groups are listed in alphabetical order, except "None" which is at the top.

- Errors with saving are shown some way
- The selected role for a user is the current group assigned to that user.
- If there are errors assigning any user's group, an error is shown in the message bar with a JP error message and a helpful link for more info.

column1: Have a meeting about what actually happens during build and release process
Document timeout behaviors
column29:
We should document the following timeout behaviors: 
1. What behaviors cause us to not timeout. What does the user have to do to remain not timed out. 
2. What functionality throughout our site does not handle the timeout functionality well. There are some areas where people will just get a loading spinner among other things when the tool timed out and they do not know.

This was brought to my attention by Christy, where a lot of her folks are having difficulties continuing their work because they think what they are doing wont time them out.

column1: Story Thread and RBAC inconsistencies
column29:
The enforcement of legacy RBAC permissions on Story Threads (manual, basic and advanced) is inconsistent. Read does not appear to be enforced when getting filter definitions. Write is not checked when adding/removing GARD files to a filter. Manual story threads enforce a create and delete permissions, but filters don't. At a minimum, the application layer should be thoroughly checked/fixed to ensure it is enforcing the correct permissions, as well as adding unit tests to verify functionality.

 

(This was discovered when enforcing Read/Write permissions on reports)

column109: 18/Feb/19 2:34 PM;MattChild;I captured the issue Mason identified as INF-2604.

column1: Get version information from assembly, not text file
column29:
The version information is retrieved to:
 #  Display to the user on the website
 # Set the version in the database when creating new projects

 

The version information is retrieved from a file in ResourceFiles/VersionNumber.txt.  This file is generated during a Maven build.  If the file does not exist, the version from the assembly is used.  However, the version from the assembly is not set during the build process.

 

Update the Maven build to set the version information in MRMWebMVC\properties\AssemblyInfo.cs and remove the dependency on the text file. The attributes in the CS file that should be set are:
 * AssemblyVersion     - just the 4 version numbers. example: 4.9.12.0
 * AssemblyFileVersion   - just the 4 version numbers. example: 4.9.12.0
 * AssemblyInformationVersion     - full version. example: 4.9.12.0-SNAPSHOT

When getting the version for displaying to user or putting in the database, use AssemblyInformationVersion.

 

And, bonus - update the year in AssemblyCopyright

column1: Make it easier to identify problems in the upgrade process
column29:
When doing an upgrade using the SQL upgrade script, sometimes there are errors. It is difficult to tell the state of the database and what upgrade scripts have been run.

The MRMVersion table tells you the current version.

The _Version table tells you the history of what upgrades have been run, but they do not tell you if the upgrades were run successfully. We need a way to understand if there have been problems with upgrades in the past.

column1: PtoP Issues
column29:
There are a handful of things identified in PtoP that are broken.  Included:
 * Last Date Modified is included in the compare, causing all nodes and edges to be updated even if they did not change
 * LAV configurations should be updated as part of taxonomy, before nodes and edges are updated
 * Spam in log file that is unnecessary (some columns should be skipped during diff because they are not part of nodes or edges but used during the diff)
 * Configuration of Link Attribute not imported on existing project (works if import to blank project)
 * Spam in log file was trying to update value of Link Attribute (probably should be skipped since that is calculated automatically based on configuration, links and value of related nodes)
 * Attributes with empty list data are updated when they shouldn't be.  In database, value is [], in PtoP file, empty space.  This appears as a difference during comparison
 * No error are caught when updating the repository. If any error happens (such as the one mentioned above), the import stops, partially complete.
 * Field definitions are not removed (Ryan didn't think it was possible but the code is there)

column1: AUT: Refactor configuring Status Color defintions for attributes
column29:
Refactor the way data is stored and brought in to handle multiple status color labels for given attribute. Currently a string is transformed to a list of maps via Eval but it doesn't handle special (arithmetic) characters. Mason began a branch called StatusColorRefactor with an example of how this might be done. 

Evaluate whether or not this refactor can be extended to other definitions such as SSF, MS, Memo, etc. so they can handle special characters as well.

Note that informedb throws and error when certain character combos are put into Status color label like '/>'. As these are discovered they will need to be either noted or fixed so they do not cause an error anymore.
column107: 15/Apr/19 10:46 AM;JohnSieck;Mason already created a branch and did some proof of concept work.  Get htat branch and talk to him before beginning this story.

column1: Timeline View: Make groups within groups
column29:
ROM Estimate: XL

For certain very complex pictures, it would be useful to organize groups into groups. Rodney gave the example of "Aegis" (ship class), which would contain a set of ships, where each ship was a set of events.

column1: Visualizer: Make data updates to all remaining kinds of attributes
column29:
ROM Estimate: Large

These are the remaining attributes that aren't editable in the visualizer (plus status color if it isn't a small additional cost):

Flag
Memo
Integer
Money
Attachment
Image
Table
Link Attributes

Team note: the majority of the effort comes from table and link attributes, which are much more complex than the others.

column1: Preserve links when moving between an object to a new type
column29:
ROM Estimate: Large

Sometimes, users will create a new object just to start working. Later, they will realize it was actually a different kind of object. When they move the object to the new type (via the "move" dialog on the Objects page), all of the relationships are lost and they have to recreate them.

For CEC's use case, the source and target object types are typically allowed to be related to the same kinds of things, but we would need to define behavior for if that isn't the case.

It may be useful to choose what gets moved and what does not.

column1: Visualizer: Make data updates to important kinds of attributes
column29:
ROM Estimate: Medium

The CEC team frequently uses the visualizer for making lots of data updates, but has to switch back and forth between the website and the visualizer because you can currently only modify dates and strings.

They are primarily concerned with tags, multi select, and single select, but would be interested in status color if it is not a big additional cost.

column1: Timeline view: Labels sometimes aren't visible
column29:
ROM Estimate: Medium

When printing out charts, CEC often shows a subset of the chart (rather than the whole thing). Because of the way labels are positioned, if you zoom in and scroll in the chart, the labels can sometimes aren't visible. They handle this right now by putting overlays overtop of the chart.

Brainstorming produced 2 possible ideas:
- Automatically move the label if it's off screen
- Manually configure the label of a particular node, with a picker similar to how annotations are configured (top / left / right / bottom / center)

column1: Timeline View: Change the size of nodes
column29:
ROM Estimate: Medium

When some users create slides from visualizer screenshots, the milestones (nodes that are a single point in time) can appear too small. This would be finding some way to choose milestones to be bigger.

As an add on if it's cheap, it may also be useful to make the bars bigger too.

JP Notes from Estimation Conversation: - Idea: respect the size rules. Add a global size rule. All rules persist. Timeline view is currently ignoring the size rule

column1: Objects page: Prevent timeout while filtering through the data
column29:
ROM Estimate: Medium

When users are on the "Objects" page, sometimes they are doing an extended amount of analysis on that page and only modifying the text filter. This filter does not appear to reset the "timeout" timer, and users can find themselves logged out despite feeling like they've been using the site.

column1: Object Details page: Sort by any attribute in the LAV table
column29:
ROM Estimate: Small

When you're on the details page (pending 4.9.14.0) or in the LAV editor, it would be really useful to be able to sort on other columns to help find the particular related objects you're looking for. Many CEC objects have a lot of relationships and sifting through them all in the list can be challenging. Example: Documentation has an "A level", "b level", or "interface", and sorting by this would make it very fast to find the document I'm looking for.

column1: Project Admin: Removing Users without having access.
column29:

In IE - If you remove yourself from the grid the resulting message clips off the page.

If you lose project access and attempt to remove users, the users will be removed from the grid and an error will appear saying that they could not be removed, but the users do not appear back in the grid.

"Remove Person" dialog pop-up is displayed. Select "Remove person". An error toast is shown but the person is removed from the Manage People list of users in the project. Although in the background, the removed user still has access to the project, it seems they don't anymore if you are just going by what you see on the screen/page.

column1: Add Person Dropdowns Blurry
column29: The dropdowns in the Project Management's Add Person modal are blurry and out-of-focus.

column1: Can not view objects in recycle bin that are deleted by other users
column29:
The recycle bin is user specific - it only shows objects that the logged in user has deleted.This means objects can only be seen and restored by the person who originally deleted it. Also, if the user is removed from the project, the objects can no longer be restored until the user is re-added. Also, if the user is removed from the Enterprise (via Enterprise Manager or automatic deletion of account), the objects are orphaned and can no longer be retrieved by anyone.

 

 

Developer note: This is controlled by a flag. The question is how does it handle RBAC?
column79: #NAME?

column1: Column Header and Subheader are blank with certain font/size combos
column29:
When selecting certain Font/Size combinations, the Header and Subheader go blank.  I have seen this with multiple fonts (Arial Black w/ >40 size; Bauhaus93 w/ >40 size; Comic Sans MS w/ >40 size). 

Other fonts do work with a very large size. For instance: Arial with 72, Bodoni MT with 72, Californian FB with 72

column1: Project Admin: Allow project admins to change report owners
column29:
This issue has a few things to work out. If we are relying on project administrators to be able to correct the problem, can they see every report, or just the ones they have access to? If they can only see the ones they have access to, there may be other reports that are shared with multiple users that will be lost. If they can see every report, that means they may be overwhelmed with a large number of reports and have to sift through everyone's working space of reports.

It would also be useful to send project admins an e-mail if a user's reports are about to be deleted.

column1: The user is not able to bulk import objects with duplicate names
column29:
Functionality that was lost was the ability to bulk import objects with that had duplicate names. Now that we have to select a key whether we are updating or just bulk importing, we can no longer import objects with duplicate keys.

This has been an issue with at least one of our customers already.

Implementation notes:
 * Reword the text to communicate what will happen if no key is specified
 * Add some way to specify that there is no key and only add data; don't update.
column107:
20/May/19 11:54 AM;PeterMorrissey;The implementation notes are no longer valid. After a discussion with the Product Owner and PST, we decided to resolve this issue by implementing INF-2484 - Allow users to include object ID when importing from Excel.

 

Expected Behavior:
 * You can now select 'ID' when choosing the attribute that uniquely defines each object.
 * The ID field is included in the generated Template

If ID is selected as the unique attribute:
 * If an object of that type with that ID exists, it is updated
 * If no object of that type exists, a new object is created
 * If the ID field is left empty, a new object is created
 * If the ID field is not empty and not formatted properly, an appropriate error is generated

If ID is not selected as the unique attribute:
 * If a column labeled 'ID' exists in the uploaded spreadsheet, an appropriate error is generated
 * If a column labeled 'ID' does not exist, the upload proceeds as normal
column108:
20/May/19 12:57 PM;PeterMorrissey;Testing notes:
 * Make sure the error messages make sense
 * Smoke-test PtoP
column109:
18/Jun/19 9:59 AM;RyanScranton;Issues: 
1. In Simple Project PtoP 1 downloading a template for Test Object Type 1 ot does not give them the ID column. Selecting this Object Type does not provide ID as a column for a key either. 

EDIT - 

We have found out the reason for these attributes not showing up are that they are hidden behind a group. For all object types that do not have any groups, there is an "ungrouped" group that just shows all attributes. In that instance the ID attribute is shown. However, for those Object Types that have groups, the attributes cannot be shown because the "ungrouped" group does not exist and cannot be placed in a group.

column1: Add SOLR training to the "Help" section
Renaming Project Does Not Update A User's Profile
column29:
When a project is renamed, the project is properly renamed. However, the list of projects a user has access to and the project that is their "current" project is not updated with the new name. This prevents the users from accessing the renamed project.

In Enterprise Manager, a users role in the project will show as 'None' for the renamed project. Also, if their current project is the renamed project, they will be redirected to the Request Access page with trying to access Informedb Enterprise if they are already logged in.
column79:
- All users have access to the renamed project.
- User's role in the project remains the same
- The user's reports are not removed.
- If a user had the current project set to the renamed project, they still have it set as current project

 * Upon clicking the toast link, users are shown the # of Removed users that succeeded, the # that failed, and name / error message pairs akin to Add People error results
 * The Error Results toast is not removed until a user manually clicks it.

column107:
03/Jul/19 1:20 PM;ScottSummerford;Here's some testing criteria that I've explored during front end development:
 * Confirm that attempting to add a user that results in a request error will properly display the in-dialog-error. (Have the add person modal open, add them in EM, then try to add them in the add person modal and it should give you a good example error)
 * Confirm the behavior of those error results (# of users displayed, error messages, styling)
 * Confirm that the in modal error toast disappears on modal interaction (changing users / groups / roles)
 * Users that cause an error should stay in the toast.

 
 * Confirm that a major error (Database / Request) closes the modal and displays the page toast. A good way is to remove your Project Admin status while on the Add Person page.
 * An error retrieving the list of possible users to add should display on the in page toast.

 
 * Confirm that users are added to the People Page grid, and EM
 * Multiple users should all be added and updated.
 * Added users will no longer be displayed in the people picker
 * Confirm that the people picker displays users properly in IE (discussion with Ryan).
 * Add Person Modal should only close upon success, and display an in progress wheel on the button until then.

column1: Do a usability study to determine if columns that can't have data should be blank or N/A

It may be worth a tight timeboxed usability test (5-15 minutes) to see if that is something we should pursue in a future story.

column1: Objects page: Update the look of the "Generates Slides..." template picker
column29:
On the object's page, the "Generate Slides" dialog has generated some frustration and been a little hard to understand. Changing the presentation style and organization may make it look more attractive and be easier to follow. A PDF sketch of a new layout is attached.

This PDF was made before we had our design system, so the fonts may differ from the standard ones we use now. The default font should be Segoe UI.

Creating a new template is something that only people with the "Designer" permission can do currently, so if they don't have the permission that option would not be shown. The current page doesn't allow them to upload a new template, but a controller action already exists for it so you should be able to tie into that.

The last slide showing the "Create your own template" page shows a video tutorial and "View Fields". We have not made a video tutorial yet, and do not have a mock up for what "See what fields are available" would look like. There is a pending action to scope out time on creating a tutorial video and field listing mock ups and see if that matches up with the time frame for completing this story. If not, that page may need to be reworked.

column1: Allow users to pick a visualizer project file from another story thread
column29: We had to do a quick and dirty fix so that we could get the code into a releasable state, but it would be much nicer for users to pick a project file while on the story thread page. Alan Jones specifically advocated for this when discussing the feature in November.

column1: Show a better "diff" of what has changed in the change log report
column29:
During the in-progress demo on 1/11/2019 with CEC / Rodney, they like the new change log report but were having a very hard time understanding the output. They were used to seeing change reports like they typically see in EDX, which shows in red the things that have changed.

Currently, there's just a big dump of the old value and new value of the whole object, which makes it very hard to tell what has been updated.

Attached is an example of the EDX output.

column1: Include other template information in the excel file
column29:
During the in-progress demo on 1/11/2019 with CEC / Rodney, it was asked whether or not column order or other data would be present in the generated report. 

Notes:
 * Column order might be a tricky one because we are going to specify the column order in the site.
 * Static data would be really useful if there is a lot of boilerplate in the report.

column1: Prevent the user from creating attributes with no caption
column29: This can cause issues with the Word Export. There is no logical reason to have a blank or whitespace attribute; we should prevent it from happening.

column1: Help write a LAV parser for macros
column29:
This was originally make them parsable, but they were made parsable as a result of our LAV infrastructure changes. Original description:

Rodney can't run his macros because separator characters of multiple values are duplicated across fields.

We need to find some way to make the separators unique (that doesn't look hideous) so that Rodney can still run his macros to generate nice looking reports. This is a stopgap measure until we can configure the output of related items so this isn't necessary (which will greatly reduce the need for link attributes).

3. When you mouseover a calendar date the 'Update/Add Filter' button changes in height. The height reverts if you move your mouse above the calendar. Possible a newline is being added in place of an error message?

column1: Disable editor in Visualizer for unmodifiable properties (like last date modified)
Rename "Link Attribute Values" to be more clear and understandable
column29:
The term LAV (link attribute values) is hard to understand what is actually meant; it is confusing to talk about with users and stakeholders.

Matt W. made a suggestion of "Lookup", which has some nice synergy with the way that users understand excel and access.

column1: Object Details: Display link attribute values more clearly
column29:
Mentioned in Sprint Review 23 by Matt W.

The link attribute values don't display well when they are shown in the object details editor. It is difficult to distinguish which belongs to which object when multiple fields are selected.

In the short discussion, the way tags were displayed was floated out as an idea, which seems like it might work well.

column1: Store identical documents only once in the database
column29:
Sometimes users will upload the same file in multiple different places. The files can be large - like a 10 meg power point attachment. The fact that each is a separate link makes the database larger and also makes project exports (project-to-project) very large.

Reporter: Brad Neal
Original Text:
As databases grow we should consider adding in a feature to optimize duplicate attachments.  Duplicate attacments, as in... they have attached the same file to many objects.  In the PEOIWS project on NSERC, there are a total of 288 attachments... and 153 have the same name (very likely duplicates)... so over half of the files are duplicates.  This is taking up ‘lots of’ virtual space and makes processing slower I would assume.

- Design system updated with typography, spacing, and layout rules

column1: 500 error when choosing to export slides
column29:
In a CEC project, open a Product Card object.  While the object is loading, click the Actions button, then click Generate Slides...

A 500 error occurs.

column1: Multi select attributes sometimes have their data saved incorrectly (which can cause Word Reports to show stale data)
column29:
Data can be saved in multi select attributes that is not shown in editors on the client. The website just ignores the data, but the Word reporter shows out the value.

 

Nancy's Note 1:

Investigate discovered the new dropdown used does not handle the '/' character well. It requires it to be encoded. So, for that object, the HW Suite was set, just not displaying as selected because the control was expecting an encoded '/'.

Additionally, when the HW Suite is edited and a value selected from the dropdown, the encoded value is saved to the database (AN/USG-2). From a user perspective, it displayed correctly, but will cause the export to export an encoded value.

 

Nancy's Note 2:

Side note, because of how multiselect values are stored, if a value is deleted from the taxonomy, objects are not updated to cleanse the value from their selections. The details editor UI doesn't display it, but the export and Preview display it since they are not checking the values against the list of allowed values in the taxonomy.
column107: 09/Feb/18 5:05 PM;MattChild;Original story this issue was found in.

column1: MRMCustomer cookie not being changed when creating new project
column29:
When creating a new project, the MRMCustomer cookie is not updated to have the new project as the current project. 

 

This causes issues trying to launch the visualizer as it uses previous project name and cannot find the story thread id.

 

May also affect changing projects.

 

Current workaround is to log out and back in to the site

column1: Use Project ID in Visualizer in place of Project Name
column29: There are several fields in the visualizer that make web calls to the server by project name. This creates a lot of handling code that's necessary to correctly escape and unescape characters. In addition, the server does not restrict duplicate project names, so it also (as a minor issue) introduces name clashes.
column79: #NAME?

column1: Creating a new project causes visualizer to launch incorrectly
column29:
When a new project is created, you can change the taxonomy and add data to the project without issue. However, if you try and create a filtered story thread and then launch it in the visualizer, it will load up the UI and say "Non-existant story thread" - and no data will load.

If you close down the browser and open it back up after the project has been created, the same story thread will launch fine. This is especially concerning because it seems like this could affect other portions of the application if there is something relying on the "current project" that is not being set correctly.

column1: LAV Attributes "Sneak Through" RBAC
column29:
If a user is denied the ability to see an object, they can still get information about that object through a LAV attribute on a related object. This potentially gives them access to information they should not know exists.

Ideally: If a user is denied permission to an object, they should also be denied the ability to see a LAV attribute of that object.

column1: Link attributes can create an infinitely repeating cycle
column29:
If a link attribute has an indirect reference to itself, it can create a cascading reference that creates an infinite cycle. This manifests in 2 different ways:
 - If the object has a link attribute to itself, and includes its link attribute field, this creates an infinite cycle.
 - If the object has a link attribute to another object's link attribute, which references the original object's link attribute, this creates an infinite cycle.

This means that the value of a link attribute will grow each time an object is saved (indefinitely).

Simple case:
 A\1 Depends on B\2
 B\2 Depends on A\1

Complex case:
 A\1 Depends on B\2
 B\2 Depends on C\3
 C\3 Depends on A\1

Disable it

The count is off for some objects in the "Related Threads Items" column
column29: Specifically on infromedb-staging, in project Alans Test, Story Thread National League Teams, and object Toy Story 2 the count is off by one.

column1: RBAC is only allowing one rule per type
column29: RBAC allows you to specify condition rules based on an attribute's value. When specifying conditional rules, it is often convenient to specify a default permission level. The current behavior only "recognizes" one rule per type.
column79:
- "Attribute Value = _______" rules should override object type rules
- Multiple "Attribute Value = _______" rules use the most restrictive rule result.

column1: Implement command dropdown button style and behavior
column29:
Command dropdown can be configured so that the dropdown menu (e.g. list of object types) can appear aligned on the left or right of command button.

Command button dropdown styling conforms to design system (see attached).

column1: Export failed due to out of memory
Flag component for filter
column29: As a user I need to be able to specify whether or not a flag (i.e. Critical) is True, False or both so that I can specify the criteria used to filter the results.
column79:
User can click radio buttons to specify the flag:
- True
- False
- Not applicable
Not applicable is the default.  If default, then show the flag records with both True and False values. 
If True is selected then only show the flag records with a value of True.
If False is selected then only show the flag records with a value of False.

column1: Copy object type can sometimes produce object types with a duplicate caption
column29: In the designer page, when you copy an object type, it comes up with a modal dialog for entering the new name of the copied object. However, if you click copy twice, it will copy it twice and there are 2 objects with duplicate captions. Several portions of the application expect captions to be unique, and this allows a violation of that constraints (affects at least Visualizer and project-to-project).

column1: Run the self test from enterprise manager
Investigate better ways to do configurable settings
column29: The web site has a lot of settings that can be configured differently based on different enabled features and/or sites. There are a lot of tools built in to Visual Studio to assist them (publish profiles, parameters.xml, web transforms, build configurations, etc).  Investigate ways that we can it to better organize and test settings in informedb both on servers and while debugging locally.

column29: Provide developers with layout, spacing, and typography specifications so the mockup can be accurately reproduced.
column79: Provide developers with layout, spacing, and typography specifications so the mockup can be accurately reproduced.  Specifications ought to cover both laptop monitor size (1366x768) and 23" desktop monitor size. There is no need for specifications related to screen sizes for tablet or mobile devices.

column1: Visualizer: Properties with commas in the property name cause the project to lose all of its view profiles
column29:
The profiles are still actually there, but users can't see them. This can be fixed by hand editing the GARD file. This is due to the fact that ViewProfiles are using the legacy prefuse format for saving, and relying on prefuse's ExpressionParser, but it is not properly escaping its output.

More details attached and in comments.

column1: Provide accurate feedback to a CAC user if they have failed to login vs. if their account has not been approved.
column29:
If a user without an account logs in, they will be shown a "account has not been approved" page. If the user does not pass the hard coded login step (e.g., they do not have an active directory account), they will also be shown a "account has not been approved" page.

It is possible that this issue may not have an impact on actual users if CAC users can't change their password. However, this is a code smell and is worth a second look at the overall process. Nancy's powerpoint (attached) diagrams the failure - "Is username & password right" -> no -> "Show user inactive user view". The decision point is not just checking to see if the username and password is right, it is also checking with the account is active or not.

 Implementation notes: Login page has several different code paths. When fixing the CAC path, be sure to look at (and/or consolidate) the login process for all paths.

 

Additional note: Also look into providing accurate feedback when a login fails when not using CAC authentication. When a username & password is entered, all errors that occur when logging in say it is due to bad username and password. This happens if the account is locked or not approved as well.
column107: 05/Jul/19 4:06 PM;MattChild;This story may need to be split. There is good reason to delay it also; if there is a project list, we have a place to put a user that doesn't have a project.

column1: Establish criteria for categorizing the impact of usability issues
column29:
JP did some initial research:

Did a quick search and my favorite Nielsen Norman Group had several good articles on the subject.
 For your information...
https://www.nngroup.com/articles/how-to-rate-the-severity-of-usability-problems/
Severity Ratings for Usability Problems: Article by Jakob ...
www.nngroup.com
Rating usability problems according to their severity facilitates the allocation of resources to fix the most serious problems. Severity ratings are a combination of ...

https://www.nngroup.com/articles/summary-of-usability-inspection-methods/?lm=how-to-rate-the-severity-of-usability-problems&pt=article 

Usability Inspection Method Summary: Article by Jakob Nielsen
www.nngroup.com
Usability inspection is a group of methods where experts inspect a user interface to discover usability problems, the severity of the usability problems, and the overall usability of an entire system.

https://www.nngroup.com/articles/technology-transfer-of-heuristic-evaluation/?lm=how-to-rate-the-severity-of-usability-problems&pt=article
Technology Transfer of Usability Inspection Methods (Jakob Nielsen)
www.nngroup.com
Participants in a course on usability inspection methods were surveyed 7-8 months after the course. Factors which influenced adoption were cost, rated benefit of the method, relevance to current projects, and whether the methods had active evangelists.
https://www.nngroup.com/articles/usability-problems-found-by-heuristic-evaluation/?lm=how-to-rate-the-severity-of-usability-problems&pt=article 
Usability Problems Found by Heuristic Evaluation: (Jakob Nielsen)
www.nngroup.com
Heuristic evaluation is a good method of identifying both major and minor problems with an interface, but the lists of usability problems found by heuristic evaluation will tend to be dominated by minor problems, which is one reason severity ratings form a useful supplement to the method.

column1: HTML for LAV Attributes with Special Characters in Memo fields
column29:

Test Steps to see an example:

Object Type: LAV OT 3
Object: Test Special Characters LAV
Click "Edit" 
Click the Edit button for the LAV "Test LAV Special Characters" 
See the issue

Found by Christy in CEC. Replicated by Ryan.

column1: Export to excel doesn't preserve the order on the screen
column29:
From Brad:
In the Object List page... We have lost some functionality when the newer “Export Objects” functionality was enhanced.  The tool exported the column data in the order in which it was showing on the screen... in the order in which the user had moved the columns; but it has reverted away from this and back to exporting in the order in the taxonomy. column29:

My initial analysis is that it's not something unique to excel. The object details page is showing the trimmed version like is being shown in the excel export. Christy says that re-saving the attribute fixes the problem in excel, which makes me think it's not an excel issue.

column1: Project Admin: People - Change a user's project access level
column29:
Future stories may further fracture permissions (such as being able to create story threads, reports, etc.), but we don't have to design for it now.

Need to figure out a strategy for doing multiple edits in quick succession.

If it's trivial, prevent self-demotion.

Error states in a message bar do not fade automatically.

Based on discussion in Backlog grooming at 4/24/2019, we should not redo the story threads page or reports page because there's some uncertainty about how to change them.
column79:
- Access levels are "Member", "Data Designer", and "Project Administrator"
- You can only choose one role.
- Roles are listed in hierarchy order, with "Member" at the top.
- Errors with saving are shown some way
- The selected role for a user is the current role assigned to that user.
- If there are errors assigning any users, an error is shown in the message bar with a JP error message and a helpful link for more info.
- API cannot be called without project admin permissions.
- Users assigned with this method properly have their project access set.
- The users table reflects their new project access level.
- Enterprise manager properly reflects the changes made.
- You can still change a user from project in enterprise manager.

column1: Allow direct linking to projects through URLs'
column29:
Suggested by Matt Wilson on 7/2/2019 via e-mail:

Is it useful and/or easy to allow/support direct-link URLs to specific InformeDB projects?  For example, if I have access to 4 different projects (PEO IWS 1A, 2, and 6) could I have distinct URLs for each that I can bookmark (e.g. informedb.navy.mil/PEO_IWS_1A, informedb.navy.mil/PEO_IWS_2, etc.)  This may become less important as we refactor a landing page where maybe I pick the project I want to open.

Just a thought because it would make sharing of a project with others easier rather than having to go to your profile and pick something out of the list.

27/Jun/19 12:59 PM;ScottSummerford;From discussion with JP, here are some notes for design -
 * The ComboBox's for the user's group / role should be limited to between 5-7 selections before it starts scrolling. The component doesn't natively support this, so I set a height limit that should activate on those choice ranges
 * The 'Default Group' option is selected by default and put at the top of the list, regardless of group sorting.
 * The 'Default role' refers to member, and the text follows the current iteration of the mockup.
 * The People Picker will continue expanding downwards, but the modal itself has a capped height limit that will start scrolling when the people picker becomes too large.

As it is now, the requests for the data displayed on the Add Person modal are made on the main page opening, so those error messages will occur there.

13/Feb/19 4:33 PM;MattChild;The feedback from Kasey was very unexpected. It seemed initially to me that the flatfile approach was so obviously more intuitive than project transfers that users would be more concerned about the details of how to do it, not if we should do it.

We need to do more research with additional users to gather more feedback to determine the next step. If we go with an approach different than project transfer (like flatfile) it has to be an order of magnitude better for user experience than what we have now. If we go with a new approach, we have to expect to change project transfers to feel similar to whatever new approach is. Redoing project transfer will be extra work and time, so it will have to be much better to justify the additional cost.

column1: Make the NSERC database upgrade process more automated
column29:
The current upgrade process involves Cody:

 * Manually selecting each database in SQL management studio

This is time consuming and error prone. We need something more like the scripts we run to upgrade latest / staging / roadmap.

Also, there should be a script in the wiki for automatically backing up a series of databases, which may be helpful:

http://gitlab.dev.simventions.com/ttg/informedb-enterprise/wikis/sql-server

column1: Visualizer: Body Scale and Row Header Scale Desync
column29:
Normally, scrolling in / out on the TimelineView is disabled while the visualizer lays out its items.

However, during long layouts, or if the scroll wheel is spammed hard enough, you can force a zoom in / out, which will desync the Body Scale and the Row Header scale. This causes the visualizer to be put in a non-responsive state.

 

Steps to reproduce:

Launch a visualizer story (a large amount of rows / items makes this easy to reproduce -  I use World Report Testing - Basic on Ryans server).

Do an action that causes a layout (Expand / Collapse is a good one)

Mash your scroll wheel to zoom in / out while the layout is occuring.

 

You should receive an error like the one attached below.

column1: Data: Redesign "link checked objects" dialog
column29:
The goal of the link objects (make relationships) feature is to:

1) Quickly create and manage (CRUD) complex relationships

2) Visualize and easily understand complex relationships
 * Parent / Child
 * Dependencies

3) Traceability (cause and effect)

4) Understand the type or significance of a relationship (e.g. Is this integration? Is there a schedule need? (i.e. A happens before B))?

As a user I want to:
 * put data in one time and use links to make it useful in many places
 * link or unlink one or more items
 * specify directionality for one or more links (relationships)
 * edit metadata for a given link
 * see if one or more items are related to one another

As a user I want to:
 * see an object that I am analyzing and want to make sure it's related to everything it should be
 * see if there is something else an object should be related to but is not
 * make a new object and relate it to all of the things it is logically associated to.
 * make a new object and relate it to all of the things it is logically associated to
 * see an object that should be related to something that doesn't exist yet
 * modify links through import functionality

Other requests:
 * Maintain state of checks (related? yes / no)
 * Select all (check all)
 * Don’t make me try to remember what I am looking for (basic or adv filter solves this)
column107:
22/May/19 8:52 AM;JohnSieck;Met with PST on May 22. As a user I want the link objects feature to be:
|Fast (speed, fast to do, low clicks, quick)|
|Easy (ease of use, explanative, understandable, logical, simplicity)|
|Accurate (correct)|
|Understandable (Understanding the significance of a relationship, specifying add’l data about dependencies and direction; details; visual; all info regarding links located / accessible on one page)|
column108: 30/May/19 9:54 AM;JohnSieck;Met with PST on 5/29 regarding wireframe v1.  Feedback was generally positive. The ability to link one or more objects to one or more objects was appreciated but an alternate suggestion about just refactoring the existing Add/Remove Related page was suggested.  I refactored that page as shown in wireframe v2.  Met with PO on 5/30 and he requested a mockup of just the "Link checked objects" modal.  We would then have three options ranging from cheap and maintaining existing functionality to expensive  and enhancing functionality.

column1: When logging out display a page specific to logging out
column29:
When a user clicks logout, they are redirected to the DoD banner with the Login page in the background. While this is logical, it cause extra cognitive effort for the user, wondering if the logout was successful or not.  Instead, display a page that informs the user they have been successfully logged out of the system with a link to sign back in if they wish.

Here are some guidelines for logout pages:
|*VISITOR QUESTION*|*OPTIMIZATION GUIDELINE*|
|*Is this the right place?*|Maintain a consistent branding experience. The Logout Thank You page should look similar to the logged-in area’s design. This is also your last chance (for a while) to reinforce your company ethos and leave your customer feeling good about the interaction.|
|*Am I logged out?*|Provide a clear confirmation that the logout process is complete. For example, “You are now logged out”|
|*Are you grateful for my continued business?*|“Thank you” is such a simple, easy thing to say. “Have a nice day” might not fit your brand, but the sentiment is one that encourages engagement.|
|*Whoops! I forgot something. How do I log back in?*|This is a very common need for membership sites. In the page content area, provide a clear link to the site login, even if you already have a similar link in the global navigation or site header.|
|*Hmmm, is there anything else interesting here before I leave?*|[OPTIONAL] Offer 1 – 3 opportunities to engage further with your company. This could be a new product or service, an offer of your newsletter, or simply an invitation to contact you.|

column1: Add an e-mail notification when an account is automatically disabled
column79:
- When a user account is automatically disabled, send an e-mail notifying them of the account status change.
- Verify that an e-mail is NOT sent out when a user account is manually disabled.
- If we are configured to disable account automatically, an e-mail is always sent.
- If an e-mail address is not filled out, no e-mail is sent and the system does not crash.
- If e-mail is not configured on the server, no e-mail is sent and the application does not crash.
- If there is an error sending e-mail, log it and continue with disable account flow.
- E-mail is populated from a template with fields that can be replaced with relevant app data (JP's fault).
- If the template is not found or there is a problem reading the template, fall back to a hard coded default.

column107:
16/May/19 9:45 AM;NancyKraus;Test notes:
 * Three warnings can be sent, configured in Web.config.  First two are before disable, second is before delete
 * Setting them to -1 in web.config disables them
 * If action (disable/delete) is disabled, the warnings do not go out
 * Email templates exist in ResourceFiles folder on server.  If none are found, a default message is sent
 * Uses SupportEmail address from web.config in the emails for who to contact
 * Each warning email should only be sent once
 * If a warning is sent, the date and time the warning email was sent is display on the user details page in Enterprise Manager
 ** If a user logs in, those values should be cleared and no longer show up in Enterprise Manager
 * The check to send them is made only once a day
 ** To configure in the Web.Config, modify BackgroundActivityInterval.  It expects a cron expression. Possible values:
 *** Daily (Default): "0 0 * * *"
 *** Every 5 minutes: "*/5 * * * *"
 *** Every minute: "* * * * *"
 * If a user's account is disabled before one of the first two warning messages go out, they do not receive them but do receive the third warning about deletion
column108:
21/May/19 3:05 PM;DrewPolhamus;Suggestions based on testing so far:

 
 * Include username in email somewhere.  On environments where multiple users have the same email address, there is no way for the recipient to know which exact account a warning is for.
 * Include the server URL in the email.  If using the email templates, add %SERVERURL% in the templates and update the template code to replace that token with a configured server URL in the Web.config.
 * Inactive number of days in delete email under "Why was my account deleted?" looks to be hardcoded to 45 when using the template.  This should come from the Web.config.

As a data analyst, I want to see what data will be changed when I import an excel spreadsheet so that I can confirm the changes are close to my expectation of what they should be.

 Attached is an example of the current "change report" from EDX (which is what they are used to seeing).

This is feature #16 for the TTA / SSDS requirement options list. It satisfies a statement in TTA Task 1 (Subtask ID 2).

During epic grooming, this was estimated between < 1 - 1 Sprints.

column1: Excel Importer: Accept or reject individual data changes
column29:
As a data analyst, when I import an excel spreadsheet I want to be able to individually reject changes that will happen during an import so that I don't have to go back into the spreadsheet and re-upload it if something looks wrong.

This is feature #35 in the TTA / SSDS requirement options list. It satisfies a statement in TTA Task 1 (Subtask ID 3) and Task 4 (Subtask ID 13, 14).

During epic grooming, this was estimated between < 1 - 1 Sprints.

column1: Output color status field to Excel and PowerPoint
column29:
The status color field right now will output the textual label to both Excel and PowerPoint. Most users use this type of field to communicate high level status though (like a "Stoplight" chart), which is much less effective without the color.

This is feature #41 from the TTA / SSDS requirement options list. It satisfies a statement TTA Task 5 (Subtask ID 19). This is a nice to have, because the macro capability that was developed for the Excel Reports could also meet this requirement.

During epic grooming, this was estimated between < 1 - 1 Sprints.

column1: Start MMP Rearchitecture
Update user inactivity notification tasks to account for all user states
column29:
If email notifications are enabled for user inactivity on a system that has users that meet the criteria for delete, they will still get the warning and disable notifications which contain instructions for action to take by dates in the past.  This could be confusing for users that receive these notifications.

To address this issue, the warning notification tasks should check whether the user state will be addressed by another task.  If it will be addressed by another task further in the action flow, do nothing (warning1 -> warning2 -> disable -> delete).  For example:
 * If an account meets criteria for warning1 and warning2, warning1 task should take no action.
 * If an account meets criteria for delete, warning1, warning2, and disable should take no action.
 * And so on.

column1: NUnit test issues
column29:
The C# tests are run using NUnit, however the test in each test assembly is being run in parallel. This maybe resulting in some of the random test failures.  Also, some tests are disabled and there needs to be a way to enable them for different Jenkins builds.

 To configure NUnit during Jenkins builds, update NUnitRunner project to change how maven runs the nunit tests, including:
 * updating to latest version of NUnit Console (3.10.0)
 * setting the number of agents to 1
 * figuring out a way to make the list of included tests configurable

column1: Copy OT icon defaults to first OT listed
column29: When the user clicks on the copy icon to initiate the copy process, the first option in the "Copy Object Type" pop-up, "Object Type To Copy" defaults to either the very first OT listed on the Manage Object Types page or to the last OT you copied if you have already copied one or more. Shouldn't the field default to the OT you picked to copy? If not, why is there a copy OT button on each OT listed?

column1: Report: No invalid name checking on report creation
column29: When you initially create a report, attempting to add an invalid name appears to succeed on the front-end, but fails on the back-end. Indications need to be added on the front end to clarify/prevent user behavior.

column1: Change the backup strategy to reduce VM / SQL backup growth
column29:
The backup strategy we are using is fairly naive. We are doing VM level back ups, and SQL server does not know we are doing those, so it is keeping a huge log of changes and not cleaning those up.

Drew has ideas about how we could do that differently.

column1: Create the simplest web -based "PowerPoint" builder that is useful
column29:
Users have a lot of trouble right now with the PowerPoint templates - it is like writing code. In order to transition to a more web-based solution, we need to create the simplest builder that is useful to an end user. It must be:
 * On the Story thread's page
 * Work across object types
 * Allow users to select most kinds of attributes

This is feature #19 and 24 from the TTA / SSDS requirement options list. It satisfies a statement TTA Task 5 (Subtask ID 20), but is more expensive (and useful) than the related issue.

During epic grooming, this was estimated between 4 - 5 Sprints.

column1: Allow "Following" an object
column29:
As a data analyst, I want to be able to follow certain objects and be notified if anything changes so that I am aware of things that are really important to me have changed, I can make sure they're right, and can update plans and other people as needed.

Notes:

During initial brainstorming session, it was discussed that this may necessitate a "profile" page to give you control over your notification settings.

This is feature #13 for the TTA / SSDS requirement options list. It can satisfies a statement TTA Task 3 (Subtask ID 10).

During epic grooming, this was estimated between 2 - 3 Sprints.

column29:

column1: Add "private" objects
column29:

This is feature #36 in the TTA / SSDS requirement options list.

During epic grooming, this was estimated between 2 - 3 Sprints.

column1: Add "proposed changes" to objects
column29:
As a data analyst on a big team, sometimes I see data that is wrong that I'm not responsible for and am not allowed to modify. I want to be able to propose some changes to an object that the owner or editor can come in and accept or reject it to make the data right.

The is feature #1 in the TTA / SSDS requirement options list.

During epic grooming, this was estimated between 1 - 2 Sprints. This estimate assumes there is no notification piece.

column1: Creating new project contains errors setting up database
column29:
When a new project is created in Informedb, the following two lines are found in the log file:
 * The module 'spCreateNewTable' depends on the missing object 'sp_CreateRollupDeleteTriggerForReferencedObjectTable'. The module will still be created; however, it cannot run successfully until the object exists.
 * The module 'Lav_Configuration_INSERT_Trigger' depends on the missing object 'sp_LAV_InitializeLAVValues'. The module will still be created; however, it cannot run successfully until the object exists.

This could be fine and just be a order issue. But it should be investigated to see if it is an actual problem
column107: 06/May/19 1:06 PM;DrewPolhamus;I confirmed that these errors are benign and are due to ordering as suggested.  I reordered the create statements in createStoredProcedures.sql and spCreateLavCode.sql to avoid these errors.

column1: Copying object types can cause a corrupt state
column29: When Jacob was testing his LAV values, he was using the "Copy object type" feature to copy an object type to a different project. Drew identified that database triggers on the MTB tables were missing.
column107:
12/Apr/19 1:24 PM;ScottSummerford;This seems to be unrelated to LAVs and more on copying objects in general.

If you copy an object type to a different project, and then create objects with that type, and then attempt to generate ppt slides, you will get an empty powerpoint.

If you go back to the original project, and either use existing objects of that the copied type, or create new objects for that type, they generate successfully.

Also, attempting to generate an excel sheet or a word document from a copied object type will pull the data from the object successfully. Similarly, if you make a new object type, add new objects, and then generate slides, it generates properly.

column1: Excel Reports: Save As and Duplicate a Report
column29:
As a user I want to save as / duplicate a report so that:

1) I do not have to start from scratch when creating a new, similar report

2) I can make changes to a copy of a report without damaging the original or "master" report.

Mockups are attached.
column79:
- A given Report can be saved as a new report
- When doing "save as", you are prompted for a new name.
- A selected report can be duplicated from the Reports page
- Saves the working copy if you're on the report details page.
- Permissions are not copied.
- Owner is changed to the person doing the copying
- If you do save as, it navigates to the new report
- If you do duplicate, it just selects the new report.
- When duplicating, the name is automatically generated based on the original name.

column1: Resolve the security patch issue for roadmap.simventions.com
column29:
The latest microsoft security patch stopped roadmap.simventions.com from working because of the way it connects to the database. It uses a trusted connection, but with no domain controller to have an AD authority. The current connection uses local accounts.

We can hold off applying a security patch temporarily, but the way the connection is working isn't a use case that is officially support by microsoft and forums seem to indicate that it shouldn't work, so we can't rely on it long term.

Easiest fix seems to be to set up either a new VM or add additional services to some of the existing VMs for AD services so we can use a "real" trusted connection with a domain account.

column1: Performance issue when deleting a number of objects. The details are in the description.

I then went back to my original OT and deleted another 18 objects with every attribute present.  I timed it and it ran for 7:27 before I got a JSON parse error (timeout).
- JP

This leads to the user selecting the "Copy" button multiple times, thinking they didn't successfully click it the first time which leads to multiple versions of the copied OT with titles like "2715 Test, 2715 Test (2), 2715 Test (3),etc.

column1: Create an account request page for sNSERC
column29:
Reported by: Brad Neal

As a user on the classified sNSERC network trying to log into Informedb for the very first time +without+ an sNSERC account, I should be redirected to a new webpage that explains what I need to do to get an sNSERC account.  Currently the page errors.

 

On the NSERC side it redirects the user to the NSERC account page... but they don’t have that on the sNSERC side.  We need to send them to a new page that helps them take the appropriate next steps in getting an sNSERC account...  which is email NSERC and get a sNSERC Account Request PDF and fill it out and submit to emails on PDF.

column1: Visualizer: Configuring Dates causes Aggregates to size incorrectly
column29:
Launch visualizer from website
 Create an aggregate.
 Go to configure dates. Change a date property so that a node in the aggregate gets put outside the timeline

The aggregate now expands outside the timeline. You cannot remove or move the node outside the timeline, so the aggregate is forever broken until you configure it to be back in the timeline, then take it out.

Also if that happens and you start drag/dropping nodes, the timeline will start never-endingly increasing in size.
column79: When a node no longer has a date associated to it, it should be removed from the aggregate.

column1: Error when trying to launch the visualizer from an NMCI machine.
column29: Users are running into the attached error when trying to launched the VIZ using and NMCI machine. This could be due to the exceptions site list.
column107:
31/Jan/19 1:40 PM;MattChild;Initial look from the error appears this may be a TLS issue. It's possible that NSERC changed their TLS configuration and the version java is defaulting to isn't working anymore.

 

If true, this may be fixable by running a tool on NSERC to disable certain TLS settings, or it may require a code change to force java to use a certain set of TLS protocols via system properties. This will be tricky, because the properties might need to be set for the actual JNLP file.

 

More information available here:

https://stackoverflow.com/questions/28908835/ssl-peer-shut-down-incorrectly-in-java

column1: Excel Reports: Add shimmer (aka ghost or skeleton) elements to reports
column29:
Use shimmer to help ease a UI transition when we know the service will potentially take a longer than 1 second to retrieve the data.

When reports are loading, using shimmer elements will help customers be more comfortable with the functionality of any UI that is pending. Customers are immediately presented with a layout that is consistent regardless of whether renderings are shimmer or real report cards.
column79:
Shimmer is implemented on the Reports page for the cards.

Shimmer is used if you know the UI loading time is longer than 1 second.
If you use shimmer and the delay is longer than 10 seconds, an alternate form of an ETA is used as quickly as possible to help the user understand that the system isn’t broken. ** We can discuss what that alternative ETA would be ** 

Widths are provided for each of the shimmer elements used to build a skeleton layout looking as close as possible to real content it is replacing.

The Shimmer UI should Fade out while the real UI Fades In (estimate between 0.1 and 0.3 seconds for fade).

column1: Data tables: Preserve context
column29:
For a given table, like an Excel Report, maintain the context for the user.

When a user scrolls, horizontally, keep the column headers visible so the user knows what goes with what.  They can easily associate data in a given cell with the column header that the describes what that data is.

If a user has to scroll horizontally to see the rest of the data in a row / table, then preserve the context for the user.  Assuming the most important information is displayed in the leftmost column, freeze that column so that the user can associate the data with a given row at any time.Kendo refers to this functionality as "Locked columns." [https://www.telerik.com/kendo-react-ui/components/grid/columns/locked/]
Excerpt: Locked (frozen or sticky) columns are the columns that are visible at all times while the user scrolls the Grid horizontally.

Here's a video talking about "Designing Tables for Desktop Apps with Lots of Data":

[https://www.nngroup.com/videos/designing-tables-desktop-apps/?utm_source=Alertbox&utm_campaign=912ab077d7-knowledge_gaps_ui_copy_big_tables_2019_03_04&utm_medium=email&utm_term=0_7f29a2b335-912ab077d7-40272225]
column79:
The column headers are visible at all times as the user scrolls through the data table vertically.

The user has the option to lock the first column so that it is visible at all times when the user scrolls the data table horizontally.
