************** JIT Debugging **************
To enable just-in-time (JIT) debugging, the .config file for this
application or computer (machine.config) must have the
jitDebugging value set in the system.windows.forms section.
The application must also be compiled with debugging
enabled.

For example:

<configuration>
    <system.windows.forms jitDebugging="true" />
</configuration>

When JIT debugging is enabled, any unhandled exception
will be sent to the JIT debugger registered on the computer
rather than be handled by this dialog box.

column1: If an attribute is deleted, refreshing the visualizer does not remove the attribute. They user has to close and relaunch to show the deletion.

column1: Clicking on the "Objects(Nodes)" and "Links(Edges)" in the customize view profile resizes the window

column1: The user can get into an impossible state if a LAV Attribute is marked as Required.
column29:
If the user is creating a new Object Type with a LAV attribute that is required the user can get into an impossible state by following these steps. 
* Create a new object type 
* Add a LAV Attribute 
* Make the LAV Attribute Required 
* Create a New Object for the Object Type 
* The user cannot Select a LAV for a new object because it is not created to make links but they cannot save because the LAV attribute is required.

column1: Story thread RBAC permission for "world" behaves differently than for a group
column29:
There appears to be a bug where setting the story thread object type's permission for the "world" group to read only:
 * The "create new story thread" button would be enabled
 * You could click the button to create a new story thread
 * Actually finishing the creation of a new story thread would show an error
 * Even though there was an error, the story thread would be created.

If the story thread object type's permission was set for a user-defined group to read only, the "create new story thread" button would be disabled (which is the correct behavior).

column1: Excel Reports: Report Details Sidebar \ Manage Access - Add a "Disable sharing" option
column29:
Use case: Users realize a report is not safe to use and they need to make sure no one runs it until they can fix it.
 * Temporarily disables all access (viewing and editing) except the owner
 * Users are still listed but grayed out.
 * Enabling editing restores everyone's access to their respective permission states.

column1: More intuitive reports save functionality
column29: When a change is made to which columns are displayed in a report by either adding or deleting the columns using the check boxes, you have to select both the preview save that is included in the pop up with the check boxes and the overall Report save in order for your changes to take place. column1: Story Thread names have no character limit, which can cause usability issues
column29:
The user is able to enter any character sized Story Thread name they want. If the user gets above a certain limit (we test at 500 characters) there are places throughout the tool that become unusable. 

For example: 
1. The user can see the manual story threads when trying to add them from the object list page. 
2. For a filter, the name will extend into the filter criteria and results section. 
3. The details button for the story thread when trying to save allows the edit to save but does not close the details dialog.

column1: When using Multiple Choice as a filter criteria, the user cannot update from "Is Empty"
column29:
When "Is Empty" is applied for a multiple choice filter criteria and the user tries to update to "Is" or "Is Not", clicking "Update Filter" does not update the filter to the criteria chosen. 

Test Steps: 
1. Create an Advanced Filter
2. Add an Object Type that has a multiple choice (single select, multi select, or tag) attribute
3. Add a filter criteria that "Is Empty" 
4. Click the label saying "Attribute is empty" 
5. Select "Is" or "Is Not" and select values
6. Click "Update Filter" 
7. The criteria window closes but the filter does not update 

This is new functionality introduced this release.

column1: Change log issues when Created/Updating new or copied objects
column29:
When creating an object, there are two records in the Log File. The first record shows that an Object for a particular Object Type was created but no metadata. When that object is saved there is another log that includes the Name of the object as well as all Old and New data. 

With the change to the copyObject, now that copyObject counts as created, there is no metadata with that change. The log only shows an object was copied and shows no old data/new data. 

Dealing with INF-2924

column1: The Date in the Calendar is remaining although the user clicked "Clear"
column29:
On the Object List page, if the user enters a date into the calendar and then clicks "Clear" the data is cleared but the last date is remembered. Usually, the calendar defaults to today. 

Test Steps: 
1. Navigate to Object List page
2. Select a Date Attribute
3. Enter a date (besides todays date) into the Date field 
4. Click the "Clear" button next to "Apple Date Range" filter
5. Open the calendar and see the previously selected date is selected by default. 


This occurs on Roadmap

column1: Date Filter button on Objects Page always Active
column29:
The "Apply Date Range" button is active when no date information is entered. The button becomes disables as soon as a Date Attribute is selected but no date is entered. However, if nothing is in any Date Fields the button remains active. 

This occurs on Roadmap as well and have not heard any issues about it.

column1: Rollup tables are confusing outside of the POM use case.
column29:
As reported by Alison:

As we utilize the tables on other projects we are running into some

additional issues. I know that we developed these for a specific use case

(the POM), but the calculations are not working as a user would expect.

 

The calculation issue occurs in the data table as well as the roll-up table.

  

Please see attached. For FY17 - If there is a delta of 0, then the total is

0 even though in this example the total is actually 41.5K. Likewise is FY18,

the total is actually 0. Request was 388K, recvd 0 = total of 0 not 388K.

 

If we remove the delta row, then the totals become 83K for FY17 and 388K for

FY18 which is still incorrect.

column1: HTML markup for Memo Field values when saving objects
column29:
When a user edits an object, it does not have to be a memo field in that object, Memo fields are saved with HTML markup. This causes issues if the user is using the Memo field as a key for the project transfer.   Developer's note: When an object is first created, if the memo field has just text, no HTML markup is saved when the object is saved. When the object is edited and saved with no changes to the memo field, the HTML markup is saved, changing its value even though the user did not change it.  Example: Memo field on created, saved to database as: Hello world Memo field on edit, saved to database as:

Hello world

column1: Investigate - Live bug: Filters sometimes fail to load rules
column29:
Reported by: Alan Jones

There is a particular filter Alan is using on his IWS 10 planning project on roadmap.simventions.com that will not fully load. The page will load, and the data will return but if you expand the "Rules" drop down, the page errors and leaves you in a blank white screen. Alan narrowed it down to an issue with the "Carrier Planning and Execution" object type.

 

Checking the roadmap log, there are a few lines that may give a clue:

ERROR 2018-12-11 15:04:37,766 27344367ms DataAPIFiltering       allColumnsForNodeTypes           - A type collision occurred for attribute: 'Location'.  'Site Planning and Readiness' has 'Location' configured as a 'String', but 'Amphib Planning and Execution' has 'Location' configured as a 'LinkAttribute'.  Please change the attribute type or the caption of one of those attributes. 

Two object types were included with the a "Location" attribute  that should be compatible (one string, one LAV to that string).

**Object Type 1: Site Planning and Readiness

Attribute 1: Location as a String

Object Type 2: Carrier Planning and Execution

Attribute 2: Location as a LAV to Site Planning and Readiness

In some initial analysis, It appears the error is due to some code duplication in the code that checks whether attributes are compatible (the code exists in 2 places, and 1 is only called in this one place). This may not be the actual issue though since it just prints an error and moves on. Nancy may have more detail.

This may also be related:

 

ERROR 2018-12-11 14:58:29,804 26976405ms DataAPIFiltering       eClauseFromFieldFilterExpression - Invalid column in filter expression..  You cannot search for values in '':'__String' since it does not exist in this filter

 Affects: 4.9.10.0.

Roadmap log file is attached.
column79:
- May be fixed by new filter code; if not, create follow on story for fixing it.
- Has been restored to informedb-latest.

column1: copyObject is registered in the change log as an update, not an add
column29: copyObject uses the saveObject workflow, rather than creating a new object and then editing it. This causes it to be registered in the change log as an 'Update' action with a null prior state, rather than an 'Add' action. Generating a change log with this action will cause a null reference exception. At the moment the change log generator skips any 'Update' action with a null prior state, but copyObject should be re-worked so that that is no longer necessary

11/Jan/19 1:15 PM;MasonVines;It may not be ideal, but it is working the way it used to except now the objectCreated is actually logged and copy is logged as a create instead of update.

The reason for the two log lines (not that it matters if it isn't useful) is that the first is creating the object, then the update is when you save the details.

My suggestion is to mark this as done and talk to Matt if we wants to change the way events are represented in the change log. Unfortunately it isn't super straight forward change it to what we talked about.

column1: Excel Reports: Decide on an approach for handling errors
column29: For example, if a report is saved and the user doesn't have access to a project, what happens?
column79: #NAME?
column107:
28/Nov/18 1:07 PM;JohnSieck;Errors: Some best practices to keep in mind as we work on this story:

Error messages should be:
 * *Visible*  and highly noticeable, both in terms of the message itself and how it indicates which dialogue element users must repair.Keep in mind users with disabilities and never use color (i.e. red) as the only encoding mechanism; always include redundant cues that color-blind users can see (i.e. an icon).
 * *Preserve*  as much as the user's work as possible. Let users correct errors by editing their original action instead of having to do everything over again. For example, in presenting [ search results|https://www.nngroup.com/articles/search-visible-and-simple/], show a search box with the user's original query terms to facilitate revisions. If no hits were found, let users search a wider scope with a single click.
 * *Reduce the work*  of correcting the error. If possible, guess the correct action and let users pick it from a small list of fixes. For example, instead of just saying  _"city and zip code don't match,"_  let users click on a button for the city that matches the zip code they entered.
 * *Hypertext*  links can be used to connect a concise error message to a page with additional background material or an explanation of the problem. (Don't overdo this, though.) See errors as an opportunity to educate users.

Exceprt from https://www.nngroup.com/articles/error-message-guidelines/
column108:
28/Nov/18 1:18 PM;JohnSieck;h3. Potential errors:

*New report*
 * Blank name (name cannot be blank)
 * Invalid name (what would make it invalid?)
 * Invalid description (what would make it invalid?)
 * New report cannot be or fails to be created
 * No permissions to create a report

*Edit / Open report*
 * Report cannot be found, does not exist
 * Report fails to open (why?)
 ** no connection (internet, db, etc.)
 ** timeout
 ** unknown error
 * Denied, No permission to access report

*Save report*
 * Error occurs when user clicks Save or Save as
 ** no connection (internet, db, etc.)
 ** timeout
 ** unknown error
 * Error occurs when user clicks Save as
 ** report with the same name already exists
 ** invalid report name
 ** invalid report description

*Delete report*
 * Report cannot be found / does not exist
 * No permission to delete
 * Bad connection or session timed out
 * Another user currently has report open
 * Report is shared with other users

*Download report*
 * Report or data in the report cannot be found / does not exist (maybe another user deleted report or data while it was open)
 * No permission to download
 * Bad connection or session timed out
 * Unsaved changes (we currently handle this case)
 * problem occurs when preparing the report for download (what would the potential preparation problems be?)

 *Editing report:*
 * error when attempting to delete a sheet
 * error attempting to delete the last / only sheet
 * no permissions to delete a sheet

      *Add sheet*
 * error adding sheet (general)
 * error adding sheet due to invalid name
 * too many sheets?

*Show / Hide columns*
 * when no columns are selected what is displayed? Or are there defaults that cannot be removed?
 * too many columns selected?

*Macro file*
 * file is of wrong type
 * no macros present
 * file fails to upload
 * file is of same name as current file
 * macro file fails to delete

*Sharing*
 * user is not owner, no permissions
 * attempting to add user that does not exist
 * user cannot be assigned permissions?
 * attempt to modify permissions fails
 * duplicate user
 * duplicate permissions (Everyone has read only and Bob has read only) Do we care?
 * fails to apply permissions (if we stick with Apply button)

 *Search*
 * invalid search parameters are typed in
 * search parameters fail to find a valid match (info, not error)
 * search fails, error when searching
column109: 04/Dec/18 1:12 PM;JohnSieck;Possible errors are ready for review.  As agreed, other acceptance criteria will be broken out into separate stories.
column110:
04/Dec/18 4:16 PM;NancyKraus;*Reports Page*
 * Error loading report cards
 ** timeout
 ** connection error
 ** database error

*Save report*
 * duplicate names are allowed, so that would not be an error
 * error due to no permission to edit

*Download Report*
 * not sure one user will know another user has a report open unless we start tracking that in the database
 * as far as problems downloading the file - all sorts of things could go sideways - just look at the random issues the Word export has (usually dealing with the memo field)
column111:
06/Dec/18 11:09 AM;JohnSieck;General approach will be to use Microsoft UI Fabric MessageBar (aka Toast message). See [https://developer.microsoft.com/en-us/fabric#/components/messagebar.|https://developer.microsoft.com/en-us/fabric#/components/messagebar]

A MessageBar is an area at the top of a primary view that displays relevant status information. You can use a MessageBar to tell the user about a situation that does not require their immediate attention and therefore does not need to block other activities.

Rather than try to document every possible error (impossible), we chose to document the major error categories.  These include:
 * Data entry
 * Download
 * Loading page
 * Timeout
 * Access (permissions)

Specific error messages ought to be written when designing and implementing a given feature.
column112:
06/Dec/18 3:04 PM;MattChild;MessageBar looks like a good approach. As discussed, what we do next:
 # The only issue we've completed that this affects is the "Save and continue". We will update the "Save" story to annotate the messages for that.
 # For uncompleted work, we will annotate expected error states as a part of the "Design specifications" story as a part of the development pipeline. The error messages will be further elaborated when we decide on acceptance criteria for the implementation story.

column112:
13/Nov/18 3:18 PM;JohnSieck;There was an underline in IE and a dotted underline in Chrome on the breadcrumb links as of Nov 8.  The mockups were done before and were not updated to reflect this change so there is no expectation that it would be a part of this story.  The underline made it more obvious that the breadcrumbs were links.  UI guidelines have become codified after use of breadcrumbs for a couple decades:

Breadcrumbs are almost always implemented the same way, with a horizontal line that
 * progresses from the highest level to the lowest, one step at a time;
 * starts with the homepage and ends with the current page;
 * has a simple text link for each level (except for the current page, because you should [never have a link that does nothing|http://www.nngroup.com/articles/most-violated-homepage-guidelines/]); and
 * has a simple, one-character separator between the levels (usually ">").

The place we deviate is not having a line underneath our linked breadcrumbs. 

I am good with adding the line back in or creating a story to do so, and then talking about our process at retro. It is a good goal to have user feedback on visual designs, and those designs and their and specifications settled prior to starting development.

column1: AUT - Add wrapper class for WebUI.setText
column29:
This is a reminder for JP to create a story to implement a wrapper class for:

WebUI.setText(findTestObject('Project/textarea_Description'), description)

It's not too bad. But in everywhere you see this call, you have to pass a test object. If you write a wrapper in an Element class:

static void setText(String path, String text) \{
  TestObject elementForPath = findTestObject(path)
  WebUI.setText(elementForPath, text)
}

Then the invocation becomes:

Element.setText('Project/textarea_Description', description)

column1: Word Report: Configure the header for an object
column29:
In my research for  how to format the data within an object section, it became clear that users might choose multiple attributes to be a part of the object header, and not show them in the actual "data" section. For instance, here's how we might show one now:

JP Sieck

Title: Designer

Product: Informedb Enterprise

Years experience: 15

Manager: David Marshburn

 

Both Blaine and Amy had some variation like this in the example they came up with:

 

JP Sieck - Informedb Enterprise (Designer)

Years Experience: 15

Manager: David Marshburn

This seems like a very common use case and would also allow us to sidestep the "What attribute to use for the header" problem.

column1: Word Report: Add a "Group By" within a section of objects
column29:
As a part of my research into the default styling of word reports, Alan reported he would want to group by a particular attribute as a higher level organization mechanism for objects. For instance, if you've got an internal list of "employees", you might want to group by their Role. In a word document, that might look like:

H1 Software Engineer

H2 Dan

H2 Nancy

H2 Pete

H1 Technical Writer

H2 Amy

H2 Michelle

column1: Word Report: Set styling for a sub-section of attributes
column29:
In my research for default formatting, it became apparent that certain styling shows different kinds of data better than others. Ultimately, giving users some options for how to organize and show groups of information will help them style their data better.

Consider that there are 10 attributes.
 * 3 of them would look nice as bullets without any labeling on them (since they are self evident what they mean)
 * 5 of them can be put in a table because their data is compact and it's easier to scan.
 * 2 of them are longer attributes that need to be separate on their own line (images, memo)

It seems like there needs to be a "grouping" of attributes that you can configure the style for: bullets, table, or newline.

02/Oct/18 12:10 PM;RyanScranton;Issues: 

1. I keep receiving the attached error when exporting to excel. This was not there in the previous version. 

2. If the object that you are trying to export has a date attribute that is blank an error is thrown. (This may not be a part of the issue, I would talk to Matt to see if we should write up a new story or fix it here)

column1: As a user I would like some indication when the object types selected do not contain any attributes so that I am not left wondering if the application is working properly
column29:
When filtering in an automated story thread, a user may select a combination of object types with no attributes other than the defaults.  When this case occurs no attributes appear in the filter except for Last Modified Date.  To the user it looks like Informedb is not returning any attributes for those object types.  It is perceived as a bug. 

 

In this case, providing a simple message to the user will help them understand why no attributes are shown.
column79:
When none of the object types selected have attributes, place a message in the filter where the attributes would normally appear that reads:

"0 attributes
The selected Object Types do not contain any attributes."

column1: Show a user that a "duplicate object" is happening and prevent further action
column29:
Occurred when Matt Child / Dan were trying to reproduce Christy's "Deadlock transaction" issue with hardware. When you duplicate an object, you can still interact with the website even though it is working and doing things in the background. When the load finishes, you are moved to the duplicate page.

Instead, you should be prevented from interacting with the site and be given a "Working" indicator.

column1: If a date is the last attribute in the list when editing, then the end of the calendar is blocked by the DoD footer.
column29: If the user has a date attribute as the last in the list when editing an object, the calendar is cutoff by the DoD banner.
column107: 08/Dec/17 11:07 AM;RyanScranton;This can not be replicated on roadmap.

column1: Update the default slide template to include an example of doing [[FY]]
SSF with no options set will show in Filter page with one unlabelled checkbox
column29: The single option has no caption and is un-clickable. See image

column1: Advanced Filter: Search multiple strings and numbers
column29: The advanced filter will only let you search for a single criteria in "is" or "contains" for strings, or single numbers for "is". It would be nice to specify multiple to give the user the option to "or" between a few different strings.

column1: Change object details page connectivity view to use a number count instead of +
column29: The visualizer now shows a number count of the number of nodes that will be expanded when pressing the + button. It would be useful if the D3 view on the object details page did the same, because it gives users a general sense of how much information they'll be seeing.

column1: Check boxes move slightly on the screen on basic filter
column29:
Reported by: Brad Neal at Sprint Review 32

When you first come to the basic filter page, the check boxes are nicely aligned. But as you click around on other places on the page (For example, selecting check boxes for object types) the boxes do not align anymore.

column79:
Attempting to create a duplicate project is handled gracefully, even if the user clicks Save immediately after having successfully created a new project.

A suggested error message for at least one of the cases would be:
The new project cannot be created because a project with the same exact name already exists. Would you like to switch to the existing project called ["project name]"? (dev: make 'switch to the existing project' a link to the project)

column1: Error creating object types
column29: When adding an object type the Adding object type progress screen spins and spins until one gets impatient and clicks refresh (shock!), then an alert message appears (see attached).

column1: Visualizer: Add ability to turn of export of header / footer when exporting images.
column29: For unclassified users, it is often better to have it unmarked.

column1: Whitespace in single select fixed config causes that option to disappear in the object details page
column29:
Reported by Brad:

So, in Roadmap, specifically the SimV NOAC project, we have 47 manager Groups with rules that hinder people from seeing people outside of their group.  But on two occasions, first the “Brad Neal” group / SSF selection would disappear when a person selects their name... now “Gail Brooks” group / SSF selection disappears when a person selects that person in their profile as their manager.  I know this is probably a little vague for a description of a problem, but please swing by my office and I’ll show you.  Having this happen twice now, I would think this is a ‘bug’.  The way that the Brad Neal option was resolved was to recreate that group/rules/SSF field
column107: 20/Aug/18 10:43 AM;MattChild;After looking at this issue with Brad, there was a space after here name; e.g., 'Gail Brooks '. Removing the space fixed the issue.

To enable just-in-time (JIT) debugging, the .config file for this
application or computer (machine.config) must have the
jitDebugging value set in the system.windows.forms section.
The application must also be compiled with debugging
enabled.

For example:

<configuration>
    <system.windows.forms jitDebugging="true" />
</configuration>

When JIT debugging is enabled, any unhandled exception
will be sent to the JIT debugger registered on the computer
rather than be handled by this dialog box.

column1: Change the language on the Project Transfers about being able to save a transfer
column29:
The saving a transfer functionality is not developed, but we have labels that say the user can save their transfer. The language and location it needs to be changed is below. 

* After clicking "Import Data" and the loading spinner appears the label says "You are ready to start importing data. If the import tasks isn't already saved, you will have a chance one it's complete." This label is shown on Step 4 of the project transfer.

Project to Project: RBAC is applied when exporting and importing projects.
column29: Prior to Project Transfer, RBAC was not used when exporting or importing projects using PtoP. Project Transfer added checking RBAC rules in some cases, but is not thorough for the full PtoP use case. It needs to be determined how RBAC affects taxonomy export and import as well as the data exporting and importing. And then implement that.

column1: Disable editing of Last Date Modified on Object Details page
column29:
When editing an object on the Object Details page, the Last Date Modified field is editable. However, when the object is saved, the server disregards the value the user entered.

The field should not be editable to avoid confusion.

column1: Change "Required fields" model to "Incomplete objects" model
column29:
Currently, fields can be marked as "required". This is technically unnecessary beyond a small fixed set of fields, but is used for business rules.

This is inconvenient because:
 * objects can't be saved while required fields are blank, leading to users typing in junk data
 * schema changes can result in these rules being quietly violated anyways

New proposed model:
 * Objects have a state of being "Complete" or "Incomplete" based on the business-logic validation rules
 * Objects failing validation CAN still be saved, but will be marked Incomplete in appropriate UI sections
 * incomplete objects are left out of reports by default
 * there is some easy way to locate incomplete objects

column1: Infinity spinner: User has no way of knowing they are prevented from attempting to save an object type with a denied value
column29:
Discovered when testing INF-1162.
If there is a Rule that denies a user access to a given object, a user may still attempt to create an object of that type.  They will not be able to create one, but the only notification a user gets is a spinning "Saving..." alert that will not ever go away....ever.  

Two possible solutions:
1) Remove the denied attribute value as an option from the editable form. User won't know what they don't know and therefore cannot create an error or warning state.
2) If the value must be shown, on Save attempt, show user an alert (toast) message that reads, "Access Denied.  You do not have permission to set the [attribute name] attribute to [denied attribute value].  Please choose a different value."

Of course option #2 language may vary depending on the attribute type.

Current proposed solution: Warn the user what's going to happen.
- If an object is going to become read only, they get a confirmation dialog that says this will become read only.
- If an object is going to become denied, they get a confirmation dialog that says they will no longer be able to see this object.

column1: Advance Filter: "Memo" doesn't coalesce with other text types (String, LAV)
column29:
If you have a object type "Employee" with a field "Education" that's a memo because an employee has a lot of education and Object type "Student" with a string field for education, you can't create a rule in the advanced filter that searches between those two things.

 

Matt Notes:

I'm worried once we have a base assumption that you can only compare exactly typed attributes, that may creep into every section of the system and getting it out again will be very difficult. Being able to treat things that "feel" the same to a user in the same way is a long term design goal that I was excited filters are moving us towards.
column79: - If you have "Employees" with a "Education" field string, and "People" with an "Education" field memo, adding both "Employees" and "People" to a single row in an advanced filter lets both education fields be searched

column1: Upgrade KendoUI to new version with react support
Filter Story Threads: Combine properties across types that are similar
column29:
The current implementation of attributes across types creates a separate filter entry for each type of attribute. This feels pretty close, but in looking at it similar attributes feel out of place when they are named the same. For instance, if you have a single select fixed name "Date" that has values "Yes", "No", and "Maybe" and an actual Date called "Date" , those values will show up differently in the UI and they will be clearly differentiable. If the values are represented in the same way (like with single select, multi select, and tag), it's unclear which is which, and also feels like a meaningless separation.

If two object types have attributes that are stored different but feel or are selected in the same way, they should be combined. For instance:
 * "Animals" has a single select fixed of "Type" that has values "Big", "Little" and "Small"
 * "Buildings" has a multi select fixed of "Type" that has values "Big", "Giant", "Glass", and "Occupied"

In this case, there would be a single "Type" entry that has "Big", "Little", "Small", "Giant", "Glass", and "Occupied".

NOTE: This story is less important if it is easy to migrate from the current implementation to a coalescing implementation in a future release. If we feel like we can do that without issue, pull this story off the top, change the fix version to 4.9.9.0 and we'll do it later. If it will require a significant or risky change, or will require is to do complex data migration in the database, we should do it now before they have a lot of story threads.

column1: Can't Create new projects on NSERC - Remove dependency on SMO
column107:
10/Aug/18 3:56 PM;NancyKraus;SMO is used because after creation of the project, a handful of SQL scripts are executed on the new database. These scripts have GO statements in them. GO is used by SQL Management Studio. If only a SQL connection is made and the SQL scripts are executed as a command in that connection, it errors out due to the GO statement - it doesn't know what to do with it. Therefore, SMO was used to execute the script.

Instead of using SMO, the scripts can be parsed on the GO statements and each executed one at a time.

column1: Error generating word document with certain memo fields
column29:
Submitted by Brad Neal:

If you try to take this paragraph (see attached) and put it in a memo field in Roadmap... and then create a Word document... it barfs.  I’m hesitant to show you what I found to see if you can find it... but to save time... the word “Distributed Interactive Simulation” is the Key.  It doesn’t look like anything special at first... but if you put/paste this into our memo field, the Distributed Interactive Simulation becomes a hyperlink... and that hyperlink breaks the Word Generator. 

 

I cannot find anything in Word that supports that this is a hyperlink... so I have no idea why it is that way in Roadmap.

column107: 27/Jun/18 8:51 AM;MattChild;Nancy did some investigation into this and determined it was because there were bookmarks that redactor was converting into malformed anchor tags. When the word library sees the malformed tags, it explodes.

column1: Can't update an object that has a lot of LAV attributes
column29:
Reported by Jason Redcay.

Server: roadmap.simventions.com

Project: LCS Enterprise Planning Tool

Object Type: Avails

Object: LCS 0003 SRA FY20 Copy

 Suspected attribute: SCDs (Caption: Applicable SCDs)

This may or may not be related to LAV's, but the particular object had a LOT of LAV values in a LAV attribute.`
column107:
28/Jun/18 11:27 AM;MattChild;Jason found additional detail:

Here is what I know after about 45 minutes of independent testing. I caution you…I can absolutely repeat what you are about to read.

 

Hypothesis: a single database object cannot have more than 40 relationships if these relationships are a LAV.

 

Considering everything we talked about yesterday…an Object Type with multiple LAVs (synced turned on).

 
 * I started from your theory that the timeout is occurring due to some factor.
 * I performed testing to see if the number of links (i.e. relationships) from one object to another would slow the database as the number of relationships increased.
 * I used the “LCS 0003 SRA FY20 – Copy” object from the Avails OT I created yesterday and removed all the relationships from it to SCD objects. Remember, we could not modify or delete “as is”.
 * After doing this I was successfully able to change the name of the object. Name changed Magic Number X.
 * I then used Magic Number X in the Avails OT to relate objects from the SCD Info OT. in batches of 10 at first.
 * Each time I added the batches of 10 I change the name of my Avails object (Magic Number) to Magic Number 10, Magic Number 20, etc.
 * As the number of related objects increased it took more and more time to save the changed name of the object.
 * When I got to 50 related objects, I could no longer change the object name from Magic Number 40 to Magic Number 50.
 * I then began with 40 as my starting point and worked upwards in batches of 5.
 * I started with 45 and finally worked my way back down to 40 which I believe is the number of related objects allowed to modify an attribute before the error occurs.
column108:
17/Aug/18 1:11 PM;RyanScranton;Scenarios that were successful to pass issue: 

1. Was able to update/duplicate/delete and restore an object that had 2 LAV attributes that had 75 links each. This was in the LCS project and Object Type that the issue was reported, however not the same object. (This was sufficient for the LAV Attribute having a lot of values) 

2. Was able to update/duplicate/delete and restore and object that had 18 LAVs where 12 of them had 40+ values. Not necessarily that many links because some LAV attributes had the same Object Type. (This was sufficient for the Objects having alot of LAV attributes.)

column1: Project Transfer: Handle null values in the key column?
column29:
When selecting which attribute is the key attribute for matching objects between the source and destination project, we need to better define how to handle nulls.

After initial discussion among the development team, the leading option is that nulls should be ignored and not "count" as a key, but not prevent users from using it as a key column. If we were to do this, we would need to update the language (and perhaps interface) to explain the null behavior and give users some indication of what's happening (for instance, an "Ignored" column)
column79:
- objects with a null value for the key attribute do not count as duplicates
- objects in the source that have a null value are not copied (ignored).
- Final Import step has a column for "Ignored" objects from the source.
column107:
04/May/18 9:16 AM;RyanScranton;State of "Duplicates" in the key field for each attributeType that is null:
* Integers - Blank values are not considered duplicates on the front end
* Strings - Blank values are considered duplicated on the front end 
* Memos - Blank values are considered duplicated on the front end

column1: Can't export data via EDX with attributes that have certain names
column29:
Reproter: Jason Redcay:

*Description:* Cannot export data via EDX with a Date_Time attribute titled, “A720”

*Troubleshooting:* 1) testing of same attribute names listed above within other Object Types; 2) name variance (i.e. shorter, longer, etc.) using letters and numbers. Some examples include A123, AB123, ABC123 and ABCD123.

*Conclusion:* When the name was changed from “A720” to “AMod720” the data associated with AMod720 could be exported via EDX. The user can deduce that when naming a Date_Time attribute, the minimum requirement must be 4 or more letter prior to numbers.
column107: 24/Jul/18 12:02 PM;MattChild;Alison and I discussed this and decided that the workaround is sufficient for now, because releasing a new EDX version may be complex.

column1: Project Transfer Step 4: Perform a transfer
column29:
Implementation notes:
 * We should start by creating 4 projects to experiment with the transfer. One pair of projects with no RBAC rules for importing to / from, one pair with RBAC restriction rules.
 * Once we're in a good state, we should back up the projects so we can easily restore them and re-run to test changes.
 * Party when it works (or if it doesn't)
column79:
- There are two "known" projects that the transfer can transfer between
- There is something that initiates the transfer on the website
- When transferring..
  - If the known "key" field isn't matched, a new object is created in my repository with the given key and matching fields. Non-matched fields should have their default values.
  - If the known "key" field is matched, the matching object is updated in my repository with the fields that match (on caption). Non-matched fields are not changed.
  - You can import data from any project, object type, attribute, and object you have RBAC read permission to see.
  - You can update your project if you have RBAC write permission to the object type, attribute, or object.

column1: Design an excel import capability
column29:
Similar to Project Transfer.

Users will do this monthly, bi-weekly, or possibly more frequently.

 

MVP:
 * Choose an excel spreadsheet
 * Choose an object type
 * Choose a key column
 * Do import

Bonus features / where it is headed:
 * Save and re-run the settings on a different excel file - Super useful but Alison can live w/o it if we absolutely had to
 * Support for multiple sheets (each sheet maps to 1 object type)
 * Choose to map the column names to fields in informedb enterprise s (not just use what is in the header row)
 * Choose to exclude columns from being imported

column1: Slide Generation: Filter with ANDs and ORs
column29:
Add support for the filtering of data in related items using composite predicates (potentially on different fields) like "all the data that has "Ship" in the name and all the data that has "Ship" in the title" or "only the data that has both "Ship" in the name and "Cargo" as the classification)

Since we don't have a good way to distinguish clauses in our syntax, it seems like we would have to introduce one (for conjoining expressions) My off-the-cuff instinct was:

(FilterByColumn << [SubType Contains ‘A’] || [Category Contains ‘A’]>>

Notes:

Nesting is desirable but not required.

 

 

Original message from Christy:

As we discussed, here is the potential syntax to support “or” (FilterByColumn << [SubType Contains ‘A’] || [Category Contains ‘A’]>>).  Im meeting with Rodney next Wednesday afternoon to discuss upcoming SW enhancement since I believe they may want this enhancement.  Just trying to get a level of effort for this, whether it be a small, medium or large.
column79:
- Can add an arbitrary number of "and" and "or" criteria for filtering slide output.
- Conditions on the same level are resolved left to right. (A and B or C and D = (((A and B) or C) and D)

column1: CEC: Allow rearranging objects in the timeline
column29:
* Must be able to change the font size of the labels (and persist this change to the project file)
 * Must be able to save the subtype config and node positions to the timeline in the project file.
 * Must be able to set explicit positions vertically. May be desirable to have 2 modes:
 ** Auto reorder everything else (algorithmically, layout manually positioned nodes first, then do the normal algorithm for everything else)
 ** Never reorder anything, and make the user rectify overlap (if desirable)
 ** Either solution will satisfy the need.
 * When computing the automated layout, prioritize relationships (dependencies) highest, followed by earliest date.Not required in contract language but may make the default views better.

column1: CEC: Configure Column Headers
column29:
* Tie time scale to chart only.
 * Header will increase or decrease width but remain at a consistent time scale based on user selection (five year, fiscal year, etc).
 * Each header section has a second row which shows a 2nd level of organization.
 * Can configure the 2nd row on or off
 * Add a time scale for Calendar Year (in addition to FY, 5 Years, etc).
 * Make sure it persists correctly in timeline (not listed in contract language but will be VERY irritating if it is not)
column107:
24/Apr/18 11:22 AM;MattChild;From contract Spreadsheet:

Header scales stay fixed to the user setting. With the + or - expansion adjust the chart timescale. The four header scale options in the timeline view have a second tier header. Standard will be one tier header with the option to select for a second tier, which will be one degree down.  Add Calendar Year as an option. Bundle with 5.

column1: Advanced Filter: Give an indication that a filter doesn't match up with the taxonomy
column29: If someone creates a rule in an advanced filter, it is possible to change the taxonomy afterwards to invalidate that rule. It would be nice to have some sort of indicator on rule criteria that can't possibly be valid, so you can take corrective action.
column79: - When looking at an advanced filter page, if one of the filters is no longer valid (because the taxonomy has changed) then show it visibly different (for example, make it gray instead of purple - but should consult designers)

column1: Project Designer: Warn what filtered story threads will be affected by changing the taxonomy
column29: Changes to the taxonomy in the design view may have implications that aren't obvious when you're making the change. It may change the results of filtered story threads that key off that name. Providing some sort of alert that says what might be affected will help users take corrective action, or may cause them to change their mind.
column79:
- When a user changes the caption of an object type, if there are any story threads that reference that object type, user gets a prompt telling them that "X" story threads will be affected.
- Prompt has the option to update the story threads to reference the new caption instead of the old caption or leave it like it is.
- When a user changes the caption of an attribute, if there are any story threads that reference that attribute, user gets a prompt telling them that "X" story threads will be affected.
- Prompt has the option to update the story threads to reference the new caption instead of the old caption or leave it like it is.

Advanced filter: Add an auto complete of variable values when creating string rules
column29:
Sometimes it is difficult to get define advanced filter rules exactly right when they are free text, so having an auto complete that shows you a list of values that match as you type would help you get to the right value faster.

This is extremely useful when doing "is" and "is not" rules (to make it easier to select the right values), but could also be useful when making "contains" type rules.

 

Mentioned by Matt W. at Sprint Review on 3/28/2018.

column1: Improve performance of slide generation
column29:
Slide generation can take upwards of an hour.

Pete did an initial investigation into the issue, and found this was a very solvable problem because it involved the way we were retrieving information about links and permissions in a very inefficient way.

 

Developer Notes:

Most of the slowdown was in the repeated calls to the database to check to see if the related items' and their object types were viewable.  Two problems here.  One is that we are iterating in the middle layer and calling into the database layer (horrible for performance).  Second, we should not be pulling data from the database layer into the middle layer if the user is not allowed to view that data.  Most of the time is taken in lines 167 and 168.  I (temporarily) commented them out so that I could generate slides while working an enhancement story without it taking forever to generate just the one test slide at a time.

Start here when looking at areas for performance improvement.

 

!image-2018-02-01-10-54-39-763.png!

column1: Project-to-project: Change downloads to use NSERC-compatible download method
column29: In 4.9.8.1, we made the download method configurable, which hopefully leads to an identification method for a way to initiate project to project downloads so the connection does not drop. We now need to implement that universally across the site so we have a consistent download paradigm and don't run into download issues elsewhere.

column1: Objects Export menu
column29: As it is we have three different menu items.  It is not clear to a new user that Export Object(s) exports to Excel. It also takes more cognitive effort to read and understand the sentence for generating "Slides" or a Word document.  Suggest we consolidate the terminology and the options.  Either use Generate or Export but be consistent.  Instead of "slides", use Power Point and explicitly say Excel instead of nothing at all.  With the addition of Word as an option, this will make the menu consistent, succinct, and easy to comprehend at a glance.
column79:
On both the Objects and Object pages, under the Actions command button / menu, there should be a menu item named "Export Objects(s)   (n)" within which would be listed three options:

    Excel
    PowerPoint
    Word

Optionally include the icon for the app to the left of the app name. See attached icons.

column1: EDX wiping 'Story Thread' attribute selections
column29:
If the special 'Thread' - 'Story Thread' attribute is present in an object type, the selections will be wiped (and in turn, removing the objects from the story thread) when performing an EDX import.

This is caused because the attribute does not store any data in the mtb table, instead it pulls the story threads connected on Object load. This does not happen during EDX.

We used to use NAME/CAPTION as the reference, we fixed Informedb to use GUIDs, but EDX is still using NAME/CAPTION.  The database likely did not lose the data, but the reference to it needs updating... and 'the script' needs to be ran again on the DB to get the SSF and MSF values back?!

column1: Custom HTTP error response messages
column29:
When an HTTP error response is thrown, messages to the user can be better.  To a user, an error page outside of Informedb's styled pages with the word "Server Error" and "You do not have permission to view this directory..." or "Page not found" seems intimidating, scary and makes us look bad.  See advice on 404 errors (which can be applied elsewhere) at https://www.nngroup.com/articles/improving-dreaded-404-error-message/

FYI  -  On IIS7 you cannot customize the following HTTP errors: 400, 403.9, 411, 414, 500, 500.11, 500.14, 500.15, 501, 503, and 505.

When a user makes changes to a table attribute, those changes are saved with an object when that object is first saved. For example, say you have a blank table attribute. You go and change 3 objects. Those 3 objects are saved with the blank table. If you then go and change the table attribute in the designer, those 3 objects will have the original table even though you didn't really change them.

There are a few potential fixes to this, but one easy way might be to add a "Reset" option that returns a table to whatever the current default is.

column1: CECPhase2: Provide better support for relative dates.
column29:
At a coarse level, many projects have a roughly set schedule. As a few examples: 60 days after project start, you have a preliminary design review. 120 after you have a critical design review. When this kind of data is represented in informedb as objects, each of these dates needs to be updated by hand. Most of the time, these dates will shirt in accordance with some sort of anchor date.

This is especially true with dates that are long term. For something 2 years in the future, the date represents a notional plan rather than a firm deadline. However, as dates become closer and collide with reality, two important considerations need to be handled:
 - Dates that are defined exclusively relative may fall on non-working days. If the date is X + 30, that will sometimes fall on a Sunday and not accurately reflect the actual date.
 - Plans are always subservient to critical business needs. It may be a best practice to have 30 days to verify and accredit a new system, but if that system is going out on a ship to deploy for 6 months then high-ranking officials may push to find a way for it to happen in 25 days.

Christy was going to discuss this more with Rodney to feel out (from a business process perspective) how they would handle those cases now.

There were a few discussions about implementation:
 - Defining a new attribute type at the taxonomy level, "relative date" and picking a basis field and offset.
 - Whenever you update a date in an object, give the option to update other dates.

Contract Requirement:
 The contractor shall implement a new attribute capability to calculate dates based on a related date

11/22/17 CEC priority: 7

10/19/17 CEC Priority ranking: 6

column1: Word Export: Performance improvements when exporting images
column29:
When exporting images, the following can be improved to speed up the export:
 * Batch getting the images from the database
 * Even if an image is exported more than once, only get it from the database once
 * When writing the Word document, figure out how to re-use images that are in the document more than once

Current observations determined the export was slow when actually writing the file, not getting the data.
column79:
- Export 100 images at 640x480 in a minute
- Hard time box; if we aren't close, re-evaluate our acceptance criteria.

column1: CECPhase3: Visualizer - Provide a better way to display dates from disparate objects
column29:
As a schedule manager for the captain, I would like to be able to see link attribute values that are dates plotted in the visualizer so that I can see all of the dates that are relevant to me completing my schedule for shipping a given software baseline.

The taxonomy has baselines in it, and each baseline has related objects that contribute to the delivery of that baseline. The related objects are "meaty"; there is a lot of information to them other than just the date - for instance, the Element Cert Event might have a location, commanding officer, etc. For the purposes of viewing the schedule for delivering the baseline, the only thing that's really relevant for the element cert event is the date, which is the "Testing Certification Date" to the baseline.

MC Notes: This requires a lot of thought on multiple fronts. One of the bedrock assumptions of Link Attributes was that they would only be displayed as text. While we could possibly parse those in the visualizer and isolate the change code there, doing so essentially commits us to propagating that functionality to the rest of the application. Another possible approach to solving the underlying issue is to have an "aggregation" capability in the visualizer's timeline; e.g., some rule  that would allow you to combine dates from various objects into a single "line". The concept would have to be explored more thoroughly though.


Contract requirement:
The Contractor shall enhance the Link Attributes with dates to plot in the visualizer as dates vs text.

column1: CECPhase2: Visualizer - Make timeline and matrix row headers easier to read
column29:
As a manager for the captain's schedule chart, I would like the row headers of the visualizer to be larger so that I don't have to add an overlay to the chart to make the headers readable when it is printed out.

MC Notes: The row headers are actually fairly hard to read at low zoom levels also. The column headers are readable and distinct, but the row headers can be very small. They should be made a consistent size with the column headers. There is a progressive font shrinking for sub-categories; this is no longer needed and can be removed in favor of a single larger font. In order to use a larger font for the row headers, we are also going to have to explore some combination of:
- Turning the text sideways.
- Splitting the text on word breaks.

Contract requirement:
The contractor shall provide a capability to customize the font in the Column and Row headers in the visualizer.

column1: Add security marking to Word exports
column79:
If security markings are turned off for the web site, the exported word files will not have security markings added by the application. 

 If security markings are turned on for the web site, the exported word files will have security markings added to the header and footer when the file is generated. 
  - The header and footer will be marked by: 
    - The marking will use the same text that is configured for the web site 
    - The text will be added as all caps 
    - The text will be in the center portion (not left or right) 
    - The text will use a 14 point font 
    - The text will be the same background and foreground color that is configured in the web site

column1: Timeline View: Rearrange objects vertically
column29: Within a row, users may know a better logical ordering for the items, than the default space-fitting algorithm.

column1: Timeline View: Milestones are hard to read at high zoom levels
column29:
At a high zoom level, the text on the milestones is very hard to read, which makes it very difficult to read the text.

Fixes to this could involve dynamically scaling the font at different zoom levels, or allowing manual configuration of the font.

column1: Timeline View: Add a legend to screen shots
column29: When exporting data from the timeline, it is likely to be shown to users who don't have any knowledge about what the colors mean. A legend would help people understand what they are seeing.

column1: Timeline View: Row and columns headers are hard to read at high zoom levels
column29:
At high zoom levels (like on print outs, or even within the tool) the headers in the timeline are hard to read.

There are numerous approaches that might fix this: Scaling the text based on the zoom level, having the text be vertical instead of horizontal, or letting users specify a font manually.

Matt has customer sensitive data that is screen shots of the overlays they do for working around the issue.

column1: Examine the way we do authorization in the site
column29:
When a user attempts to access something that they are not authorized to access, they are being re-directed to the login page. The login page, seeing a user is already logged in, displays a "you are not authorized" message. This has some unintended side effects, such as if the user attempts to access the login page after logging in, they are told they are not authorized. Also, when a user attempts to access the site by clicking on a provided link such as a link in a word document, MVC is redirecting them to login and the page, seeing they are logged in, redirects to the unauthorized message.

 

If a user is logged in and attempts to go to the login page, they should be re-directed to the dashboard

If a user is logged in and attempts to access another page they have access to and MVC re-directs them to the login page, they should be re-directed to the page they want to go to

If a user is logged in and attempt to access a page they do not have access to, they should be re-directed to a specific Unauthorized page

column1: CECPhase2: Filter & Sort related items on a slide
column29:
When generating slides from Informedb enterprise CEC has a slide template that they use to generate 47 product card slides, each of which may have between 10-30 related objects of a single type and there are 2 different types shown on the same slide. However, only some of the related items are relevant for the particular slide being shown - for example, only related items that are "Active". Paring down the data requires going into each of the 47 slides and finding and removing the related objects that have that attribute.

Their team would like the ability to filter which items are shown in the table based on a value. For instance, display only the related items whose "Status" column is "Active".

As a stretch goal, they would like to combine multiple criteria (using ands and ors).

Contract requirement:
 The contractor shall enhance the slide template options to filter on data displayed on a slide.

11/22/17 CEC priority: 5

10/19/17 CEC Priority ranking: 4
column79: Acceptance Criteria snuck by as an empty field all the way through to the first testing kickback.  :(
column107:
20/Oct/17 4:37 PM;JohnSieck;Future consideration: a slide builder that would help the user specify the data that goes into a slide, format the slide and preview the results, then save the template into a library of templates.  This would eliminate the need for a user to utilize short codes.

!!!!  MMT is wanting to do something similar to help their users customize and generate reports more easily.  !!!!
column108: 08/Jan/18 4:12 PM;JohnSieck;PPT slide attached is an example from Christy's CEC database (object MTB numbers are made up).  Syntax is negotiable as Christy was fine with several variations we showed her.
column109:
31/Jan/18 1:34 PM;MattChild;When generating slides from Informedb enterprise CEC has a slide template that they use to generate 47 product card slides, each of which may have between 10-30 related objects of a single type and there are 2 different types shown on the same slide. The data that is shown in these tables of related items appears to be unsorted. Since these slides go directly to the Captain for status reporting purposes, they need to be sorted and organized in a logical and consistent way (in the case, by sorting by fiscal year - which is displayed as a text string). To achieve the desired sorting, their process is currently to paste it into excel, sort it, and paste it back into power point. When doing this for nearly 50 slides weekly, this gets cumbersome.

Their team would like the ability to pick a column and sort how the related items fill out that column. The only required sort criteria are alphabetic (ignoring case) and ascending. In implementation, we should still expect to have a basic idea / understanding for how we might approach other sorts or changing ascending / descending in the future.

Contract requirement:
 The contractor shall provide a capability to sort how link data is shown on a slide by a business rule.

11/22/17 CEC priority: 6

10/19/17 CEC Priority ranking: 5
column110:
06/Feb/18 3:32 PM;RyanScranton;When filtering, the attribute that the user wants to filter on has to be in the related items table. This goes against the requirement of being able to filter on attributes that are not included in the related items table. This was found with with the following test steps on Latest in CEC 7: 
1. Go to product cards
2. Select "AHE DSSC 2+ (CEC 2.1.10.13)"
3. Click "Actions" 
4. Click "Generate Slides for Checked Objects" 
5. Click "Generate" for the "ProductCardV22-Test" template 
6. The "Interface Documents" section has a message saying "Column name 'SubType' does not exist." That column exists for the object type it is just not included in the related items table. 
7. Once "SubType" was added to the related items table the filter worked correctly.

System.Net.WebException: Unable to connect to the remote server ---> System.Net.Sockets.SocketException: No connection could be made because the target machine actively refused it 127.0.0.1:8983

   at System.Net.ServicePoint.ConnectSocketInternal(Boolean connectFailure, Socket s4, Socket s6, Socket& socket, IPAddress& address, ConnectSocketState state, IAsyncResult asyncResult, Exception& exception)

column1: Disable illegal characters when naming a new project
column29:
There are certain characters which cause big problems in a project name; those characters should be disallowed for now.

Known offending characters: comma (,), double quote ("),
 percent (%),
 period (.)

Also add some text to let users know which characters are not allowed.  (JP suggests alternative: Or just update the current text on the Create New Project page with the characters that are allowed)

column1: Provide some resolution for converting existing filters to use the type-aware filters
column29:
CEC has already created some filtered story threads. We need to provide some sort of resolution so that they do not lose all their work. Current options as I see it:
- Handle existing threads as they are persisted
- Run a migration script to convert their existing threads to the new format.
- Our team can hand make the changes after hours to replicate their existing stuff.

column1: Filter page: Dates across types sometimes produce incorrect results
column29:
When selecting multiple fields of dates in both the FROM and TO column, the way they are combined sometimes produce undesirable results. Consider the following setup:

Object Type 'Animals' has Date A
Object Type 'Barrels' has Date B
Object Type "Cars' has Date C

FROM:1/1/2016
+ Date A
+ Date B
Date C


TO: 12/31/2018
Date A
Date B
+ Date C

All objects from both "Animals" and "Barrels" will match.

Due to initial investigation of the SQL query, this is due to the way the query is realized:
( ( (Date A after 1/1/2016) or (Date A is marker date) OR
(Date B after 1/1/2016) or (Date B is marker date) )

AND

( (Date C is before 12/31/2018) or (Date C is marker date) ) )

MC Note: does marker date trigger our "before" match?
column107:
21/Nov/17 4:10 PM;JohnSieck;I created this story thread to test: [http://informedb-latest.dev.simventions.com/MRM/Lists/Filtered/c804d243-1e2f-4405-bc89-3ebabb53617f]

When selecting multiple fields of dates in the FROM or TO column, the way they are combined sometimes produces undesirable results. Consider the following setup:

Object Type 'Animals' has Cheetah with Date of Birth as 11/1/2015
 Object Type 'Barrels' has Wood Wine Barrel with Manufactured Date of 1/2/2016
 Object Type "Cars' has Mercedes Benz with Inspection Date of 11/15/2017

FROM:1/2/2016
 + Date of Birth
 + Inspection Date
 + Manufactured Date

All objects from "Animals", "Barrels" and Cards will match even though the Cheetah has a Date of Birth prior to the entered date of 1/2/2016. Now do the following:

FROM:1/2/2016
 + Date of Birth
    Inspection Date
    Manufactured Date

The Animals/Cheetah object no longer appears in the list. This is correct.

It seems that whenever more than one date attribute is selected all the objects appear even if the date entered should remove them from the story thread.  This holds true for both FROM or TO fields.

column1: Remove the need to ctrl-F5 when we deploy a new version of the software
column29: When we deploy a new version of the software, browsers may have an old version of the javascript cached. To get around this, we have trained our users to ctrl F5 when they run into issues. However, this still results in wasted time and erroneous bug reports. In addition, as we go out to a wider audience, we are less likely to be able to have direct contact to tell them the fix.

column1: Infinity Spinner when creating a manual story thread
column29:
As I was creating test data last night, I tried to create a manual story thread and it just spun infinitely in Sprint Review 18 on informedb-sprint.

This was created via the "New Story Thread" button, then selecting "Manual Story Thread". Creating a new story thread worked on the "Old" Story Thread page.

column1: DoD Banner: Do not show DoD banner again if login is failed
column29: If you type in an incorrect password, the DoD banner is shown again. This will get very irritating if you've forgotten your password and have to retry.

column1: DoD Banner: Do not change visited URL
column29:
After accepting the DoD warning banner, the top level URL in the URL bar is changed to:

 sitename.com/Account/DoDBanner

Selecting the URL and hitting enter presents an error about an request verification token. Refreshing the page (F5) shows a scary looking warning banner (attached).

The preferred behavior would be to not have accepting the DoD banner affect the URL in the browser's URL bar at all, which should resolve both issues.

column1: DoD Banner: Set focus on the "Accept" button
column29:
When the DoD Banner shows, the focus is still in the user name box. If you hit enter, it reloads the page and shows you the DoD banner again.

The simplest fix for this would seem to be to focus the "accept" button, which will allow users to get through it more quickly as well.

column1: Fix ptop when not including attachments
column29:
A code path exists to turn off including attachments, however it is currently broken. Dan has more detail.

 

 

includeAttachments value is also currently borked if set to false. This has to do with new way that attachments are stored (table uses a reference to the file instead of having the raw data in the export table) Dead reference when includeAttachments is false

If we can get this done before RC on wednesday, it should be included in 4.9.8.1.
column107:
28/Nov/17 11:19 AM;DanielBiester;to test, change web.config setting to not include attachments in PtoP export.


 <add key="PtopIncludeAttachments" value="true" />    (change to false)

 

confirm that export/import still works. Attachments will not transfer over. 

 

Joined with 1505

column1: Set 'IncludeAttachments' in web config for PtoP
column29:
Currently, PtoP always imports and exports attachments. this can slow down attachment heavy projects for testing. Making this settable in the web config would allow developers and testers to test faster internally

If we can get this done before RC on wednesday, it should be included in 4.9.8.1.

column1: Filter criteria and its real estate ought to be hidden when nothing is selected
column29:
# Create a blank filtered story thread.
 # Click on an Object Type.
 # Type something in to Search Within. The criteria appears as it ought to.
 # Uncheck the Object Type. The criteria remains but it should not be shown as nothing* is selected.

* When nothing is selected there is too much space between the "To populate your story thread..." text and the name of the story thread in the Portlet Header. There should be only 16px of space between the bottom of the Portlet header and the top of the block of text no matter what the state of the filter criteria (hidden or shown).
column79: When no criteria is selected the filter criteria ought to be hidden, including its space (real estate). See mockup approximation in attachment (it is missing a piece of the border but you get the idea)

column1: Filter criteria Date labels ought to be From and To not After and Before
column29: When Date range criteria is chosen, users see "To" and "From" as the labels but when the info appears in the criteria radiator it is labeled "Before" and "After."
column79: The Date filter criteria labels ought to match the Date criteria component.  Labels ought to be "From" and "To" so they match.

column29:

When analyzing this, also test what happens if your first connection to the site includes a suburl reference (e.g., the "objects" page) to see if it correctly prompts and redirects.

This can be tested on:

https://informedb-latest-cac.dev.simventions.com/

column1: There are no front end checks implemented for when the user has Read Only for story threads
column29: If the user has read only for story, there are still buttons that allow the user to think they have full permissions. The "New Story Thread" button is still listed. The "Create" and "Delete" button on the manual story threads page is still there.

column1: Users should be able to change the e-mail address on their CAC and still login
column29:
Currently, e-mail is set once and is used to verify a user's identify. If a user changes the e-mail associated with their CAC, they will no longer be able to login.

Nancy has done preliminary investigation into this issue and concluded that resolving this should include changing the validation process to work with the UPN from the CAC and modifying the web.config to allow duplicate e-mails.

column1: Can't create CAC user with the same first and last name as a previous user
column29:
When Joe Smith creates an account on a CAC server, his information is stored in the user database. If another Joe Smith tries to create an account, they will fail to log in and the log file will say "duplicate user name".

Nancy has done preliminary investigation into this issue and concluded that resolving this should include changing the the username for users to the UPN from the CAC and having separate profile properties for first and last name. As such, the display on the website should be changed to display those profile properties instead of the username. We need to create a migration script for existing databases to the new scheme.

column1: Users should be able to create an account on a CAC-configured server with no associated e-mail address
column29:
There is no e-mail certificate associated with secret CACs on sNSERC. When a user first logs into the site with a CAC, Informedb Enterprise creates an account with information from the CAC.  Since this process is (and must be) automatic, users must be allowed to create accounts with no e-mail address.

Nancy has done preliminary investigation into this issue and concluded that resolving this should include changing the validation process to work with the UPN from the CAC and modifying the web.config to allow duplicate e-mails.

column1: CAC Login should verifies that the specific user that has logged in has a domain account
column29:
Currently, when a CAC user is checked for their domain account, a wildcard based on the last name is used to search active directory. For instance, if a user with the last name "Jo" logs in, and he doesn't have an account, he will still be allowed if another user with the last name "Jones" exists.

The check is done by querying an LDAP server. When implementing, add a pre-step to verify that the server is up and log an error so that we can clearly identify server connectivity issues. In Nancy's initial look at the log files from NSERC, there were frequently account login failures and we need to learn if this is a server connectivity problem or a problem with our application.

column1: Unable to modify user's profile if user does not have an email
column29: In Enterprise Manager, when editing a user's profile, the email address is required. If the user does not have an e-mail address, the admin cannot save changes to the profile (for example, giving the user access to a project).

column1: Update places that show username to show display name
column29:
Update any place on the site that shows the username to show the display name. The display name should be the first and last name of the user, if they are set, otherwise it is the username.  The places that need to be updated are:
 * Object Details Page
 ** Attachment Author
 ** Recent Changes
 * Filter (new story thread page) Author and Modified By
 * Notifications
 * Custom Error page
 * Enterprise Manager Pages:
 ** Assign user to group
 ** Create new user
 ** List of all users

Additionally, update the SQL tables to include the ID of the user and link back to the Users table in the UsersDB. This will uniquely identify the user since the display name is not necessarily unique.

column1: STIG: Disable password changing on a CAC configured server

Also, there is a Cat I stig that states passwords can not be displayed in cleartext. When a password is reset via EM, the new one is displayed to the user, which may be a violation. Disabling it on CAC enabled sites prevents the problem.

column1: As a user, when creating a story thread, I need to better understand how each filter criterion is working so I can get the results I want
column29: In a story thread, for each criterion component in the left sidebar, provide a way for a user to hover or click to get an explanation of how that criterion works.  For example, user clicks or hovers over a small question mark icon to learn that "Search Within" searches all text fields and that a text field is like a person's name, not a single select fixed or multiselect option like Document Status or Color.
column79:
Each criterion component has a 16x16 question mark icon with 8px padding to the left and right. When a user clicks or hovers a message appears explaining how that criterion works. The user can click [X] or a Got it! button to close or, if hovering, simply move their mouse away so that the question mark loses focus. Accessibility The question marks should display a visible focus state when users tab to them. Avoid using
or tags to create the question mark. Screen readers don’t automatically know either is a usable button. Remember that screen readers handle links slightly differently than they do buttons. Pressing the Space key triggers a button, but pressing the Enter key triggers a link. When labels are used to call out new content that is dynamically loaded onto a page, be sure to use ARIA live regions to alert screen readers of the change.

column1: Improve the access request process
column29:
This was discussed in the sprint review on 1/31/2018 by Chuck Fullerton.

Tying the right people to the project that they need to do their job is a difficult process that is blocked by a single point of failure. We need a way to democratize this process by creating local project administrators who have the power to grant access to their information (both project and RBAC group).

One possible implementation of this would be to define high level activities that the project does that new users would be looking for. For example, "Fleet Support" may be the name of the project, but the needs they serve might be:
 * Shipboard Maintenance
 * Crew Analysis
 * Drydock scheduling and planning.

column1: Add declassification parameters to information in informedb
column29:
This was discussed in the sprint review on 1/31/2018 by Chuck Fullerton.

Classified information must also have a date when the information should be declassified; this should be incorporated into information that is labeled or marked.

column1: Add reference to original classification authorization to information in informedb
column29:
This was discussed in the sprint review on 1/31/2018 by Chuck Fullerton.

Pieces of data (values of attributes in informedb) may have a classification level. That classification level is typically a derivative classification that ties back to an original classification authority, and references an original document. This would provide a user a way to go back and identify what that original source of that classification if they need to verify it.

column1: Add distro statements to reports generated in informedb
column29:
This was discussed in the sprint review on 1/31/2018 by Chuck Fullerton.

Security markings should include a distribution statement about who is allowed to see the information. We could make it easier for users to add this by prompting them and then including the distro statement as a reminder for them to do it.

 

Examples of a distribution list are usually represented by a letter; A-G. It defines who can access it.

column1: Keep sync'd with links - Clear related items if keep sync'd is unchecked.
column29:
Checking this results in a massive change to the links in the database, which there will be no easy way to clear.

If they are unchecking it, it seems more likely that they are switching use cases - not "This attribute should show everything", but "I want to specify what links are relevant." Starting them from a blank slate makes this use case easier to support and helps make the check box feel more "symmetrical", which will help understanding.

column1: CPP DO17 P3: Sort Related Items in Column
column29:
This reqt is TBD based on new SME from Delta Inc for SSDS.

As a user, when I pull in related items table on a PPT, the columns are not configurable.  Currently all the data coming over is in random order.  We need to give the user an option to sort by a specific column/attribute.  

Consider adding a "special tag" in the PPT template that tells the SW to sort on this column when the data arrives in the table.

In the example below, the ShortName would be sorted alphabetically:

What PPT Template formula used to look like...
<# RelatedItemsAsTable::MTB35::MTB6::ShortDocTitle, ShortName, DocStatus #>

What the PPT Template formula looks like with Alphabetically tag on ShortName...
<# RelatedItemsAsTable::MTB35::MTB6::ShortDocTitle, ShortName|A|, DocStatus #>

Or something like that...
