column1: Investigate performance of periodically failing unit test
column29: The unit test GetDetails_Batch_PerformanceMeetsMinimumRequirement periodically fails on the build server. The failure is occurring because the timeout threshold is being exceeded. This does not happen all the time, but when it does, it prevents Jenkins from completing successfully. It should be investigated why this failure is happening. It may be a software issue. If it is, it should be fixed. It could also be a server issue. If that is the case, the test should either be changed or disabled to the failure does not prevent Informedb Enterprise from being deployed.

column1: STIG - End the user's session when the browser is closed
column29:
When a user closes the browser, the user's session should be ended. This is related to a Cat I stig.

 

It's possible to indicate that a cookie should not persist across sessions, does ASP.NET do this?
column107: 16/Jan/18 2:46 PM;MattChild;Response from Mike Brown and Tram is to just generally talk about session security and how browsers are limited to a 10 minute timeout.

column1: STIG: Reset password should e-mail you the password
column29:
Showing passwords in clear text on the website is a stig violation. In addition, this gives the password to the administrator and requires further action from the administrator to give the password to the user.

Instead, we should adopt an approach like other sites use; generate and send an e-mail to the user about their reset password.

column1: Visualizer: Nodes without a label are hard to identify in the various tree views
column29:
Specifically brought to attention by Christy, but this is relevant to many customers.

Many customers clear out the label field of a node and instead use label annotations to display the "real" name of that node. As such, in the node tree or the "Create Links" dialog, it's difficult to identify which node is which because they are all "Untiltled".

MC Notes: If people are circumventing the use of labels, this indicates a problem in the way labels are being presented. Label annotations are meant to provide supporting information about the node itself, not being used as a primary mechanism for identifying a node. The system needs a "label" design construct to be able to concisely represent that node to a user. This likely means we need to look at how the various views are interpreting and using the label attribute, and provide more options for how it is presented.

column1: MDA Install Support
Remove "SubType" from being required
column29:
Christy removed "subtype" because she wanted a different attribute; subtype no longer made sense for her taxonomy. You can work around this by having a subtype field that is not show in any attribute group, but this is a symptom that it's not universally applicable.

Subtype was original put in as a sort of coarse filtering mechanism. Removing this as a field that is required by the web application would give users greater control over their taxonomy.

column1: Rapidly clicking multiple object type checkboxes may make the filter page slow to respond
column29:
If the user goes from no selected object types and quickly clicks the first 3 types in the list, don't send 3 requests.  If there is a delay between clicks of X seconds, submit the request.  Or, if there is a request in the queue, ignore it if the user submits another request before the results come back.

Team notes: Throttle observables to only have one in flight request at a given time.

column1: STIG: Allow different session timeouts for different types of users.
column29: There are two Cat II stig requirements related to session timeouts. Regular users have a 15 minute timeout and admins have a 10 minute timeout. Both are met by configuring the timeout in the Web.config. However, it would be nice to be able to configure different timeouts for different types of users.

column1: CECPhase2?: Make Link attribute configuration "Always include new links" include existing links
column29:
As CEC has used the "Always include new links" configuration capability of link attributes, they realized an important use case was missing. Frequently, link attributes are created after the links have been established. That means that users still have to go in and manually add each link that is existing.

Chirsty's proposal was to have the "Always include new links" check box go back and retroactively add all previously linked objects.  This may potentially lead to confusing situations if the user is allowed to edit the link attributes after this has been checked - so we may also need to disable editing if the check box is checked. If we were to do so, "Always include new links" would probably be better named as "Keep sync'd with links"

11/22/17 CEC priority: 3
column79:
Attribute Editor Page:
- LAV attribute configuration screen should be renamed from "Always include new links" to "Keep sync'd with links"
- When checked, all existing links should be added to objects of that given type.
- When unchecked, all link attributes should be "unchecked" (cleared)

Object details page:
- When "Keep sync'd" is checked, the LAV should still be openable in a separate dialog, but no changes should be able to be made to the selections.

 * Excel
 * PowerPoint
 * Word

As it is we have three different menu items.  It is not clear to a new user that Export Object(s) exports to Excel. It also takes more cognitive effort to read and understand the sentence for generating "Slides" or a Word document.  Suggest we consolidate the terminology and the options.  Either use Generate or Export but be consistent.  Instead of "slides", use Power Point and explicitly say Excel instead of nothing at all.  With the addition of Word as an option, this will make the menu consistent, succinct, and easy to comprehend at a glance.

column1: Filter story thread: Can't search for dates that which are missing a value
column29:
If the date filter is blank, it should match all objects for which that date field is defined but does not have a value. For instance:

Object A has "EndDate"
Object B has no date fields.

Filtering the "to" of the date field to a blank and selecting "EndDate" should match all objects in Object A that don't have a date set.

From pete's original report:
When I click on the “EndDate” checkbox for the “To” portion of the “Date Range” filter component, it filters on a blank date since I have not selected one not.  No dates can be empty strings, so this seems to be an invalid filter condition.

SELECT dbo.EntMoreRestrictiveOfObjectTypeAndObjectAccessForGroup('00000000-0000-0000-0000-000000000000', objecttypeid__GUID, id__GUID) as MoreRestrictiveOfObjectTypeAndObjectAccessLevel, *  
 FROM FilterView_53_54_55_56_57 
  WHERE dbo.EntMoreRestrictiveOfObjectTypeAndObjectAccessForGroup('00000000-0000-0000-0000-000000000000', objecttypeid__GUID, id__GUID) > 0 
   AND
   (
      (
         ((dbo.[EntTagColumnContainsExactValue]([enddate__Tag],  'EndDateTag_02') = 1 OR [enddate__Tag] = 'PlacehoooooolderForWhenObjectTypeDoesNotHaveTagColumn' )         )
       And 
         ([enddate__SingleSelect] = 'EndDateSingleSelect_01' OR [enddate__SingleSelect] IS NULL         )
       And 
         (([enddate__Flag] = 'true' OR [enddate__Flag] IS NULL )         )
       And 
         (
            (([enddate__Date] > '5/7/2017' OR [enddate__Date] = '1/1/1753 12:00:00 AM' ) Or ([enddate__Date] = '5/7/2017' OR [enddate__Date] = '1/1/1753 12:00:00 AM' )            )
          Or 
            (([last date modified__Date] > '5/7/2017' OR [last date modified__Date] = '1/1/1753 12:00:00 AM' ) Or ([last date modified__Date] = '5/7/2017' OR [last date modified__Date] = '1/1/1753 12:00:00 AM' )            )
         )
       And 
         (
            (([enddate__Date] < '' OR [enddate__Date] = '1/1/1753 12:00:00 AM' ) Or ([enddate__Date] = '' OR [enddate__Date] = '1/1/1753 12:00:00 AM' )            )
         )
      )
   ) 
  ORDER BY   [short name__String] ASC  
 OFFSET 0 ROWS FETCH NEXT 50 ROWS ONLY

column1: Show Row Numbers in Table Editor and Rollups
column29: As an Informedb user, I would like to be able to toggle row numbers for table attributes and rollup tables so the information is easier to follow.
column79:
-	The table editor and rollup table viewer has a “Show Row Numbers” checkbox
-	The checkbox/toggle works whether the table is in view or edit mode
-	Delta rows are not numbered and do not count in the numbering.

column1: Improve Keyboard Shortcuts in Table Editor
column29: As an Informedb user, I would like to be able to use common keyboard shortcuts in the table editor for better ease of use when editing tables.
column79:
-	The up and down arrows move the cursor between rows
-	The Home key moves the cursor to the first cell in a row (CTRL moves to row 1 cell 1)
-	The End key moves the cursor to the last cell in a row (CTRL moves to bottom-right cell)

column1: Turn On/Off Rollup Table Tab
column29: As an Informedb designer, I would like to be able to disable the rollup table tab based on project/role/whatever so my users don’t misuse it.

column1: Insert Rows/Columns Anywhere in Table Editor
column29: As an Informedb data editor, I need to be able to insert rows or columns somewhere other than the end of the table.

column1: Uncheck Rows with Like Values Based on Column
column29:
As an Informedb data editor, I would like to hide a series of rollup table rows based on the value of cells in a particular column. Example: The column “APPN” has a dropdown with checkboxes for “RDTEN”, “WPN”, etc. Unchecking the checkbox for that value will also uncheck all rows that have that value for the “APPN” column

TBD: Is this configurable somehow? The mockups have only Name/APPN with this dropdown, not the numeric FY columns.

column1: Rename Summary Row and Column in Rollup Tables
column29: As an Informedb data editor, I need to be able to rename the bottom row and/or rightmost column in the rollup tables that represent grand totals so I can provide correct representation of the row in slides and display output.
column79:
-	The rollup table row and column configuration editor allows the user to rename the summary row and column.
-	The renamed summary row and column appropriately shows the new name when displaying a rollup table and exporting it to slides.

column1: Allow Designers to Lock Default Table Structure
column29: As an Informedb designer, I would like to be able to lock the table structure for a given Table attribute so that rows and columns cannot be removed or added for that attribute when editing objects.
column79:
-	A checkbox option in the default table editor is provided and labeled “Lock Rows and Columns”.
-	When the default table is saved and this option is checked, no user can add or remove rows and columns from the table for that attribute when editing objects.

column1: Does not allow filtering on avail name until something else is filtered first
column29:
The first issue is that in the OT Platform Avails, the filter isn’t working properly on the Avail Name. If she tries to filter on something for the Avail Name no items are filtered, however, when she filters on a different attribute and then tried to filter on Avail Name again, it works properly. 

Steps:

•	In CEC DB go to the Object List page for “Platform Avails” 
•	Filter on “Avail Name” attribute (You can filter on anything it won’t work) 
•	Filter on a different attribute in the column view (The filter will work for that attribute) 
•	Filter on “Avail Name” attribute (The filter will work now) 

We have had difficulty reproducing this. Dan has worked with Ryan in testing it. It may be related to a particular database.

column1: PToP Improvements from Real-world usage
column29:
1)	The changes to Edit Groups was confusing.  I’m not sure the algorithm, but many groups were duplicated and/or only had 1 attribute in it, where all the other like attributes were in another group, named the same thing.  This is low-pri… just strange.
2)	If the Original project has an XYZ String… and the Destination Project it was an XYZ Memo, the result after the merge will be two XYZ fields (one string and one memo). This is correct, but confusing to the user if this is the same data.  Not sure I know the answer, and I’m not sure its broken, but just an FYI.  (See #4)
3)	If the Original project has an XYZ Template for an ObjectType… and the Destination Project it was an XYZv2 as a template for the same ObjectType, the result after the merge will be two XYZ templates.  This is correct, but confusing to the user if this is the same data.  Not sure I know the answer, and I’m not sure its broken, but just an FYI.  (See #4)
4)	It would be best if there was a Update Log / Change Log that is exported for each PtoP use… on a PtoP Update, the user really has no idea what was updated.  It would also be cool if there was feedback as to similar named objects that are different attribute types.  

-Brad Neal

column1: Add "single select fixed" attributes to filter list
column29: Selector on left side, should work exactly like multi select
column79:
- If an object type is selected, each of its single select attributes are a top level group on the left
- All of the single select values are selectable as options under the grouping
- Selecting one of the single select values narrows the search results
-- Any types that have a single select attribute with that caption are only included if they have the selected value(s).
-- Any types that do not have a single select attribute with that caption are not affected by the filter.
- Selecting two or more of the single select values means that either of the attribute values constitutes a match for objects with either value (logical or)
- If two object types have a single select attribute with the same caption, all of the attributes are shown in the same top level group
- If two single select attribute values from different types have the same caption, it only appears once in the list
-- Selecting the option includes data from the attribute value of either type
- User interface to do all of the above

column1: when user attempts to add duplicate tags in an object, provide a more specific error message so they know what they are doing wrong
column29:
To reproduce
Open an object with a Tag attribute.  
Click edit and enter an ! or some other special character.  
Hit enter.  
Save. 
Now	click edit and try to enter another tag with the same special character value as you did before.
You should get a dialog with message "These field(s) have invalid values: '[Name of Tag]'! 

It would be really helpful if the msg could tell the user which tag(s) are invalid so they could remove the offending ones without guessing and guessing and guessing…in my case the actual error was that I was entering duplicates of tags I had already entered into my object.  The error message was no help.
column79:
Error messages when a user creates a tag (i.e.invalid tag, duplicate tag, etc.) ought to follow the following principles:
Human-readable language, instead of obscure codes or abbreviations such as "an error of type 2 has occurred."
Polite phrasing that doesn't blame users or imply that they are either stupid or doing something wrong, as in "illegal command."
Precise descriptions of exact problems, rather than vague generalities such as "syntax error."
Constructive advice on how to fix the problem. For example, instead of saying "out of stock," your error message should either tell users when the product will be available or provide a way for users to ask to be notified when the product is restocked.

column1: PtoP is considering all objects/object types/relationships as 'updated'
column29: PtoP is considering all objects/object types/relationships as 'updated', even when no data has changed. This causes unnecessary performance hit and changelog records to be added.

column1: Orphan Attribute Error
column29:
If user closes out of page, refreshes, clicks a link, after hitting 'delete' on an attribute, it can cause issues, like this. 
Takes more than a moment to delete an attribute (on my end) so should be a status indicator and lock the page.
column107: 06/Mar/17 10:32 AM;LeeWheless;i checked the delete operation and could not reproduce. all attributes get deleted with the column.
column108: 13/Mar/17 12:53 PM;DavidTuell;In the AdminAPI, the attribute reference is removed from the sections (groups) then from _AttributesTable prior to removal of the actual column from the object table. Therefore, the cause of this bug cannot be the cancellation of the request from the UI, since the latter action was executed and not the former. This means there was likely an erroneous reference somewhere.

On save, if object type changes, will wipe out previous config (previous type selected) and wipe out lav attribute values for this type. So if you change the object type on the lav attribute  'Current Company', it will wipe out current company values in object details. column1: List items in SingleSelect and MultiSelect need unique identifier
column29:
List items in SingleSelect and MultiSelect currently store null as an id, and use 'name' or index when comparing for updates/deletes. This is problematic because the name can be changed, and the order can be changed (causing the index to change in the list) making them both unreliable.

New functionality for changing captions or checking for added/deleted list items will have problems until a unique key is added to each list item.

Suggestions: hidden column in grid holding the ID is saved with the grid, and stored into the item value.

column1: Replace GetTempPath calls with WebApp subfolder
column29:
There are two places in the Informedb code that use the call GetTempPath to retrieve the executing user's temporary folder. One resides in PtoP Import, the other in PowerPoint generation code. This code is blocked by Windows at Medium Trust (NSERC) and will also be blocked by DoD endpoint HIPS (such as HBSS) either now or in the near future.

It is also best practice to never have a Web application modify the file system outside of its installed directory structure, regardless of security settings.
column79: - Both GetTempPath calls are replaced by code that operates within the Web app's installation directories.
column107: 21/Mar/17 3:33 PM;DavidTuell;For testing this item, verify that slide generation and PtoP Import still work as before. The only change was a temp file location change and won't be visible in the UI.

In my template is looks like:
What is he?: <# Description #>

The output should look like:
What is he?: PM

Instead, the output looks like:
PM
What is he?:

For memo fields, the value ("PM") is put above the text, not after.
All other types of fields it shows after the text, except memo fields.

column1: SlideGen: RelatedItemsGraph doesn't work in Medium Trust (NSERC)
column29:
The call to ConnectedNodesGraphRenderer.renderSimpleGraph in MRMWebMVC\ReportGenerators throws an exception that states "That assembly does not allow partially trusted callers". This prevents the use of the RelatedItemsGraph tag in slide templates. Any slide generation call will throw the error when the slide contains this tag. This only affects builds not running on Full Trust (NSERC)

Investigate why the call fails at Medium Trust and fix.
column79: #NAME?
column107:
24/Mar/17 3:52 PM;DavidTuell;Root cause of the issue is that the Svg.dll library from the NuGet package of the same name is not tagged with AllowPartiallyTrustedCallers, so it can only be invoked by applications running with Full Trust.

The package is open source, so this leaves two COAs for fixing the issue:
1) Pull Svg from GitHub, add the AllowPartiallyTrustedCallers tag, and build it from source.
2) Replace the Svg package with a similar capability that works under Medium Trust, then retrofit any web app code that uses it.

column1: Sub-type not updating on caption changes
column29: When the sub-types value changes in design it is not being updated in the viz. It says "Subtype not found. Re-save object's subtype." Re-saving the object does nothing.

column1: Ungrouped Right Side Attributes for PtoP
column29:
When using PtoP... from left to right...
If a user doesn't save the right side groups and pulls in a "saved group" from the left side, any new attributes on only the right side, get 'kicked out' of that group.
column107: 22/Mar/17 3:06 PM;DanielBiester;This might require a redesign on the way that 'default' grouping works. If the Edit Groups window is never saved for an object type, there is no group record for that object type, so on PtoP the right side only attribute will be bumped to no group on import.

column1: Select items retroactive IDs
column29: More issues coming through from single select/multiselect/ attribute types. Need to write SQL upgrade statement to remove all null item IDs and assign Guids
column107: 28/Mar/17 7:46 PM;DanielBiester;Still problematic are SubType options. Be mindful that reordering SubType might wipe all selected subtypes for that object type

column1: Color Caption on Object Details Page
column29: On the Object Details Page, the status color caption is not centered, its at the bottom of the color, not in the middle.  Put it in the middle... like it looks on the object list page.

column1: Investigate why Export Project doesnt work for only these two projects
column29:
This is LOW PRI:
Export failed for project "Britt's Test Project" on beta. 
Export failed on "Ryan Beta Test" on beta.
But works on all/many others just fine.
column107:
28/Mar/17 5:39 PM;DavidTuell;For some strange reason, the stored procedure "_spGetAttachmentbyID" had a space before the name in those two databases only. Manual rename of the stored proc fixed those two DBs.

I double-checked the upgrade script and it's correct in there.
column108: 28/Mar/17 7:47 PM;DanielBiester;Dave, this was an issue Pete and I came across recently and had fixed in the project creation scripts. Might be same on some other projects but I think the issue was not around for long.

THIS IS HIGH PRI:
If you LAV a date, it should look like a DATE (without the 12:00:00 AM timestamp)

column1: Retroactively fix default node colors

1) Connect the Dots project on Alpha now shows grey as the default for most object types.
2) A new object type on ANY project gets grey as a default and not blue.
3) Objects with the default color show up correctly in RelatedItemsGraph on PPT.

column1: Deny a ObjectType in StoryThread and All objects in that ST Dissappear
column29: If a rule is created to DENY a user from seeing OT1 objects... When you go into a Story Thread with OT1, OT2, OT3, OTn objects... All of the OTs and their objects are removed, not just for OT1.

column1: Power point templates are not displayed properly.
column29: When a user tries to select a PPT Template for an object to create a PPT... there is no scroll bar for PPT templates, if there are more than like 3... it never shows up and the window is very ugly.  Need to clean up.

column1: SubType Select Proper ID
column29:
SQL code to retroactively add IDs to Single select, multi select, SubType, and Status Color fields is working, however SubTypes need to be given the ID of the SubType from the _ObjectTypesTable and not a NewID. 

Disconnected IDs cause selected SubTypes in objects to be wiped when reordering/renaming SubTypes in subtype attribute config
column107: 05/Apr/17 2:49 PM;BrittanyMcCray;I'm getting an internal server error when I try to update the subtypes for Drivers in project 9LCS2.2. I have tried several other OTs without an issue so it may be bad data.
column108: 05/Apr/17 8:13 PM;DanielBiester;The description for one of the SubTypes had a comma in it which messed with the upgrade script to add IDs. Is this something that can happen elsewhere or was it bad data?

column1: LAV Name in Italics needs to be Caption
column29:
This is LOW PRI:
When editing a LAV attribute in an object the LAV window displays the attributes selected in design at the top under the title. This is using the name and not caption for the attribute... the name is in italics.

column1: Design schema for defining rollup tables/objects
Kendo UI Evaluation/Prototyping
column29:
Evaluate Kendo tables as a starting point for constructing a new table UI. Points to consider:
* Data format/rework of existing data model required
* Server-side vs. client-side data processing
* Ease of style customization
* Ease of functionality extensions
* Compatibility with TypeScript/React/future front-end stack
* Does it work in Medium Trust (NSERC)?
* Any additional licensing costs?
* Objective: Good candidate for replacing SlickGrid?
column79:
- Team decision for go/no-go for using Kendo UI tables based on evaluation criteria in description.
- Attach any edited/compiled research notes to parent (INF-68)
- If no-go, add subtasks for evaluating other libraries or prototyping our own UI solution.

column1: Long time to deleting attributes
column29: Why does it take about 2 seconds to create an attribute, but 2 minutes to delete one?

column29: Search is not working properly; no results are being shown. This even occurs after clicking the solr button. I cannot get any results.

Can we run through the code path and see what this is supposed to be doing?

column1: Hex in “Related Items as a Table”
column29:
Hex Value is exported for Status Color when generating a template with the “Related Items as a Table” option. 

To recreate, go to Alpha... to "Ryan Alpha Test 2" Project... go to "Test All Types Default View" Object Type... click the "Test Object 1" object... run the template attached called "Bugtest1.pptx".

column1: Wrap up edge cases with replacing SubType IDs
column29: Few edge cases that cause issues with replacing SubType IDs
column107:
06/Apr/17 2:08 PM;DanielBiester;Few comments on what I found:

After Brittany found the issue with listData not saving, I found that the cause was commas existing in SubType properties. This was fixed on the upgrade script so that it does not happen again, and I subsequently went through all projects that also had that issue and fixed them manually. 

Next issue found was with '&' characters being encoded in the json string, but not accounting for that when using the name property to find the SubType Id. This was fixed, and I am looking for other possible characters that may cause issues similar.

9MMP14 has a few issues.
- XML listData for SubTypes. These will not be able to assign IDs, and so will not update the caption across objects if updated.
- MTB6 and MTB4 both have attribute data but neither object type exists anymore.
column108: 06/Apr/17 3:08 PM;DanielBiester;All projects on app2008 and Alpha should be OK now.

column1: Bulk Import Attachment
column29:
When a user tries to import using BULK IMPORT... and there is an attachment in the taxonomy, the import fails and you get this error:

Failed to import data into new Object Type 'ef830f4e-9a3a-4a94-8000-dddf3de915c1' due to :'Failed to delete temporary object used to validate bulk import data integrity due to exception 'Value cannot be null.
Parameter name: value''
column107: 07/Apr/17 10:42 AM;BradNeal;FYI, attachments, tables and images are purposely removed from the export taxonomy and aren't needed for bulk import (but are causing issues :-))
column108:
07/Apr/17 11:52 AM;DavidTuell;Root cause was null value being passed to function that checks for attachments on deleted objects. Modified that function to account for it.

When testing this bug, regression test deletion of objects that have Attachment and Image attributes. This functionality was also affected by this fix.

column1: Story Thread names as an attribute of an Object Type in an object is null
column29: For an ObjectType... If I add "Thread" as the Name... and "Story Thread" as the caption... and "MultiSelect" as the Attribute Type... and then go to an object in that type... and try to add that object to a story thread in the list, all of the story Threads in that list are NULL.  The software seems to be working (adding to thread(s)), but it shows Null names of Story Threads.

Linking objects from the Object List page 
Linking objects from the Object Details page 
Adding objects to a story thread 

.      Linking objects from the Object List page 
a.      Navigate to the Object List page 
b.      Check multiple objects 
c.      Click the “Actions” button 
d.      Click the “Linked Checked Object(s) to Object” button 
e.      Enter a word with an apostrophe 
f.       Get the error as soon as the apostrophe is typed. (We double checked all other special characters) 
2.      Linking objects from the Object Details page 
a.      Navigate to the Object List page 
b.      Click on an object link 
c.      Click the “Actions” button 
d.      Click “Add Related…” 
e.      Enter a word with an apostrophe 
f.       Get the error as soon as the apostrophe is typed. (We double checked all other special characters)
3.      Adding objects to a story thread 
a.      Navigate to the Story Threads page

column1: Export Rollup Tables to Slides
column29:
As an Informedb user, I need to be able to display one or more of an object’s rollup tables in a slide template.

- Reuse our current table code
- Add a new template keyword for putting an object's rollup tables
- Each rollup table is added as a separate table.

Assumption: The output in the slide does not need to look like the display in the web page. It is acceptable for it to look similar or the same as the existing tables.
Assumption: We will put every summary table onto a slide. It is optimized for the case of a single summary table to meet the customer's main use case.
column79:
-	A tag structure for declaring a rollup table by index (number) is included in the available tags for slide generation templates.
-	Slide generation code for tables supports the rollup table data format.
column107:
23/May/17 7:13 PM;MatthewDavis;The template tag is:
<# Rollup::<positive number> #>
where Rollup can be any mix of case, and <positive number> is a number from 1 to n, where n is the highest rollup table number, i.e. if there are 10 rollup tables, n = 10.

Delta Row breaks when adding/removing columns
column29:
Adding or removing a column after adding a delta row causes the delta row to break.

When adding a new column -> The new column does not have the delta row.
When removing a column -> Any delta rows that have not been calculated (no values in cells above) will no longer work. In addition, delta cells in the removed column remain in place.

column1: Correctly implement 'Visible Columns' and 'Visible Rows' in calculation
Circular LAV Attributes can cause problems
column29:
I figured out the problem.  Currently you can’t LAV from ObjectType1/Object1 to ObjectType2/Object2… and have another LAV from OT2/Ob2 to OT1/Ob1.  That circular reference is breaking LAV.  We believe this could be an easy fix (hopefully).  

In your LCS example, you have SCDs LAV’ing to AVAIL, and an AVAIL LAVing to SCDs… specifically, 16865 LAVs to LCS 0003 SRA(d) FY17-1… and you also LAV LCS 0003 SRA(d) FY17-1 to 16865 in another LAV attribute.  That’s a no-no right now.  

In LCS 0003 SRA(d) FY17-1 object, as soon as I unchecked the 16865 from that objects LAV, it worked on both sides.  

So you are LAV’ing objects with reference to both in both directions…  

- Brad / Alison
column107:
22/May/17 8:58 AM;PeteSchatz;On strategy we might try is to short cycle the infinite loop

IF ((SELECT TRIGGER_NESTLEVEL()) > 1 )
RETURN

Consider picking a reasonable nest level allowed if it will allow us to have circular references
SELECT @@NESTLEVEL AS 'Inner Level';
limit inner level nesting to 2 (or 3 for stored procs?)
column108: 22/May/17 9:10 AM;BradNeal;Does this fix the problem... or does this stop the Save problem from happening?
column109: 22/May/17 9:47 AM;PeteSchatz;We will have to dig deeper to see if we will be able to continue allow circular lav attributes without the save problem occurring.
column110: 22/May/17 9:50 AM;BradNeal;There are two issues... The problem LAVing between two objects needs to be fixed ASAP.  The problem LAVing between two LAV attributes together... I don't care about (right now).

column1: RBAC issues with deleting Object Types
column29:
When an Object Type has rules and the Object Type is deleted, the rule for that object type defaults to the first Object Type in the list. This causes duplicate rules which is not allowed to save rules. The user has to find which rules are duplicated and have to delete them before the user is able to edit any rules and save.

column107: 02/Aug/17 11:34 AM;MatthewDavis;Do we wish to delete the rules for the user, or do we wish to inform the user that rules still exist for an object type and have the user delete them before they can delete an object type?
column108:
02/Aug/17 12:04 PM;DanielBiester;The rule should be deleted, since the object type no longer exists.

dbo.Rules - > Data 
Contains the rule set in json format. If an object type is deleted, should delete from this table by way of 
Data LIKE '%<OT-Guid>%'

And again for Attribute deletes
Data LIKE '%"AttributeID":<AttID>%'

To add to object type and attribute delete triggers.

column1: Make enableLaunch a @computed based on deep-comparing original & modified filters
column29:
the current code in FilterListView.tsx that sets and clears the enableLaunch flag is fragile & dependent on order of evaluations.

Saving the last server-fetched version of the filter and deep-comparing it to the mutated version to derive the flag is more a functional-programming-style approach, which MobX works well with.

column1: Default Click Object should be Show Neighbors
column29: When a user is in the VIZ, the default response of the tool when a user clicks on a node (once or double-clicks) should be "Show Neighbors".  Currently if a user clicks on the node the view details change, but the picture stays the same.  The theory being, if a user clicks once on that node, they want to see what its connected to it... and ghosting the other 40 nodes on the screen its not connected to.  If a user would like to see all of the nodes, they click off of the node somewhere.  This should work for all views.

column1: Default Edge Color in VIZ 85% Transparent
column29: As a user, when I look at all of the nodes and edges loaded, the edges don't need to be that 'powerful' black... they overwhelm the node location and information on them.  Please keep the default line color black but change the default transparency to 85% (instead of 0%).  MattW and I (Brad) have done some preliminary testing and think this value is the best.  Black with 85% transparency allows the users to use the "Show Neighbors" feature to its fullest... allowing the user to see the black lines pop-out... and the others are ghosted.  This should be the default value when first using a new data-set... but can be changed as any normal user could.

column1: Change password text does not match actual requirements.
column29:
Noticed in sprint review on 8/16/2017 by Kasey Hill.

On the user's profile page, it states:

Passwords must contain characters from all four of the following categories: 1. Uppercase characters (A through Z)
2. Lowercase characters (a through z)
3. Base 10 digits (0 through 9)
4. Nonalphanumeric characters: ~!#$%^&*_-+=`|\(){}[]:;"'<>,.?/
5. Minimum 8 characters.

However, when you change your password, it only enforces one of those (and gives the correct accompanying text of only enforcing 1).

column1: Show users when they hit the password lock out and try and log in
column29:
When a user is locked out, they have know way of knowing it. It shows the same "Could not authenticate" message as a failed password, which would erroneously give them the impression that they just forgot their password. Since account locking requires external user action to resolve, they need to know that they should take such action.

Note: to get locked out, you have to hit a certain number of retries within a certain number of seconds, as specified in the web.config

2) A user updates the caption or description of the attachment

column1: Updating a LAV attribute in the edit dialog will keep modified values even if you hit "x"
column29:
Steps to reproduce:
- Edit an object with a lav attribute
- Click pencil
- Check an item
- (Notice the lav attribute is updated in the background)
- Hit "x"
- Lav attribute is updated even though you hit "x".

Usually "X" has a "cancel" connotation; as a modal this feels incongruent with expected behavior.

Impact of this is low because it doesn't save it in the database; changes will not be persisted if you cancel out of edit mode.

Suggested resolution: Make the dialog much smaller; more of a popup (like the multi select values).

column1: Only blank out numerical values in the Edit Contributors Dialog
column29:
Without the string values (such as those identifying the row name), it is VERY hard to identify what row you want to be visible or not.

As such, we should only blank out numerical values (e.g., those that would be summed and would look out of place due to the computation performed on them)

column1: When an object is deleted, any referenced rollup data should be deleted (contributor/table)
column29:
On delete of an object, any rollup tables for that object should be deleted from the database. Any contributors referencing that object should also be deleted.

Middle layer might be easier, as we already have a dynamic trigger for LAV on object tables. On pure sql solution would be to set triggers for MTB tables on table creation, and include both LAV and Rollup related trigger functions.

column1: Edit contributors dialog: search result count not correct if contributors are in the list
column29:
If you search for something that includes an item from the contributor list, the contributor will be included in the count. So if there are 15 items that match and 1 of them is a contributor, there will be 14 items in the search result list and the count at the top of the search result list will be 15.

If they move a contributor over from the search results, the number is also wrong.

The count looks very nice but my recommendation is to just change it to "Found Tables".

column1: When editing, adding a contributor after a delta row checks the top row of the new contributor by default.
column29:
If the user is editing a roll up table and adds a contributor under a delta row, the top row of the new contributor is checked by default. This functionality can be seen following these steps. 
1. Navigate to the Rollup Tables for "Ryan Scranton 1" in the "Employees" Object Type in the "Rollup_Test_01" project. 
2. Click the "Actions" button for "Test Rollup 1" 
3. Click the "Configure" button 
4. Select "Bonus" from the "Brittany" object as a contributor. 
5. Make sure the "Bonus" from "Brittany" is below "Bonus" from "Ryan Scranton 1" 
6. Click the "Next" button 
7. See that the first column for the "Bonus" from the "Brittany" object is selected.

column1: Simplify Enterprise Manager Rules
column29:
As part of the NICE TO HAVES… we need to upgrade our intelligence on how we make rules in our tool.  Currently Kasey’s project has 50 object types…. And that project has 20 groups… each group she is required to deny people the majority of the object types… so she has to create 50 rules for each group to deny objecttypes.  That is a lot of clicking and unnecessary time.  It would be optimal to be able to “select all” objectttypes that require deny and be done with that one rule… not 50 rules to deny all the object types.  

-Brad Neal

column1: PtoP wiping 'Story Thread' attribute selections
column29:
If the special 'Thread' - 'Story Thread' attribute is present in an object type, the selections will be wiped (and in turn, removing the objects from the story thread) when performing a Ptop import.

This is caused because the attribute does not store any data in the mtb table, instead it pulls the story threads connected on Object load. This does not happen during PtoP.

This is to improve the EDX code so that the Caption is showing as the value in the spreadsheet, and the user can update the status by using the caption instead of the hex.

column1: PtoP - Export/Import Change Log
column29:
As a user who runs PtoP to update a target project, I want the change log on the right side to get updated to include the left side changes for all objects that are PtoPed over.

Multiple PtoP transfers will not make duplicate entries in the target log

We will disable log upon save of each imported object so that it does not add change entries twice

Constraints: 
  we will always export all rows (not just a time range) since this is simple
  we will always export, not allow config option to skip log export/import
  we will not scrub the change log to remove deleted items or story threads from the history

Developer's Notes:
  - Export in chunks so we can handle any size without memory errors
  - Need to add new dataApi to save a change log item
  - Need to add flag to bypass logging into new dataApi

column1: Project Import Status Page
column29: As a project designer, I would like to be able to see the status of a long running project import operation while it is in progress.
column79:
- When an import operation is invoked, the user that started it immediately receives a notification providing a link to a status page.
- The status page will contain, at a minimum, the various stages of project import with a status of Not Started, In Progress, Failed, or Succeeded. (In Progress with a percent complete is an objective requirement)
- The status indicators should use color to make them stand out (exact colors and iconography/words to be decided by developer(s) )
- The stages of project import include one for file parsing, one for schema, one for each object type, and one for each link type (does attachments make sense as a stage?)

column1: Project Export Status Page
column29: As a project designer, I would like to be able to see the status of a long running project export operation while it is in progress.
column79:
- When an export operation is invoked, the user that started it immediately receives a notification providing a link to a status page.
- The status page will contain, at a minimum, the various stages of project export with a status of Not Started, In Progress, Failed, or Succeeded. (In Progress with a percent complete is an objective requirement)
- The status indicators should use color to make them stand out (exact colors and iconography/words to be decided by developer(s) )
- The stages of project export include one for schema, one for each object type, and one for each link type (does attachments make sense as a stage?)

column29: As a project designer, I would like to see a report of exactly what will change before commencing a project import.

column1: Create automated links of relationships as tags
column29: SimVentions will design and deploy software enhancements that create automated links of relationships as tags in the data entry form for easy export and sort. As part of this task, SimVentions will create new functionality that will enable a user to update link data within the online WebApp as if they are updating the objects attributes; currently updating attributes and updating links are separate processes. SimVentions will keep the old process in place to update the links for each object, but also add this new capability built with the edit attribute section.

column1: Duplicate and Edit Cannot Save With No Story Threads
Excel Wizard to import including links
column29:
I need to create a ROM for a customer who is interested in importing spreadsheet outputs from DOORS into Informedb.  The basics of this task are:

Informedb must import a spreadsheet with multiple rows and columns containing different objects with their attributes; one column (Column A) are the parent objects (AAA), and the other column(s) are either attributes (Column B & Column C) or children objects (Column D).  
               Column A: AAAObject1, AAAObject2, AAAObject3
               Column B:  AAAAtribute11, AAAAtribute22, AAAAtribute33
               Column C: AAAAtribute55, AAAAtribute66, AAAAtribute77
               Column D: BBBObject5, BBBObject6, AAAObject7

Informedb must be able to link objects of the same ObjectType (AAA) and between different ObjectTypes (BBB): column D.  

Informedb must have a Wizard that allows the user to select which columns are the parent objects (Column A), which columns are the children objects (Column D)… and all other columns would be attributes of parent object(s) (Column (B & C).

column1: Spreadsheet Modal: Ctrl-c / ctrl-v clears a cell
column29:
Reported by Ryan Scranton.

Copy/Paste using CTRL-C/CTRL-V should not clear out the cell. If a user clicks on a cell and Clicks CTRL C to copy the cell is cleared. If the user clicks on a cell to past and type CTRL V to paste the cell is cleared.
column79: #NAME?
column107:
03/Dec/19 9:17 AM;ScottSummerford;Copy / Paste wasn't implemented. What's most likely happening is that you're pressing control + C to edit, the modal recognizes "C" as a key to enter edit mode, but you enter edit mode with the prior key cntrl pressed first, which doesn't put anything in the text field.

That behavior may also be why cntrl + v sometimes works properly.
column108: 11/Dec/19 10:36 AM;PeterMorrissey;This has been fixed in branch INF-3566_No_Edit_Ctrl

column1: Excel Reports: Macro file doesn't show new file name if uploaded a 2nd time
column29:
Currently, if you download a macro file, rename it, and then upload, the original macro file name is still displayed.

Moving forward, if the user changes the name of the file, even if all the macros are the same, the UI ought to reflect the name change.
column79:
Given that Don, a user, is editing a report
When Don downloads a macro file
And renames it on his local hard drive with a new, valid filename 
And makes no other changes to the file
And uploads it to the report
Then the name of the macro is updated on the report to reflect the new name

column1: Design and define new Informedb page layout
column29: Layout 2.0 ought to specify what the site looks like within a browser including security markings, nav bar, headers, sidebars and content areas.  Spacing, colors, typography and common icons all ought to be specified.  Show examples of the site at different screen sizes so developers can see what parts of the layout are fixed and which collapse and expand.
column79:
Show what site looks like at the following resolutions:
- 1366x768
- 1920x1080
Indicate which parts of the site are fixed and which expand / collapse or are hidden when resizing.

Show which parts of the site layout make use of scrollbars.

Define and indicate where font styles and icons are used for top level, common elements (i.e. page headers, project title, nav bar actions, etc.)

Describe or demonstrate what happens when opening / closing each sidebar including any animations / motion.

column1: Help page - Unit cards are not clickable
column29: On the help page, when mousing over a unit card (i.e. Unit 1: Introduction to Web Application) the mouse changes to the pointer indicating the card is a link, but the link only works when clicking on the actual text or the image.  Anywhere else in the card is not clickable.  If the user clicks an unlinked spot one or more times they may come to the conclusion that the unit is not available and become frustrated.

column1: Create a website to house the design system
column29:
Create a website to be a repository for design system standards, styles and working examples.  Some examples of this kind of site include Kendo's UI demo site, Google's Material Design site, and Trello's Nachos design system site.  The US Website Standards is also a style guide / design system example.

Developers and designers should be able to access the design system for information like:

When do I use a pop-up versus a tooltip?

What is the left and right spacing on a command button?

What do I use to alert the user before they take a destructive action (like deleting a project)?

What font do I use for the Page command bar?

How do I make my links accessible (508 compliant)?
column79:
- Creating the site that displays the capability (at least 2 pages)
- A build command in source control that creates the design system website.
- A way to build and deploy the design system website to the server host tram setup (e.g., from Jenkins).
column107: 19/Mar/18 10:09 AM;JohnSieck;Passed test.  It doesn't have two pages but it demonstrates a page.  The second page will likely be created when Joseph shows Brittany and I how to create content on the site.  I don't think that task should hold up this story as the groundwork has been laid and that satisfies the intent in my mind.
